name: Full Sail Wassail
review: Old ass bottle. Poured a brownish color with a medium sized off white head. Toasted malts, earthy, and definitely showing its age.

name: Full Sail Wassail
review: nutty toasty aroma. Flavor is resin, vanilla, and clove. Palate is medium bodied with moderate hop bitterness. Smooth and easy drinking, could be a session brew. Slight raisin in the finish. Reminds me of Magic hat #9 slightly in memory. I bought a sixer and was willing to take my meds if this wasn't good, but it turned out pretty solid. Nice brew.

name: Full Sail Wassail
review: Pours garnet light brown. Sweet cookie aroma, toffee. Sweeter beer with tons of cookie dough malt flavor. A little cocoa. Oily and sappy. Finish is also sweet and big malts. Some raisins. Enjoyable and tasty!

name: Full Sail Wassail
review: 0.355l bottle thanks to Cristobal37. Dark copper body with a thin white head. Huge biscuit notes in the aroma with some spicy hops, caramel, nutmeg and raisins. Taste of toast, caramel, raisins, orange zest, spicy hops and gingerbread cookie. Nice one.

name: Full Sail Wassail
review: 12 oz bottle into a La Chouffe stemmed tulip glass on 8th Jan 2018, while on holiday in California. Dark mahogany body, beige crown on top. Malts to the fore here, in both the nose and taste, sweet malty molasses with caramel and light coffee flavours blend together nicely before a mild hop finish. My sweet tooth really took to it.

name: Full Sail Wassail
review: Bottle in Seattle. Dark amber brown, mostly clear, small head. Nice roasty malt aroma, solid English character. Dark ale sip, nicely metallic and slightly burnt malt. Cool character distracts some, I'd love this a little fuller bodied. Amber bitterness. Quite nice.

name: Full Sail Wassail
review: Bottle from World Market in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is caramel, spiced plums. Taste is creamy caramel, fruity malts with a bitter, spiced woods-y finish. Excellent NW winter warmer.

name: Full Sail Wassail
review: Bottle. Clear deep amber color, thick tan head with good retention and lacing. Aroma of burnt caramel. Taste is earthy toasted caramel. Warming.

name: Full Sail Wassail
review: Shared 12 oz. bottle. Pours a clear dark amber with a beige head. Malt and spice on the nose. Taste is quite malty, with sweet caramel and holiday spices.

name: Full Sail Wassail
review: Aroma: sweet and malty; Appearance: dark amber with thin white head that dissipates slowly; Taste: follows nose with dry, strong notes; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: almost too sweet but underlying dryness saves it; will probably not get again, however.

name: Full Sail ESB (Extra Special Bitter)
review: A little old perhaps, couldn�t tell the date. Aroma is a little dusty, but the flavor was solid. Nutty, earthy with light caramel toast and fruit.

name: Full Sail ESB (Extra Special Bitter)
review: Dark bronze, clear with yellow foam. Raisins, toffee in the aroma. Sweet, toffee, fruit with strong metalic bitterness in the aftertaste and a hint of alcohol.

name: Full Sail ESB (Extra Special Bitter)
review: Clear bright penny copper with a thin foamy white top. Big lovely toffee pale english malt on the aroma with a slight grassiness. Smooth and slightly bitter flavor, perhaps the most bitter ESB I�ve had in a while (not that bitter overall but probably similar to how true Brits taste ESBs back in the day) with quite a bit of grassy hop flavor, English Marris otter pale malt biscuitiness, and a smoot nutty finish with a quiet grassy bitterness on the aftertaste.

name: Full Sail ESB (Extra Special Bitter)
review: 12 oz bottle. Pours a deep dark orange color, some off-white head, not much lacing. Aroma is caramel malt and faint floral hops. Flavor is crisp and bitter, with a malty aftertaste. The palate feels thick and chewy. Look out, this one packs a wallop.

name: Full Sail ESB (Extra Special Bitter)
review: Poured from 12 oz bottle into pint glass. Appearance: pours a 1" off white head that falls quickly with just a hint of lacing. Color is mostly clear copper with mild streaming carbonation. Aroma: malt dominate -- bread dough and a bit of toffee. Hops are floral with a little citrus rind as well. Mouthfeel: light to medium bodied with a fluffy ale mouthfeel. Finish is dry and somewhat boozy. Flavor: toasted bread, toffee, raisin and other ripe fruit. WIth a lingering floral, citrus rind, and even a bit of pine hops. Overall: a very good and enjoyable ESB -- although the 6.5% is a little high as the BJCP guidelines top out at 6.2% -- thus the beer is a little too boozy and would be limited for sessionability.

name: Full Sail ESB (Extra Special Bitter)
review: Bottle. Amber-brown beer with a tan head. Caramel and light citrus aroma. Caramel and citrus flavor with light woodsiness. Medium bodied. Caramel and citrus lingers with light earth and light toffee.

name: Full Sail ESB (Extra Special Bitter)
review: Pours a clear coppery color with off-white head. Caramel malts, toffee, and some spice on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium bodied. Finishes with more caramel and toffee flavors, with the sweetness balanced out with just a bit of bitterness.

name: Full Sail ESB (Extra Special Bitter)
review: Pours clear deep amber with a thin, rapidly diminishing beige head. Aromas of toast, caramel, earth, grass, with the barest hint of banana and a light floral note. Medium-light body, moderate carbonation. Lightly sweet, medium bitter with a lasting nutty, almost astringent dry finish.

name: Full Sail ESB (Extra Special Bitter)
review: Bottle. Head is initially average sized, frothy, off-white, mostly diminishing. Body is medium to dark amber. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (cookie, caramel, biscuit), lightly to moderately hoppy (apricot, flowers), lightly yeasty (dough), with notes of toffee and black tea. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter. Medium body, watery/velvety/syrupy texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic. My second sampling of this and happily it�s as good as my first impression...it looks like someone actually put some effort into this one, which is becoming rarer and rarer at Full Sail sadly. It�s enticingly cookie-ish and apricotty, and while it starts sweet (in a nice lip-smackin� way), there�s quite a bit of apparent bitterness in the finish (only 35 IBU, really?), so it�s quite delightful to drink.

name: Full Sail ESB (Extra Special Bitter)
review: Bottle from Fred Meyer. Clear pure amber in color. Lightly sweet earthy hop nose. Clean earthy hop flavors. A good spicy bitter hop finish. Fairly rich malty flavor with some good earthy hop notes.

name: Full Sail Pilsner (-2006)
review: Full Sail Brewing Company--Pilsner--2000 12 oz. Bottle. 5.40% ABV. (4.25 / 5.0) Pilsner--Clear light bright golden color. Floral Saaz nose with enticing delicate bouquet. Crisp clean rich malty body has floral light lager fruit underpinning. Light clean ctrus hop end. Light lacy head. Sampled 6/10/2000. Full Sail Brewing Company--Pilsner--Summer Seasonal--2001. 12 oz. Bottle. 5.40% ABV. (4.5 / 5.0) Clear rich bright golden color. Light malt hints enliven rich easy smooth Saaz floral hop front. Crisp smooth malty light caramel fruit body. Mild dry sweetness. Balanced dry sweet spicy hop end. Lacy head. Sampled 5/29/2001.

name: Full Sail Pilsner (-2006)
review: Date: 10/15/1996 Source: Brewpub clean yellow, thin head, mild hop aroma, clean crisp hop flavor with just the right amount of sweetness, light bitter finish Aroma: 4/10; Appearance: 4/10; Flavor: 2/10; Palate: 2/10; Overall: 5/20 Rating: 1.4/5.0 Score: */4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Full Sail Pilsner (-2006)
review: Golden with minimal head. Aroma is malt with light earth. Flavour has a nice maltiness with noticeable saaz on the finish. Clean trhouout. Nice well made pilsner.

name: Full Sail Pilsner (-2006)
review: Tap at Hood River brewery. Light to medium golden in color, clear. Very attractive white fluffy head forms and fades a bit too quickly. No lacing. Aroma is nicely hopped moderately spicey/earthy. Light toasted malt. Really rather full bodied, full mouthfeel yet lively and crisp. Long bitterness throughout. Tasty pilsner, underrated.

name: Full Sail Pilsner (-2006)
review: 5.23.03 12oz bottle. Pale golden yellow and a medium white head that fizzes away. I don�t get what makes this a pilsener other than the label; it seems like a regular High Life on steroids. Grass seed, lemon, wonder bread.

name: Full Sail Pilsner (-2006)
review: On tap at the full sail brewery. Pours a golden yellow with a small white head. Very smooth flavor with a grassy quality to it and some nice simple light malts. Slight fruitiness to the aroma and taste but very faint, quite a nice easy drinking summer brew.

name: Full Sail Pilsner (-2006)
review: light gold color, light fizzy head. Crisp fruity aroma, light malt but not much. The flavor is well balanced for a pils and drinks surprisingly well. I really like this one. It's well built which is hard to find these days in this style but still lacking like most in this style.

name: Full Sail Pilsner (-2006)
review: Deep amber, orange color with a slim white head. Decent aroma. Some malt and a hint of wheat, but that's about it. Fairly smooth taste and kind of watered down. A fairly average Pils. Nothing really to write home about.

name: Full Sail Pilsner (-2006)
review: Sampled at the brewery. Light clear yellow. Good lemon and wheaty aroma with a sizable malt presence. Fresh and light, while still frothy makes a good pilsner, one of my favorites.

name: Full Sail Pilsner (-2006)
review: Clear and golden with a big white head. Lightly carbonated, clean and light on the tongue. Bready and somewhat grainy malts. Floral, earthy and slightly bitter hops. Dry finish. Well made.

name: Full Sail Old Boardhead Barleywine
review: From Nov 2007 his is the 2006 vintage and I got it in a trade with Wasatch. Thanks John! This pours from 22oz bottle a cloudy orange amber with a small head of foam with some lacing. Not much foam to shrink down to but there's still a fine layer as I near the end of my session. The smell has notes of caramel malt, hops, and some spice. The taste at first sip is hugely malty. Lots of nice caramel flavour permeate my every taste bud. Next sip brings the hoppy goodness with notes of floral hops and some grapefruit and some nice fruity tones both dark and not so dark.(plum and apricot) And boy are they working well together as in, this puppy is really well balanced! You love hoppy brews, this one is for you. You love malty brews, ditto. It has a medium bordering on full mouthfeel and it's lightly carbonated. It finishes slightly bitter but there's still a good malt presence there as well. And I'm sipping on it straight from the fridge! Time to set it aside and let it warm up a bit, methinks. (about a half hour later) As it warmed up, all the flavours became more intense but I still find it very drinkable. Very nice BWSA and one I'd drink again with no qualms.

name: Full Sail Old Boardhead Barleywine
review: Originally rated on 1/26/09. i liked this barley wine because of the balance. It had enough hops to give it a decent aroma and some complexity to the taste, but enough sweet malts to compliment. Neither one was overwhelming or overbearing. Alcohol was well hidden and it had a good mouthfeel, not too thick or thin. Overall i Thought it was pretty good, and i would try it again

name: Full Sail Old Boardhead Barleywine
review: Over carbonated. Malty. A little barrel. Lots of barrel nose. Sweet and over carbonated. Meh ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Full Sail Old Boardhead Barleywine
review: 2007 vintage poured from a keg at a 2014 event. Has a mellow syrupy aroma. Pours a copper color with a ginormous head. A nice mellowed out barleywine...the years have definitely influenced it. Notes from the �14 Denver Rare Beer Tasting

name: Full Sail Old Boardhead Barleywine
review: Really nice, aged well. Dry, not too heavy. Slight medicinal aftertaste. Hides the booze well.

name: Full Sail Old Boardhead Barleywine
review: 22 oz bottle of 2011 Reserve served in a Belgian snifter. The hazy brown body is topped by a thin weak head that leaves minimal lacing. Fruity appealing aroma with some biscuit and remarkably little evidence of alcohol. There�s little sign of the alcohol upon tasting either ... at first; but eventually the alcohol builds and the finish and aftertaste are actually rather boozy. While the boozy finish detracts from the flavor it is overall good enough, and complex enough, to deserve a 8. More hops than expected for this style. Feel: light carbonation in a medium-light body with obvious alcohol warming.

name: Full Sail Old Boardhead Barleywine
review: Bottle shared by alexsdad06 vintage 2007 pour dark amber copper with moderate tan head. Nose toffee, raisin, sweet malt, and maybe hint of oxidation. Taste up front sweeter flavors with raisin, plum, toffee. Mid palate moderate bitterness still. Hint of spicy pepper. Drinks pretty nice for 8 year old beer.

name: Full Sail Old Boardhead Barleywine
review: Deep dive into the rotter for this 2009 reserve barley wine gold ale. Rich toffee. Raisin rum cake. Musty sherry. Oxidized grape drank. Bit of sharp coffee medicine. Better than expected given what was in front of me. Rotted just fine.

name: Full Sail Old Boardhead Barleywine
review: Bottle. 2010 vintage. A: Dark brown with red highlights. Creme colored head. Lacing. N: Toffee, leather, earth, tobacco, some oxidation, grass. Dry autumn leaves. T: Quite bitter, light sweetness. M: Medium body, touch of alcohol, drying, soft carbonation. O: Throwback barleywine. Not unrestrained but not my cup of tea, either.

name: Full Sail Old Boardhead Barleywine
review: From a 22 oz bottle shared at home. Vintage 2012. Pours slightly hazy copper with an ecru head. Aroma of raisins and booze. Flavors of caramel and bitter citrus. Bitter finish.

name: Full Sail Main Sail Stout
review: Date: 10/15/1996 Source: Brewpub Appearance: black, thin tan head, Aroma: roasted malt aroma, Flavor: very smooth flavor with dry character and a roasted malt finish, very guinness like Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Full Sail Main Sail Stout
review: Should be listed as a dry stout. Hard to discern aroma (at brewery). Pours a clear very dark brown with a large creamy head. Comes off very smooth with incredible malt support from a style that rarley has such a thing. Taste and finish is dominated by roasted/burnt flavors, I'm guessing from chocolate malts (?). Certainly not the best beer from Full Sail (we all know what THAT one is!) but quite unique within its style.

name: Full Sail Main Sail Stout
review: This is one of the Full Sail products tjhat suffered badly since they had their malting troubles in 97. My figures are pre 97 for the original.

name: Full Sail Main Sail Stout
review: A good stout, more or less a beginners stout. Decent nose and a fine finish. Quite drinkable, especially if your not into the Imperials or Guinness.

name: Full Sail Mercator Doppelbock
review: Full Sail Brewing Company--Mercator Doppelbock--Reserve 1999 12 oz. Bottle. 7.80% ABV--26 IBU�s. (4.0 / 5.0) Doppelbock--Smooth. Clear bright black cherry red color. Light sweet flavorful front. Light smooth flavorful body is rich without thickness. Finishes with a burst of flavor. Ages well. Sampled 3/21/1999 & 12/18/1999.

name: Full Sail Mercator Doppelbock
review: Date: 03/19/2000 Mode: Bottle Source: Belmont Station, Portland opaque rust, thick tan head, malty aroma, rich dry malt flavor, slight fruity character, -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 09/07/2005 Vintage: 1999 vintage muddy brown, headless, wonderful sweet fruity vineous aroma of rich ripe dates covered in a brown sugar sauce, big body, sweet malt flavor, lots of brown sugar character, no hops or bitterness, even though the aroma has developed some wonderful rich ripe fruit character, the flavor has broken down into a sugary syrup, excitment followed by a letdown Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 8/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.7/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Full Sail Mercator Doppelbock
review: On Tap at Full Sail Hood River. pours out an amber. there is a nice aroma of dark fruit.

name: Full Sail Mercator Doppelbock
review: Bottle, 1999. Ruddy brown pour. Dark fruity aroma. Sweet malty and dark fruit, especially prunes, flavors. Clearly aged well.

name: Full Sail Mercator Doppelbock
review: 1999 vintage. Poured a hazy brown with a golden hue. Aroma of dark fruit and aged malt. Flavor of dark and ripe fruits. A little flat but can be expected for 6 year old beer.

name: Full Sail Mercator Doppelbock
review: Cloudy red with not a whole lot of head. A strong bit of prunes in the aroma mixes with straw and leather. This is an impressive doppelbock. This was the 99 edition.

name: Full Sail Mercator Doppelbock
review: Dark brown, lasting tan head.Malt nose. Sweet malt taste with decent body and some finishing hops. Good lace

name: Full Sail Mercator Doppelbock
review: Dark nut brown. Sourish and syrupy sweet. Perhaps I got an off bottle. ..

name: Full Sail Mercator Doppelbock
review: A very tremendous tasting bock. It obviously has tons of malt and hops, for it has held up well in the two years I have kept it. Very cloudy and nice alcohol kick. One of the best Doppel's in the country that I have tried.

name: Full Sail Mercator Doppelbock
review: Too light-bodied for the style, and too easy going. Hops don't come through enough at the end. Wouldn't pour it down the drain, but probably wouldn't buy it again either.

name: Hair of the Dog Adam
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: woodsmoke tobacco - smoke comes in after rich milk chocolate notes again thick and syrupy high sweetness

name: Hair of the Dog Adam
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Bottle from Perry�s Liquor & Craft Beer in Livermore, CA. Aroma is roasted malts, toffee, raisins, prunes. Taste is chalky prunes, chestnuts?, tangy toffee with dark chocolate. Overall very complex and probably ahead of its time (when it first came out)...BUT a little less than exciting considering the hype.

name: Hair of the Dog Adam
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: On tap at Fakin Craft Bar, Zagreb. Dark brown with an amber tint, small tan head. Aroma is raw dough, malts mixed with herbs, spice. Alcohol present but light. Light smoke. Herb liqueur. In the end you catch a glimpse of caramel and toast. Flavour is herbal candy, toast and slightly roasty malts, wouldn't say smoky. Caramel in the finish, but combined with dry herbal touch. Medium to full body. Balanced. Soft carbonation.

name: Hair of the Dog Adam
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Taster shared with Brian. Appearance: opaque dark brown with a white head. Aroma: dark malts, fruitiness. Taste: similar, like Schwarzbeer from Cloudburst we've had earlier this day. Overall: ok. Earlier Rating: 6/16/2019 Total Score: 3.9 Glass shared with Dima Sh. Appearance: opaque dark with a low head. Aroma: very fruity with flower and dark malt notes. Taste: same with flowery and grassy hoppy bitterness. Overall: interesting and unusual.

name: Hair of the Dog Adam
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Draught pour @ Apex. Pours an opaque brown colour with a medium creamy nitro beige head. Nose is general toasted malt, and very old world dark beer in character. Flavour is toasted malt, mild caramel, burnt sugars, and a semi spiced/hoppy bittner finish. Different indeed.

name: Hair of the Dog Adam
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Im Monks Cafe in Philly (draft). Dunkles Braun, eine angemessene Schaumkrone Aroma kr�ftig nach kalten Kaffee. W�rzige Note. Kakao. Etwas rote Beere. Geschmack: Bittere Schokolade, Karamell, etwas Haselnuss. Scharfe Bitterkeit weit hinten im Rachen. Pl�tzlich kommend. Cremig. Schwerer Antrunk.

name: Hair of the Dog Adam
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: 12oz bottle. Batch 99. Pours a very dark brown with a negligible beige head. Aroma is fig, leather, chocolate, and some wood. Initially soy sauce comes through, strongly, but it disappears as the beer warms. Taste is chocolate, licorice, fig, caramel, some leather, light spice, some soy sauce, some earth, some wood, and a hint of smoke. Some alcohol in the finish. Medium-full body. Relatively low, somewhat grainy carbonation. Oily mouthfeel.

name: Hair of the Dog Adam
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Pours dark copper, minor carbonation, small off-white head and just some sticky lacing. Aroma of caramel, liquorice and ripe figs. Tastes quite sweet but balanced but bitter hops, with malted barley, caramel, brown sugar, liquorice, fruity ripe fruits with some bittering hops to balance. Smooth, viscous, light carbonation, a pleasure to sip. Excellent ale, and this is one of their standard ones!

name: Hair of the Dog Adam
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Bottle at the Burger Joint, Singapore. Poured a clear dark brown colour with a mostly lasting frothy off white head. The aroma is roasty malt, caramel, burnt treacle, liqouirce, red berry fruits, light spicy hop. The flavour is moderate sweet, liquorice alcohol bitter, with a rich, fruity, slightly oily, earthy, leather, fruity, warm alcohol bitter palate. Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation. Awesome. Worth the wait.

name: Hair of the Dog Rose
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Sample at Beavertown Extravaganza 2017. A dark orange coloured beer with a white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, spice, funk, fruit, lemon, pepper and with a sweet finish.

name: Hair of the Dog Rose
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: [5/10/18] Draught at Mikkeller & Friends in Copenhagen. Murky amber. Beetroot, hibiscus, caramel, malt, some spiciness, fruitiness, sweet, sugary, medium-bodied. Weird.

name: Hair of the Dog Rose
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Draught @ Mikkeller @friends. Poured Rose, red color. Black currants all over, in flavor, in aroma. Its smooth, its light tart. Its juicy. Awesome.

name: Hair of the Dog Rose
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: At Mikkeller and Friends, 2018. Pours brown to orange with a small head, aroma of wood, Hibiscus, cherry, beets, flavor of cherries, hibiscus, beet, medium bodied

name: Hair of the Dog Rose
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Hazy rustic gold under a thin white foamy cap. Bright hibiscus and peppercorn aromas with a smoothbelgin biscuity malt base. Vibrant pale malty flavor that�s a little strong and slightly estery with pink peppercorns and a tasty Belgian herbal playfulness. Really neat and complex.

name: Hair of the Dog Rose
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Draft in the tasting room. Hazy burnt orange with medium head and lace. Peach, cherry, tobacco, and teakwood aroma. Rather restrained malt sweetness and stonefruit, but also a healthy, balancing, clean bitter. Medium body and exceptionally satisfying finish especially for the size. A bit more complicated than a tripel ought to be, perhaps, but it works.

name: Hair of the Dog Rose
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: 23/IX/17 - on tap @ Borefts Bierfestival 2017 (Bodegraven) - BB: n/a (2017-1710) Thanks to ratebeerians and friends for sharing today's beers! Clear orange beer, small creamy white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: very malty,g rains, hay, sweetish, cow fodder. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: very malty, sweet, some caramel, grains, bitter touch, cow fodder. Aftertaste: bit malty, metallic touch, little bitter, hay, cow fodder, malty, sweet touch.

name: Hair of the Dog Rose
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Retro. Dark orange pour. Herbal tea like nose with fruit esters and yeast prominent. Light spices. Hibiscus is nice. Good tripel overall though not a standout for HOTD.

name: Hair of the Dog Rose
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Tap@Beavertown Extravaganza 2017, London -fuzzy golden pour with a white head. Fruity and light malty. some icing sugar, caramel sweetness, some citric lemon flavour, yeasty, some grassy and floral nuances going on, citric spice into the sweet finish.

name: Hair of the Dog Rose
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Cask at Cask Days. Cloudy golden color dense head. Floral perfume aroma, hibiscus lavender pepper. Taste is funk flowers bitter peppery finish. Best of fest.

name: Hair of the Dog Fred
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Tap at Borefts 2019: Slightly hazy orange colored brew with an dry bitter taste, hints of caramel, grapefruit, some burning alcohol and some wood. Quite complex beer which is easy to drink.

name: Hair of the Dog Fred
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: 08.08.2019, tap @ Bakushu Club Popeye: Small slightly bubbly-creamy mediumlasting head, hazy golden orangy color. Aroma is slightly dry boozy, dusty caramel malts, fruit stones, bark, minerals, alcohol, toffee, paper, sawdust, cardboard, dried grain, hints of raisins. Taste is slightly dry sour-ish boozy, bark, fruit stones, caramel malts, sour grass, minerals, alcohol, paper, harsh hops, sawdust, harsh citrus peel. Longlasting harsh bitterness, boozy mouthfeel. Fair enough, needs years in the cellar...

name: Hair of the Dog Fred
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Bottle at Toranado, SF. Rich, sweet, yeasty, like their American ales. A complex array of hops, as well. Really nice!

name: Hair of the Dog Fred
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle from wchesser poured into a snifter. Deep golden with small white head. Aroma is caramel malt, medium body, low carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is caramel malt, some what spicy rye, and some hops backbone for balance.

name: Hair of the Dog JD
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Was originally named small beer when I first had it at the Archer. Lightly smoked nose and flavor.

name: Hair of the Dog JD
brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review: Very smokey. This is a small beer drawn from Adam. Unique stuff...........

name: NorWester Oregon Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Draught@Hilpe� Hauki, Helsinki. Cloudy amber color, white head. Grapefruity hop flavor. Medium-full body, medium carbonation. Once again a beer that is too grapefruity for my taste.

name: NorWester Oregon Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Nor�Wester Beer Company--Oregon Pale Ale--Oregon Promise Series 1998 12 & 22 oz. Bottle. 5.50% ABV. (2.5 / 5.0) Pale Ale. Nor�Wester Beer Company--Oregon Pale Ale--Oregon Promise Series 2002 12 oz. Bottle. 5.50% ABV. (3.5 / 5.0) Clear thin amber color. Mild floral hop front. Tart mild caramel malt body with citrus bite and minimal biscuit notes. Medium light sweet texture. Mild hop sweet end. Easy & Over Carbonated. Minimal hops. Sampled 4/15/2002.

name: NorWester Oregon Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: This bottled brew poured a medium sized head of frothy medium sized mostly lasting light brown colored bubbles that left behind a fair lacing. The body contained unnoted carbonation, was unnoted and light brown in color. Its aroma contained notes of mild caramel malts and hops. Its mouth feel is initially tingly thick with a lingering mellow palate and a dough aftertaste. Its flavor contained caramel malt hop notes. A very average brew.

name: NorWester Oregon Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Bottle. Small off-white head that mostly diminished, fair lacing, fine-medium sized bubbles, carbonated, transparent, and an orange hue. Aroma was malty, caramel, sweet and hoppy as was the flavor. Tingly mouthfeel. Light-medium body.

name: NorWester Oregon Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Dark amber body with off-white, foamy head. Aroma was unremarkable. Slight sparkle to the taste. Okay ale, nothing special.

name: NorWester Oregon Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Slightly hazed amber body with small beige head. Aroma is sweet, toffee, floral. Taste is toffee and earthy at the front, giving way to pine, light grapefruit. Can occasionally get a slight metallic tang in the swallow. Medium watery body. Very pleasant beer ideal for sessions.

name: NorWester Oregon Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: very nice pale. amber color, frothy head. floral pine aroma. lots of big citric pine hop flavors here but with a nice solid malt character.

name: NorWester Oregon Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: An alright appearance to this one with decent white head. Nose is lightly hoppy and...is there a note of peach or some other sweet fruit? It's a LITTLE too subtle...more aroma strength would be of great benefit. Flavor has that same hint of fruit that I just can't place. Not too hoppy or bitter...in fact, other than the fruit note, there's not much at all. This beer desperately needs some depth to make it better.

name: NorWester Oregon Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Mine had a slight metallic nose and taste...contaminated?...................

name: NorWester Oregon Pale Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: run of the mill northwest APA that is a clone of SNPA. good, but nothing special to write home about.

name: NorWester HefeWeizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: From old tasting notes. Cloudy, honey gold color. Thick, creamy white head. Yeasty, wheat malt aroma. Sharp, yeasty malt flavor hints at grapefruit. Bitter citrus finish.

name: NorWester HefeWeizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: From the file last updated in 2010. Pours gold with big head. Aroma was citrus. Taste was weak.

name: NorWester HefeWeizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Nor�Wester Beer Company--Hefeweizen--Oregon Promise Series--1998 Release--12 oz . & 22 oz. Bottle. 5.30% ABV. (3.0 / 5.0) Hefeweizen--Golden Brown fruit pulp color. Good body. No real taste or aroma, but good. Nor�Wester Beer Company--Saxer--Portland Brewing Company Hefeweizen Unfiltered Wheat Ale--Oregon Promise Series--2002 12 oz. Bottle. 5.30% ABV. (3.5 / 5.0) Hefeweizen--Bright hazy lemon juice yellow color. Light head. Mild wheat spice hop front. Thin clean dry citrus mild banana clove butter wheat body. Bland. Clean citrus mild hop end. Warming enhances mild flavor. Sampled 5/14/2003.

name: NorWester HefeWeizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: This bottled brew poured a small sized head of frothy large sized mostly lasting white colored bubbles that left behind a fair lacing. The body contained soft carbonation, was other and dark yellow orange in color. Its aroma contained notes of mild bready aroma with a wheat note . Its mouth feel is initially tingly with a lingering tingly palate and a smooth aftertaste. Its flavor contained malt wheat bready notes.

name: NorWester HefeWeizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: (12 oz bottle: Hi-Time Wine Cellars in Costa Mesa, CA) Not a lot of wheat flavor, more just a generic, cheap micro-wheat. Light sweetness, minimal hops. Seems to be a bit past its prime though, as I�m picking up a bit of breadiness, plus some cardboard in the finish. And actually, the nose is sweet and bready as well. Light-to-medium in body. The color is a muddy golden and kind of sickly looking. The small, fizzy, whitish head dissipated rapidly down to a small ring. Not very good.

name: NorWester HefeWeizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Not a great hefeweizen, Far too carbonated, produces a biting acid on the tongue, I don�t like that aspect, the aroma is a little weak as well. On a positive note, it does taste pretty decent, although bland. I don�t think I would get this one again.

name: NorWester HefeWeizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: english pint / sweet wheaty aroma. fizzy, cola sounding poor with airy white head. hazy yellow straw body. citrus, slightly doughy, sweet wheat.

name: NorWester HefeWeizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Hazy/murky dull golden color with a smaller off white head. Sweet wheat and floral hops aromas. Grape-nuts and light hops flavors. Hints of citrus. Another boring american wheat.

name: NorWester HefeWeizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Bottle. Poured a small fizzy white head that fully diminished, sparse lacing, fine-small sized bubbles, carbonated, hazy, and a yellow hue. The aroma was malty and sweet. The flavor was sweet and malty. None of the typical aromas and flavors for this beer style. Tingly palate. Light-medium body.

name: NorWester HefeWeizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: 12oz bottle. Slightly murky medium yellow color, some yeast particles visibly floating. Light sweet grainy lemon and wheat flavor, a little bit like plastic, or perhaps the bottle that I�m tasting. Drinkable, refreshing and sweet, but not the ideal hefe. Light corn aroma turns my nose away, however.

name: NorWester Raspberry Weizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Nor�Wester Beer Company--Raspberry Weizen--1997 12 oz. Bottle. 5.30% ABV. Fruit Ale--Raspberry . Nor�Wester Beer Company--Raspberry Weizen--Oregon Promise Series--1998 12 oz. Bottle. 5.30% ABV. (2.0 / 5.0) Fruit Ale--Raspberry Hefeweizen with a touch of raspberry aroma.

name: NorWester Raspberry Weizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: bottled, I drank it a couple years ago, it was a perfectly balance wheat beer with raspberry juice, perfect for summer day.

name: NorWester Raspberry Weizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Looks perfectly fine so thats why i bought this old bottle. Has head and clear appearance. Smell is dead with nothing to smell but flavor is the same with only a light berry syrup taste.

name: NorWester Raspberry Weizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: This is hard to find in my area but a friend brought me a bottle and I enjoyed it. The pyrimid beers are notbad at all and I love friut and lambic brews. They are not in the blucreek or lindmans catagory but a pleasent drink that is mild. I could taste the rasberry but may have not been able to pinpoint it if it did not say what is was on the bottle. In any case a good beer but I like Purple Haze better.

name: NorWester Raspberry Weizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Regular medium yellow wheat appearance. Nose and flavor are syrupy sugared raspberries. Really similar to Thomas Kemper�s berry wheat. Fizzy, though not too thin. What else can you say about it other than "It�s a fruit beer".

name: NorWester Raspberry Weizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Hazy yellow, head thick and mildy pinked. Nose grassy and sweet, raspberry is restrained. Good raspberry in the flavor, not overpowering or cloying, balances nicely with lemon and clove. Refreshing.

name: NorWester Raspberry Weizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Smallish off-white head atop a clouded amber body. Aroma is medium sweet, raspberry, lemon, some caramel, light wheat. Taste is medium sweet, raspberry that seems somewhat artificial, light lemon, finishing pleasant raspberry. Light body, some tartness. Sorry, but I just don't see the point.

name: NorWester Raspberry Weizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Had from bottle on May 16, 2003 An interesting beer - pours with the standard hazy yellow for wheat beers and has a small head. The aroma is slightly fruity but nothing to write home about. The taste is good - tart, but not too much so with a hint of other citrus flavors. I enjoyed the beer, but if I'm going to drink a fruit beer, I'll stick with the Krieks and Lambics. I love hefeweizens, but not too sure about fruit-weizen combos. Very drinkable however, and would be a great beer for a hot day in the sun. Also good if you're eating something sweet - the tartness would be a perfect contrast.

name: NorWester Raspberry Weizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: a good sweet fruit beer for desert. hazy amber stuff with some floaties. not much in the sweert aroma but the taste is pure raspberry, syrupy sweet yet tart. nice clean crisp palate from the wheat base. one of the better wheat+fruit beers out there

name: NorWester Raspberry Weizen
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: On tap at Yard House: Looks like grapefruit juice. Light pinkish color with a thin ring of foam. Aroma is of raspberries and citrus. Good balance between the fruit and malt flavors in the body. A drinkable, well-rounded brew.

name: NorWester Smith Rock Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Nor�Wester Beer Company--Smith Rock Bock--1997 Release--12 oz. Bottle. 7.00% ABV. (4.0 / 5.0) Maibock. Nor�Wester Beer Company--Smith Rock Bock--Promise Series--1999 Release--12 oz. Bottle. 7.30% ABV. (3.75 / 5.0) Maibock. Clear golden red color. Minimal aroma. Body is smooth and cleanly sweet with a light toffee fruit flavor. Thin feel and not overwhelmingly flavorful. Easy smooth finish. Sampled 7/30/1999.

name: NorWester Smith Rock Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Murky, unfiltered copper color. Sweet malty aroma with a small head. Caramelized sugar taste dominated by malts and a little spice. Bit of a harsh aftertaste.

name: NorWester Smith Rock Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Very cloudy amber appearance with a 1 centimetre thick tan head. Thick pour, it appears to be full-bodied. Aroma is sweet and spicey...a pretty good representation to the style and exactly what you'd expect from a bock. Equally strong in the burnt sugars (caramel, toffee) as well as the malt and spiceyness...pumpkins, cloves and nutmeg are present. Medium-bodied; Strong initial flavour of malt and spices as well as that sugar! The carbonation was at a minimum and the head has completely dissipated now (less than 2 minutes). Aftertaste a bit spicey and definately flavoured with malt. Overall, a pretty good Bock, and since I don't like the style...that is saying quite a bit! Worth a try if you can get your hands on it...and i'm really not sure how I found it! I bought my twelve ounce bottle at Chevy Chase Wines & Spirits in Washington, D.C.

name: NorWester Smith Rock Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Cloudy copper, with virtually no head. Aroma is intensely toffee/caramel, sticky and sweet. Taste is strong toffee, sweet but thankfully not as much as aroma hinted at. Minimal carbonation.

name: NorWester Smith Rock Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)

name: NorWester Smith Rock Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Medium brown color, medium head. Very rich maltyness, some sweetness, toasted caramel flavors. Bock like maltyness. Finish is clean and crisp. Aftertaste is nice balance between the malt sweetness and the hop bitterness

name: NorWester Smith Rock Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Hoppy aroma, with a nice malty flavor, and a smooth finish. ................

name: NorWester Smith Rock Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Orange coloured. Malty, dry and balanced. A true German style bock! .......

name: NorWester Smith Rock Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Light copper color; Medium-thin head but dense, thins to a glass ring stickiness. Lots of hops for a bock(?). Very strange. Crispness of the lagering but the hops dominate.

name: NorWester Smith Rock Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Re-rate 02/07/02: Pours a nice deep amber color, beige head and decent lace. Nose is quite floral, malt under tones. Begins malt sweet, the middle light, the finish is nicely hopped and a tad dry. Light to medium carbonation, a decent bock, not great but good.

name: NorWester White Forest Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Nor�Wester Beer Company--White Forest Ale--Promise Series 1999--12 oz. Bottle. 5.50% ABV. (4.0 / 5.0) Winter Ale. Described as Scottish Style. Clear bright copper red color. Light fruity aroma leads to amber style light flavorful sweet fruit toffee body lacking noticeable Scottish character. Very clean flavor. Sampled 4/20/1999. Nor�Wester Beer Company--White Forest Winter Ale--1997 Release--12 oz. Bottle. 7.00% ABV. (4.0 / 5.0) Winter Ale. Nor�Wester Beer Company--Whiteforest Winter Ale--1997 Release--22 oz. Bottle. 7.00% ABV. (4.0 / 5.0) Winter Ale . Nor�Wester Beer Company--Winter Ale--1996 Release--22 oz. Bottle. 7.00% ABV. (4.0 / 5.0) Winter Ale. Nor�Wester Beer Company--Winter Ale--1996 Release. 12 oz. Bottle. 7.00% ABV. (4.0 / 5.0) Winter Ale.

name: NorWester White Forest Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Name: White Forrest Date: 10/06/1997 Mode: Bottle Source: Burlingame Grocery, OR amber with a slight chill haze, whispy head, strong malt aroma with light floral hops, strong malt flavor with a touch of bitterness Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.7/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: NorWester White Forest Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Sparkling amber,tan head. Scarce bead.Malt nose. Dry malt flavor, slightly off.

name: NorWester White Forest Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Sweetish and brief. None of the deep maltiness I crave in a scottish ale. Very forgettable.

name: NorWester White Forest Ale
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: A little thin not as strong as i would have liked. Still good though........

name: NorWester Mt. Angel Oktoberfest
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Nor�Wester Beer Company--Mt. Angel Oktoberfest Lager--Oregon Promise Series--1999 Release--12 oz. Bottle. 5.50% ABV. (3.25 / 5.0) Oktoberfest--Clear bright rusty amber color. Mild lager front tinged with hint of body. Medium textured smooth rusty body has light smoky nutty fruit flavor and dry sweetness. Smooth clean light sweet finish. Sampled 8/28/1999.

name: NorWester Mt. Angel Oktoberfest
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecer�a Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Name: Mt. Angel Octoberfest Date: 10/11/1997 Mode: Bottle Source: Burlingame Grocery, OR clear light amber, whispy head, light hop aroma, light body, soft malt flavor, pleasant hop flavor, slight bitter finish, more of a pale ale than an octoberfest Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Rogue American Amber Ale
review: Keg at Rogue Bar, Portland in 2013. Clear amber with an offwhite head. Aroma of berries, grassy hops and chewy grain. Easy drinking. Some piney hops with dried fruit and biscuity malt flavours.

name: Rogue American Amber Ale
review: Backlog. Clear mahogany with a small, off-white head. Nice red-style ale that ticks all the boxes.

name: Rogue American Amber Ale
review: Aroma: malt, mocha & passionfruit Appearance: amber red/brown, hazy, tan lasting head Flavour: caramel, burnt toffee & hop balance Palate: medium well carbonated finishes roasted & hop bitter

name: Rogue American Amber Ale
review: From the bottle. Brown with a frothy to creamy white head. Aroma is caramel and roasted walnut. Taste is mildly sweet, bittersweet at the end with toffee and roasted grain notes. Body trends light. Easy going, drinkable stuff.

name: Rogue American Amber Ale
review: Bottle. It poured an murky orangeish brown color with a tight tan head that dissipated to a lace ring only. The aroma had a caramel maltiness with some bread doughiness. It is mildly bitter.

name: Rogue American Amber Ale
review: Color cobre con espuma blanca y persistente. Aromas a maltas y caramelos. Muy recomendable.

name: Rogue American Amber Ale
review: 25.09.2014, tap @ In de Wildeman: Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet, caramel malts, nuts, leafs, grass, "knekk", hops, hints of dried fruits. Taste is slightly dry, weeds, bark, grass, paper, caramel malts, hay, hops. Medium to longlasting bitterness, dry slightly harsh and watery mouthfeel. Fair enough.

name: Rogue American Amber Ale
review: Donker rood van kleur. Smaak van diep gebrande mouten en dat van koffie. Bier heeft ook sterke smaken van hop. -backlog de BierApp-

name: Rogue American Amber Ale
review: 355 ml bottle at Brew Beers and Ciders in Bangkok. Appearance is a somewhat hazy amber shad, topped with a finger of off-white froth. Aromas are muted, there is a little floral hops over more malty grainy notes. Taste us mainly malty sweet, good flavour profile, little hops. A bit light bodied.

name: Rogue American Amber Ale
review: Bottle@ Wikas Rogue tasting w Senior. Appearance: pours slightly hazy amber/brown with good off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: bread, caramel, citrus, grapefruit, nuts, light coffe, grass and earthy notes. palette: strong malty aroma, average carbonation, medium body, medium sweetness, balanced by a medium bitterness, average duration and a watery texture. Overall: tasteful amber with a hop twist

name: Rogue MoM Hefeweizen
review: Tried for the first time back in 2011 and only just now adding it to my ratings. Maltier and thicker than the average belgian wit. Lacks the spices I expected as well. Musty and pretty well balanced.

name: Rogue MoM Hefeweizen
review: From old tasting notes. Labeled as "Rogue Half-a-Weizen". Hazy honey gold color. Interesting earthy citrus wheat malt aroma. Refreshingly bittersweet complex malt flavor, reminiscent of spices and peppercorns. A hint of ginger leads to a big hop finish.

name: Rogue Honey Cream Ale
review: From old tasting notes. Honey gold color topped by a bubbly white head. Soft sweet floral hop nose. Bittersweet fruity malt flavor is balanced by a crisp biting hoppiness. Long bitter aftertaste.

name: Rogue Honey Cream Ale
review: From the file last updated in 2010. Pours gold. Aroma is hoppy. Flavor is malt and citrus hop.

name: Rogue Honey Cream Ale
review: "not bad. wasn�t expecting much, but this is quite refreshing. the honey is a nice touch, and of course Rogue won�t make a beer without a generous amount of hops. nice."

name: Rogue Honey Cream Ale
review: I miss this one. Pour is yellow in the glass. Nose and taste is sweet honey, buttered toast. Rated 6/17/02 - Original rating 4.3

name: Rogue Honey Cream Ale
review: Piss yellow pour and a lot more of a bitter flavor than you�d expect from the style. That�s not necessarily a deterrent for me since I despise cream ales in general, but this one still didn�t quite work out for me.

name: Rogue Honey Cream Ale
review: this beer pours a bright golden colour with a subtley sweet honey aroma. it�s faint, but becomes more noticeable in the taste. a little malty mid palate, finishes with soft hop character.

name: Rogue Honey Cream Ale
review: I really liked this. It started out sweet, and creamy, and had a very pleasant taste. It has a nice clean, bitter finish. I am surprised this beer hasn�t done better.

name: Rogue Honey Cream Ale
review: This beer has such a great name, but the beer itself doesnt live up to the name. Bitter, not honey dominates. Reminds me a bit of the santas private reserve. not so great.

name: Rogue Honey Cream Ale
review: Bottle (22oz). Slightly hazy light amber with a 2cm white foamy-frothy head. Dry, papery caramel malt aroma with a hint of herbal/resin bitterness, honey-clover sweetness as it warms. Grassy-honey aroma- quite sweet, but bitter in the tail, smooth, light, vaguely creamy and surprisingly drinkable. Only just okay, but better than I expected.

name: Rogue Honey Cream Ale
review: Pours yellow with a fine white head. Smells of honey, pine resin, some sweet malt. Tastes of citrus, pine resin, pepper, touches of honey. Finish is bitter. This is a far cry from what I�ve come to expect out of a cream ale.

name: Rogue HazelNut Brown Nectar
review: 355 ml. bottle @ home, served in a tulip glass, due date: 2020/02. Aroma: toasted malts, biscuits, caramel, nuts, hazelnuts, toasted biscuits. Appearance: deep amber to copper color with light brown overtones. Beige head made of tiny to small sized bubbles with medium head thickness and medium to high retention. Low to medium Brussels' lacing, medium haziness. Taste: medium sweetness, low bitterness, low sourness. Flavors of toasted biscuits, biscuits, toasted malts, hazelnuts, nuts. Balance is toward the sweetness but well balanced for the style and not cloying at all. Mouthfeel: medium body, watery to oily / silky texture, medium carbonation, very long bittersweet finish with low to medium bitterness, medium sweetness and the same aforementioned flavors. Alcohol is very well hidden and only noticeable because of its mouth and throat warming. Astringency is not noticeable. Overall: exccellent appearance, very good aromas and flavors of biscuits, toasted biscuits, toasted malts, nuts, hazelnuts. Sweet but not cloying, different and quite delicious. Quite good. Wonderful aromas, excellent sipper and nice to be paired with a pecan pie. It lacks of complexity, if it had more layers of flavors it would be an amazing beer.

name: Rogue HazelNut Brown Nectar
review: Bottle, 0.355l. Aroma of caramel, hazelnut, roasted malt and cocoa. Pours cloudy dark brown color with thin creamy tan-like head and sparkling appearance. Taste starts light sweet nutty and caramelly, following is toasted, mouthfeel is smooth, while finish is light bitter. Medium body, creamy texture and average carbonation in palate. Nuts�n�more...

name: Rogue Morimoto Imperial Pilsner
review: Keg at BrewDog Camden in 2013. Always liked this one. Clear deep golden with a white head. Malty nose, with raisins, herbal hops and lemongrass. Sweetish malty flavours at first, then dried fruit, grassy hops and peppery notes come in. Fantastic body and great lingering malty flavour.

name: Rogue Morimoto Imperial Pilsner
review: botte, alko. yellow, bit pale, not totally clear, unfiltered apparently. pale, slight popcorn seedy, malty, yello florals, light citrus, light sea weedy. full bodied, pale malty, some grainyness, earthyness. finishes nice and dry, crackers.. nice enough imperial lager.

name: Rogue Morimoto Imperial Pilsner
review: Bottle from Morimoto restaurant. Musty aroma with slight hops. Pleasant fruity taste. Enough of a hop bite to hide the booziness. Bready. Good!

name: Rogue Morimoto Imperial Pilsner
review: From Dec 2005 Poured from bottle(room temp) a clear medium gold with a large head that dissipated slowly. The smell is pretty subdued with faint hints of hops and that overall "pilsner" aroma. The taste is a very pungent bitterness up front that makes my mouth pucker...I kid you not! Mid way, the bitterness settles down and becomes more of a citrusy flavour that carries through to the aftertaste. And...I find the alcohol in this imperial definitely noticeable but not in the "Malt Liquor" kind of way; it's soothing, and would be welcome on a cold winter's night. If you add up what I just wrote, you might think that I don't favour this brew all that much but guess what? I liked it enough to say to myself, I'm buying this one again.

name: Rogue Morimoto Imperial Pilsner
review: Sampled at SBWF. No carbonation or head. Very opaque. Green aple aroma and raw hops. Big bitter bite that lingers and some hop taste. Medium body.

name: Rogue Morimoto Imperial Pilsner
review: On tap @ Rogue SF. Pours clear dark golden with thin creamy off-white head that laces well. Aroma is light sweet pils malt, with a slight corn note throughout. Dry, floral hops on the back. Taste is a big sweet light-bodied malt, boozy and thick. Same floral hops, though they really get overwhelmed by the hefty malt bill. Lingers slightly bitter on the finish. Pretty good as imperial pilsners go.

name: Rogue Morimoto Imperial Pilsner
review: Bottle with Sune and Theis. Hazy golden, medium sized nicely lacing white head. Effervescent. Grain, green plants, dry flowers, booze. Full body, some sweetness, heavy bitter, dry. Ok, but fairly boozy and bitter.

name: Rogue Morimoto Imperial Pilsner
review: Bottle from Mads in Sommerhuset. Pours a clear golden with a small white head. Quite sweet with a medium bitterness. Aromas of sprucey hops with notes of soap and alcohol. Medium to full bodied. Medium carbonation. Bitter finish.

name: Rogue Morimoto Imperial Pilsner
review: Tap. Orange, cloudy, rocky head, tan foam, medium bitterness, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, & long finish.

name: Rogue Morimoto Imperial Pilsner
review: One strange brew, this pours a cloudy, headless murky pale gold. Aroma is nice and malty with a sweetness and some floral hop. Flavor is initial malt and some honey up front (nice), but quickly hits with a bitter/astringent bite mid-sip that lasts through the finish and leaves the throat dry.

name: Rogue Irish Style Lager
review: An okay lager. Pours dark gold, has a thickish body and a balancing bready sweetness. Tried for the first time in 2010.

name: Rogue Irish Style Lager
review: From Mar 2006 Poured from bottle(room temp) a clear medium gold with a large head of foam that dissipated slowly. The smell is of sweet malt. Kind of typical of a macro lager. The taste is also of sweet malt but there's a sourness there as well that does nothing to help with the taste of this lager. I find it *very* ordinary and I'm a *big* fan of Rogue products so there is *no* anti bias associated with this review. Bottom line: It's a Rogue product but don't let their reputation sway you into trying this lager. It's just not worth it.

name: Rogue Irish Style Lager
review: Pours a golden yellow with a slight honey aroma. Taste is thin, with minor biscuit notes. Clean and crisp finish with a light apple tinge left on the palate.

name: Rogue Irish Style Lager
review: [24/12/15] Bottle from Clackamas Town Center: Golden body with slight head. Nose is bread, toasty, spices. Taste is malty, with spices, cereal and herbs. Dry in the finish.

name: Rogue Irish Style Lager
review: Bottle to plastic cup. Appearance is golden red. Above avg. White head. Aroma is barley, grasses. Taste is barley, wheat, root vegetable, sweet honey like finish. Easy drinking lager. Lacks body. Good, not great.

name: Rogue Irish Style Lager
review: Clear yellow body with a thick white foamy head. Aroma is sweet and grassy, with a taste that is light, sweet, floral and has an overall smooth finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Rogue Irish Style Lager
review: Pours a clear medium yellow with a white head. Aroma is faint malt with hops. Palate is medium light body. Take is slightly more bitter and crisper than Harp�s.

name: Rogue Irish Style Lager
review: 650 ml bottle poured at home. Pours a hazy golden with creamy white head and floaters in it. Smells like apples. Tastes like nothing with a touch of honey. Drinkable

name: Rogue Irish Style Lager
review: Clear golden with a thin white head and a faint gold malty nose. Clean and crisp lagery flavor with robust wheaty dough and cracker flavors. Just a basic clean and biscuit-malty lager. Nothing particular Irish about it but quite nice all the same. There�s a touch of toasted pretzel dough once it warms a little.

name: Rogue Irish Style Lager
review: Pour on tap, clear golden pour with thin white head, aroma brought notes of biscuit, bread, yeast into a bit of cracker, slight spicy, grassy note. Taste was similar and simple, some slight cereal, bread, touch of cracker into some spice, herbs, grass, finishing slightly dry.

name: Rogue Dead Guy Ale
review: De botella en Oldenburg. Bonito color �mbar con suave espuma color marfil. Aromas muy ricos a miel, melaza, malta tostada y cierto frescor lupulado. En boca es fresca, carbonatada y con un rico sabor a miel de bosque, bizcocho de yogur y melaza. Retrogusto suave y dulz�n con toques frescos lupulados. Qu� rica!

name: Rogue Dead Guy Ale
review: I love this beer. I like amber ale, brown and black ale, hate all these IPA overhopped BS beers and apparently like Maibock or what ever this dead guy ale is. Please keep making it and don�t change a thing. It is awesome.

name: Rogue Dead Guy Ale
review: Dark amber with a one finger wide white head. Roasted smell of grass and hay. Intense grainy, malty taste with a bitterness that develops during the sip. Low carbonation and hoppy bitter aftertaste.

name: Rogue McRogue Scotch Ale
review: Backlog rate. Pours a caramel brown color with a small beige head. The aroma and flavor have big caramel and toffee malts, dark fruits, a hint of smoke, overall good brew.

name: Rogue McRogue Scotch Ale
review: This one stunned me. Found an unintentionally aged 8 year old bottle and expected the worst. Somehow this is still pretty solid. It pours chestnut brown with a beige head. It has a fairly full body with a bit of soft carbonation. It has lots of toffee, caramel, richness and a little on the sweet side. There is some oxidation, but its not much and extremely less than I'd expect for an 8 year old scotch ale. Pleasant surprise.

name: Rogue McRogue Scotch Ale
review: From old tasting notes. Hazy, reddish brown color. Creamy beige head. Interesting smoky toasted malt nose. Bittersweet toasted malt flavor with hints of peat and tarragon. Very unique and interesting.

name: Rogue McRogue Scotch Ale
review: How: Bottle. Where: Had at home. Appearance: Amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma: Malt, caramel, hops, butterscotch. Body: Medium body and carbonation. Flavour: Butterscotch, caramel, sweet malt.

name: Rogue McRogue Scotch Ale
review: Thin 1/2" tan head.. the brew is dark walnut.. okay nose.. toast and caramel... lite roast.. Flavors are thin .. dark toast with some minor caramel... hints of peat smoke. Mehhh.... okay ... but only an okay representation of a Scotch ale..

name: Rogue McRogue Scotch Ale
review: Bottle at Craig�s. Pours dark brown with a thin beige head. Aromas of toffee, caramel, spice.Taste is sweet, nutty. Sweet finish.

name: Rogue McRogue Scotch Ale
review: Wee bottle at craig�s. Pours deep amber, nose is caramel, toffee, berries, taste is similar, dry, not bad.

name: Rogue McRogue Scotch Ale
review: bottle at home ... copper ... thin tan lacing ... soft sweet toffee fruit .. sweet toffee malt nose ... sweet fruits .. soft toffee fruit ... dry toffee malts ...

name: Rogue McRogue Scotch Ale
review: "dark fruit, sweet carmel malt and a hint of smoke in the nose and flavor. medium bodied and goes down easy. just a touch on the simple side, but a decent representation of a good style. 11/11-7 oz bottle now. didn�t used to be anywhere near this good. not smokey, but sweet, rich, a little peaty and ridiculously smooth. this is what a scotch ale should taste like. best rogue brew i�ve had in a long while." Inconsistency knocks a tenth off.

name: Rogue McRogue Scotch Ale
review: (bottle - 7 oz - 2010 vintage) Dark copper pour with no head. Big malt and roasted chocolate and caramel aroma. Flavor is lots of malt and a surprisingly boozy middle. Caramel and bitter roasted hops at the finish. Held up nice.

name: Rogue Mocha Porter
review: De botella en Oldenburg. Color negro con halo de espuma color beige. Aromas fuertes a caf� y regaliz. En boca es suave y amarga, como un buen caf� solo, se notan los toques a regaliz. Nada de chocolate ni dulzor. Retrogusto amargo. Simple pero rica.

name: Rogue Mocha Porter
review: Bomber in 2013. Super dark ruby with a beige head. Aroma of cocoa, roasted malt and earthy hints. Decent body. Chocolate is not too sweet in the flavour, and there�s some coffee and roasted nuts in the mix.

name: Rogue Mocha Porter
review: Ordered a batch from taobao. It didn�t taste sweet as much to my liking, it reminded me a lot of Guinness, similar texture and flavor, can�t say I am impressed

name: Rogue Mocha Porter
review: Deliciosa en nariz con notas de caf�, caramelo, y canela. Un aroma seco, muy equilibrado y muy agradable. Los sabores b�sicos est�n tambi�n equilibrados, dominando un amargo suave junto a un dulce y un �cido tambien suaves. Da notas de caf� con leche, o quiz� con nata por su textura untuosa. Final largo como de caf� con nata con poco az�car. Gran bebestibilidad. Muy recomendable. Para repetir.

name: Rogue Mogul Ale
review: From old tasting notes. Hazy mahogany brown color. Creamy beige head. Fragrant roasted malt nose. Bittersweet roasted malt flavor with candy like nuances. Noticeable hop twang in middle. Bitter burnt malt and hop finish. Interesting and hearty.

name: Rogue Mogul Ale
review: "a lightly hopped beer for a rogue ale. kind of non-descript, not fitting into any style well. a decent malt forward beer, but pretty simple really. eh."

name: Rogue Mogul Ale
review: Aroma: Jammy; fruit preserves, sweet overall. Appearance: Translucent medium brown with a messy tan head. Flavor: Matches the nose; just feels like a bunch of malts and hops thrown together; sweet; hoppy; jammy mess- just feels aimless. Palate: Medium body, slick texture, flat carbonation, long finish. Overall: Probably the last Rogue beer I�ll ever bother drinking. Now I remember why I don�t bother anymore.

name: Rogue Mogul Ale
review: On tap at Union 613. Hazy dark amber with a decent cream head (full disclosure - drunk out of a mason jar...but it worked). Matly sweetness, caramel, bit of toffee, some grapefruit rind and apricot but semi fermented, hints of spice. Moderate+ body, moderate carbonation, semi-sweet, smooth, alcohol is well balanced, becomes slightly dry and then you get an interesting play between the bitterness of the hops and the sweeter malts on the finish. Good.

name: Rogue Mogul Ale
review: Love this beer, subtle mocha flavors from malty sweetness holding up to a massive hop variety that somehow creates one delicious harmonious profile

name: Rogue Mogul Ale
review: On tap at Maxwells. Very tasty beer; a mix between a brown & an IPA yet the balance is there. Rogue pushes the envelope again & delivers a tasty malt, hop, & yeast mixture.

name: Rogue Mogul Ale
review: Draft @ Taco Mac Metropolis, Atlanta, GA. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy aroma with weak hints of caramel. FRuity malty hoppy bitter caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter citrus finish.

name: Rogue Mogul Ale
review: Sugar fruit, toffee, vanilla and nuts. Thats what stood out in this beer. I also detected the chinook flavor and some mild chocolate. The finish was sweet and hoppy bitter.

name: Rogue Mogul Ale
review: On tap and on drink special at Stags Head. Pours dark amber brown. Taste is nutty, earthy, some piney hops, and cinnamon. finish is dry.

name: Rogue Mogul Ale
review: Slight grassy hop aroma followed by cereal grainines. Dark amber with little head. Clean flavor with spicy, piney notes. Unusually crisp and dry for a winter ale. Mouthfeel is rocky with minor astringency at the end. A hoppier version of the style, but a nice diversion from the ordinary.

name: Rogue XS Old Crustacean Barleywine
review: 3rd entry with family as we�re getting ready for supper, I was so eager to try that one, as it is one of my favorite style, and in a different bottle presentation, yet the taste was not meetRogue XS Old Crustacean Barleywine
column9: old Backlog, Bottle, pours a hazy amber brown with a fast receding head. Notes are pine, caramel malt, toffee, and raisins. Lighter to medium bodied for the style especially compared to Angels Share which is the barleywine of choice these days. Warming in the belly.

name: Rogue XS Old Crustacean Barleywine
review: Color marrn con matices rojos y espuma blanca que se disipa con cierta facilidad. Aromas a maltas, lpulos, muy licorosa. Sabor a caramelos, madera de barrica, chocolates, azcar moreno con un final un punto amarga. Cuando adquiere temperatura est mas cerca de un licor que de una cerveza. An as....excelente.

name: Rogue XS Old Crustacean Barleywine
review: Taster at Darby's Gastown. Pours a hazy copper with a tan head. Aroma is sweet fruity caramel. Taste is similar with boozy and citrusy hoppy bitterness. Despite this one is a bit too much American barleywine than I would prefer, it is quite good.

name: Rogue XS Old Crustacean Barleywine
review: Draft at the Rogue Ales Bayfront Public House, Newport, OR. Enjoyed on May 6 2018. Clear deep amber golden color with a small off-white head. Barley Winey. Herbal hops, sweetness, alcohol and some dryness. Way too herbal for me.

name: Rogue XS Old Crustacean Barleywine
review: Bottle thanks to Keith! 2013 vintage. Pours moderately clear burgundy with a modest brown head which soon recedes. Aroma is caramel, toffee, oak. Taste is toffee sweet, caramel sweet, modest-high bitterness, oak flavours throughout.

name: Rogue XS Old Crustacean Barleywine
review: From Jan 2006 Poured from 750ml bottle(room temp) a dark clear gold with a smallish head that dissipates quickly leaving just a fine layer with little lacing. The smell has a very sweet malty nose and there's also an obvious air of alcohol mixed in there but then, this *is* a BWSA so I expected that. The taste is huge! Lots of malt up front but a more than abundant note of hops(it's 120IBUs) comes into play and takes over and never relinquishes. If the malt had kept up with the infusion of hops, I'd have certainly rated this one higher than I did. Overall, this isn't exactly the most well balanced Barleywine Style Ale but I do find it a quite enjoyable brew to sip on. I recommend it.

name: Rogue XS Old Crustacean Barleywine
review: Sampled at SBWF. Small head and a clear golden color. Complex aroma and a very appealing taste. A bit alcohol in the taste but at 11.5 % it is expected. A smooth chocolate taaste.

name: Rogue XS Old Crustacean Barleywine
review: From old tasting notes. Cloudy brackish brown color. Creamy beige head. Interesting spicy Worcestershire sauce aroma. Tangy, bittersweet treacle malt flavor. Bittersweet malt/hop finish seems subdued. Long bitter aftertaste.

name: Rogue XS Old Crustacean Barleywine
review: Bottle at Cornwall Specialist Beers , Redruth , Cornwall dark brown with off white head with dark roasted malts , toffee ,raisins taste leaving a rich strong malty toffee aftertaste ,thanks to Hal the brewer at coastal for the taster .

name: Rogue Oregon Golden Ale
review: Spice citrus aroma. Murky orange colour good head and lacing. Spicy malt flavour. Fizzy palate.

name: Rogue Oregon Golden Ale
review: Aroma and flavor is mostly fruit and some mild hops. Definitely a session ale, would call this among the better that Ive had.

name: Rogue Dry Hopped St. Rogue Red Ale
review: This is the first Rogues that I tried about 3-4 years ago, and after sampling many others from them, still one of my favorites. Not overwhelmingly red, if that makes sense, and a little more hoppy than most....something to do with dry-hopping? Was also the first dry-hopped beer that I sampled. I stopped buying it though cause it's a little pricey for something that's only 5.2%, plus I've been trying to sample new things. It's still worth the price because it's one of the smoothest and crispiest red ales out there. I've been sampling some of Lagunitas Red Ales lately and love those too, but this I'd say is a little better, not as strong though.

name: Rogue Dry Hopped St. Rogue Red Ale
review: From Nov 2006 Poured from 12oz bottle(room temp) a clear red with a large head of foam that shrank slowly leaving a solid layer with some lacing. The smell is an abundant nose of sweet caramel malt. The taste is sweet caramel malt up front with some grain and just a touch of hop bitterness near and through the finish making it a sample of the style that I can enjoy and revisit without hesitation. Bottom line: Another tasty brew from Rogue that I can recommend.

name: Rogue Dry Hopped St. Rogue Red Ale
review: From old tasting notes. Deep reddish brown color. Creamy beige head. Spicy malt nose. Delicious bittersweet toasted malt flavor upfront. Complex sprucy hop finish. Long dry aftertaste very tasty and flavorful.

name: Rogue Dry Hopped St. Rogue Red Ale
review: Draft Third of a Pint at GBBF 2010 (Day 4), Earls Court, London Aug 2010 - Hazy but OK. Reddish-copper in colour. Very Hoppy; Resinous piney and earthy hops. Malty; grainy malts, roasty, caramel. Fruity; citrus grapefruit. Piney hops dominate over sweet grainy malts. Dry bitter hoppy finish. Very drinkable. Decent. (2010-08)

name: Rogue Dry Hopped St. Rogue Red Ale
review: Bought in a 22 oz. bomber. Perhaps I obtained an old bottle or it may be that I simply cannot connect with this one. I do not know. It pours a nice dark amber with a fantastic egg shell foam that lasts a good long while. Drops down from there.Scent is malty with a bit of woodiness. The beer tastes of biscuit and a light hop tone that leaves quickly. I detect a dryness with a slight bitterness at the end. Hard to try this one again.

name: Rogue Dry Hopped St. Rogue Red Ale
review: Took rating from old notes. Refreshing, medium bodied beer with a lasting frothy head. Nice hops balance. Further notes pending re-rating.

name: Rogue Santa's Private Reserve
review: Aromas caramelo y fruta madura y frutos secos Aspecto bueno espuma fina persistente En boca compleja seca y amarga ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Rogue Santa's Private Reserve
review: Dark amber colour, minimal head, fair lacing. Aroma is biscuit, red fruit, citrus hops. Medium bitterness. Lively carbonation, too high. Average.

name: Rogue Santa's Private Reserve
review: A: Slightly cloudy amber with a medium off-white head. N: Honey sweetness and plums. T: Hints of chocolates and fruit. P: Medium O: Quite nice.

name: Rogue Santa's Private Reserve
review: Bottle. 5.0%. Best before 07.19. Pours a hazy amber, with a light tan head. Sloppy lacing. Fresh aroma; malt and citrus hops. Slightly fat. Hint of pineapple. Hint of liquorice as it warms. Flavour is the same, with a light sugary, slightly tart overtone. Bitter, citrus hop finish, hint of liquorice. A bit dry. Lingering light grassy note. Overall good; well-made and -balanced; good balance between malt and hops. 08.03.19.

name: Rogue Santa's Private Reserve
review: De geur is heel lekker divers. Fruitig. Zeer weinig schuim als je uitschenkt. De smaak valt mee, maar kan niet tippen aan belgische kerstbieren.

name: Rogue Santa's Private Reserve
review: Botella, color cobrizo,espuma perfecta,fina,alta.muy resistente.Aroma pan,malta tostada,cereales,caramelo,frutos secos,galletas,frutal.Sabor lo mismo con suave amargor dominante por encima de suave dulzor.Postgusto amargor con notas frutales.Muy buena

name: Rogue Santa's Private Reserve
review: Bottle Aroma-honey, dark fruits Appearance-amber, clear, white foam Taste-medium bitter, light sour, light sweetness Palate-medium body, sticky, lively carbonation, long finish Overall- very good

name: Rogue Santa's Private Reserve
review: 355 ml bottle bought at HK Brewcraft in Central. Looks: Translucent amber red colour with a thin ring of dirt-like yeast sediments; One-quarter finger head with soapy off-white foam which fades in 30 seconds; Very good sticky lacing with zero carbonation. Aroma: Very fragrant toasty Amber malt, with strong caramel, sticky toffee, strong plums and dark fruits, floral, sugar, spices, pine, resins, earth, biscuits, lemon and grass. Taste: Close to medium sweet Amber malt, with strong grapefruits, caramel, light toffee, floral, sugar, spices, strong pine, strong resins, dry biscuits, toast, strong lemon, mid to strong bitter hops and grass. Body: Mid to light body. Quick slick and very oozy palate. Mouth Feel: Solid Amber maltyness in a slick background. Very piney and oozy hops dominate, surrounded by strong grapefruits, caramel and slightly toffee malts. Flowery with medium sweetness. Spicy earthy with strong lemon to round. Surprisingly good! Hoppiness: Floral, spices, pine, resins, earth, lemon and grass in nose, same in taste but stronger and with grapefruits; Bitterness is strong for a lasting, high astringent bitter-sweet full malty finish. After Taste: Dry. Very toasty piney oozy and strong bitter to mouth. Comments: I bought this one as an afterthought, with so many nice Xmas beer in place already and I am not really a fan of Rogue. Surprise! There's not any X'mas spicy gimmick here, just a well-made, rock solid Amber Ale with attractive dark fruity aroma, toasty dry body, and strong sharp piney oozy hops with a satisfying bitter finish. If you like tasty and hoppy Amber Ale, this is it!

name: Rogue Santa's Private Reserve
review: Bottle at Hopa. Pours deep copper, thick head. Rich amber ale with a spicy and Belgian touch. Light body, easy to drink.

name: Rogue Santa's Private Reserve
review: Fruity with loads of caramel in the nose. Taste is bitter, resin, caramel, and chocolates. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Rogue Smoke Ale
review: Smokey malt aroma. Amber clear colour great head and lacing. Malt Smokey bacon flavour. Smooth palate.

name: Rogue Smoke Ale
review: Aroma: smokey bacon, gives way to caramel malt Appearance: hazy orange with a tan lasting head and patchy lacing Flavour: lightly malty with a well balanced smokiness Palate: medium mouthfeel and finishes lightly herbal and smokey

name: Rogue Smoke Ale
review: From May 2007 This pours a clear amber with a very small head of foam that shrinks to just some scattering in the middle and has very little lacing. The smell is a light malty nose with some hoppiness. The taste on first sip has a good caramel malt flavour that is followed up quickly by some citrusy hop bitterness. Not much smoke that I can note except maybe in the finish. Further sips in and the smoke becomes more noticeable but, imho, it doesn't seem to "mesh" too well with the malt and hops. The mouthfeel is good except near the finish where it borders on being watery and the carbonation is fairly substantial. Bottom line: I think it's pretty good but it's not something I'd drink on a regular rotation. Try it and see what you think.

name: Rogue Smoke Ale
review: From old tasting notes. Hazy reddish brown color. Creamy beige head. Smoky chocolate malt nose. Interesting roasted malt flavor with an obvious smokiness that brings to mind hints of Canadian bacon and camp fires. Hoppy finish and complex maltiness.

name: Rogue Smoke Ale
review: Draft Third of a Pint at GBBF 2011 (Day 5), Earls Court, London Aug 2011 - Cloudy Orange-amber in colour. Subtle smoke aroma and flavour. Malty; roasty smokey malts, hints of roast cured ham, caramel. Hoppy; spicy and herbal hops. Medium sweet malty spicy flavour. Easy drinking. (2011-08-06)

name: Rogue Smoke Ale
review: My first go at a smoke beer. Poured at a local tavern. Appearance is dark, of course, with very little head. I smell the smoke, of course, and the first taste is the same. That comes with some coffee and a bit of chocolate. Also something earthy. Tobacco perhaps. Variety is good but Ill take an imperial stout or porter over this.

name: Rogue Smoke Ale
review: BB log, 12 oz Bottle, pours amber with one finger head. Smell and taste are heavy smoke, fire, spicy hops, grain, and malt. Im not a fan of smoked beers and this is way too much even for that style. Medium bodied. No thanks on this Rogue.

name: Rogue Smoke Ale
review: Rated from old notes. Generally a fan of smoked beers but this one did not do it for me. A flat, lifeless experience. Looks like heavy apple cider, smells like salami, tastes like a mistake.

name: Rogue Smoke Ale
review: Poured from a tiny little bottle, thanks to Mike. Very smokey, light malty sweetness, thin bodied, cardboard.

name: Rogue Smoke Ale
review: Bottle @ home. Thanks, Arturo. Old as hell nip bottle. Chunky dark amber pour with some brown and a bunch of floaters. No head. Smoke, ham, and caramel nose. A bunch of apple as well. Slight raisin sweetness on the tongue. A bunch of smoke, some savory qualities, nuts, and salt. No thanks.

name: Saxer JackFrost Winter Doppelbock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: From old tasting notes. Copper red color topped by a thick bubbly beige head. Bittersweet roasted malt flavor has an intense maltiness offset by a big spicy hop finish. Long bitter aftertaste.

name: Saxer JackFrost Winter Doppelbock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Notes from the file last updated in 2010. Poured brown with beige head. Malty aroma. Tastes of dark malt and dark fruit.

name: Saxer JackFrost Winter Doppelbock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Saxer Brewing Company--Jackfrost Doppelbock--1998 12 oz. Bottle. 8.00% ABV. (4.5 / 5.0) Nice aroma, but not hoppy. Buttery diacytel flavor combined with wine citrus malt. Big, malty and well balanced. Rich and dry, not syrupy and sweet. Sampled 12/4/1998. Saxer Brewing Company--Jackfrost Winter Doppelbock--2000 12 oz. Bottle. 8.00% ABV. (4.75 / 5.0) Clear bright deep black cherry red color. Aromatic malty toasted fruit front. Very smooth rich toasted malt body. Crisp easy maltiness with minimal sweetness and a doughy hint. Balanced mild alcohol end. Sampled 11/14/2000. Saxer Brewing Company--Portland Brewing Company--Jackfrost Winter Doppelbock--2003 12 oz. Bottle. 8.00% ABV. 24 IBUs. (4.5 / 5.0) Malt of the Earth Beer of the Month Club Selection. Clear rich deep amber red color. Malty mild hop front. Light lace & head. Smooth rich creamy caramel cherry fruit mild sweet body.
