Lingering malty mild hop end. Smooth and Rich. No EtOH bite. Sampled 4/11/2003.

name: Saxer JackFrost Winter Doppelbock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: 12oz bottle. Poured a medium and cloudy brownish color with a smaller sized off white head. Aromas of caramel, some earthiness, and some fruitiness. Tastes of caramel, some dark fruits, and the same lighter earthiness.

name: Saxer JackFrost Winter Doppelbock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Fred Fest 2009  Portland, OR Aroma: Sweet malt aroma with a very faint fruitiness lingering. This beer has aged. Appearance: Dark Brown in color, slight haze with a thin tan head. Flavor: Big dark malt flavors this beer has changed and become a sweet brew like a Barleywine with little fruity flavors. Palate: Dry Sweet fruity finish, with a Good Mouthfeel. Overall: This was a great beer to try and 15 years after it was brewed. 1994 batch this was a treat of treats. Loved the fact I got to try this. Awesome

name: Saxer JackFrost Winter Doppelbock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: 94 keg, tapped at Fredfest 09 at Hair of the Dog. Pours murky dark brown with a very brief nod in the direction of having a tan creamy head. Big doughy sweet malt nose--toffee, caramel, nuts and biscuit. Creamy, slightly sticky body. Lots of different sweet and more neutral/savory malts duking it out across the mid-palate: caramel, cookie dough, toffee, nuts, biscuit, toast, then finally at the end, some sharp dark resin to resolve against all that. Very lovely beer that obviously never quite found its niche among the cognoscenti. Of course, 15-year-old expressions arent just lying around all the time for everyone to drink, especially given this was from the first batch.

name: Saxer JackFrost Winter Doppelbock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: OK, I havent had this beer for 2 or 3 years, but when I think about it almost every week I have to rate it. Saxer and Tony Gomes got me hooked on Dopplebock. Ive tried all the benchmark beers and cant understand why they are labeled benchmark when this beer is the one I dream of! Smooth sweet malt with no edges. High octane without recognizing it. Great all malt nose that leaves you yearning for that first sip. Overall, I cant think of another beer Id rather have on a deserted island than this one, or perhaps, Tonys Pilsener.

name: Saxer JackFrost Winter Doppelbock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: I was lucky enough to get a bottle of this with some signifigant age on it. It was at least 2 years old, possibly 3 or even 4. Which ever it was, it was a nice beer with some good malty sweetness to it. The nose is a bit of wet cardboard, some whiskey notes, brown sugar and prune juice. Appearance is a deep woody brown, barley any head at all. Mouthfeel is slightly thick. Flavor is alcohol, caramel malts, and a touch winey. A nice beer for a nice cold December night playing Rock Band.

name: Saxer JackFrost Winter Doppelbock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: This beer produces a hearty aroma of nuts and hops. It is copper in color with and an off-white head. It touches the tongue as a thin solution producing and sweet nutty taste on the palate that lingers well after swallowing.

name: Saxer JackFrost Winter Doppelbock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: A bit of a one-trick pony...all sweet malt toffee and caramel...alcohol pretty well hidden...a bit thinner than I like in a doppel...but pretty drinkable. Id revisit this one again.

name: Saxer Dark Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: I used to enjoy this beer very much, it was one of my favorites- before getting serious into tasting. 1997: I remember this beer having a clean finish but having a moderate body of roasted malts. Light clear brown in color. I miss it.

name: Saxer Dark Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Saxer Brewing Company--Dark Bock 1998--12 oz. Bottle. 7.00% ABV. Doppelbock? 1999 12 oz. Bottle. 7.20% ABV. (4.0 / 5.0) Doppelbock--Clear cherry red color. Light fruit aroma leads to richly flavored smooth apple plum malt body. First taste is excellent. Dry dry finish with unexpected hop character and expected alcohol bite. Sampled 4/21/1999. 2000 12 oz. Bottle. 7.20 % ABV. (3.75 / 5.0) Doppelbock--Multiple Partial Reviews. Rich clear copper amber color. Light toasted notes. Smooth and rich without being sweet. Malty. Clean finish. Sampled 5/14/2000.

name: Saxer Dark Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Bottle 2002 vintage poured a clear reddish brown with a lingering ring of amber foam. Aromas of wet cardboard, cinnamon, molasses, dates, fig and light carmel. Palate was light bodied and crisp nwith a smooth finish. Flavors of carmel, spice, fig, mollasses and a hint of cardboard with a smooth lingering malty spiced finish.

name: Saxer Dark Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: bottle. ugly pour, looks like prune juice mixed with quik with hardly any head, just kind of filmy with a ring of bubbles around the glass. smells like sugar babies, grape taffy, and a bit of smoke with just a cupful of cardboard. how old is this thing? definitely has an oxidized flavor, caramel, soft wood, a bit of plum/prune. not a bad beer, but it seems like this would have better fresh. 1 6 6 2 12 apparently it is an 02 bottle.

name: Saxer Dark Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: This was my first Dark Bock, but its smoother then I expected. Alittle sweet but not over powering.Well balanced so you cant taste the Alcohol..Very good

name: Saxer Dark Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: First Saxer from the great beer state of Oregon. Dark, hoppy, little sweet undertone. Chocolately, very nice beer. PNW hasnt disappointed yet. A little watery for what I was expecting. Overall a very good beer. Again, if this is one you havent had you should try this brewery.

name: Saxer Dark Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: A dark malt liqour? some things were just never meant to be, take for example the upcoming movie Soul Plane, I mean, what the hell was the guy that came up with that idea thinking? But more importantly, dont buy this beer.

name: Saxer Dark Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: I have no clue what a "dark bock" is supposed to be, other than a darker color of a bock. I've had plenty of Saxer's regular bock and even their dopplebock (they're often on sale) so I thought I'd try this one (also on sale < grin >). Bottle looks a lot like their regular bock label only...darker. 7.2% alcohol by volume "microbrewed malt liquor." No date code. From back label: "Dark Bock - A classic Bavarian Dunkel Bock brewed with imported German malts and hops. Dark Bock has deliciously rich, roasted malt flavors with a spicy hop profile.... Saxer brews world-class Bocks using forty percent more malts than other beers and then cold conditions them for a full six to eight weeks." Um, sure. Pours dark brown with not much head, but what's there seems to stick around rather well. Not much lace but there's a ring floating in the beer that's about a half an inch thick that doesn't want to go anywhere. Smells really malty with a hint of spicy hops. Tastes malty. I can't detect any hops at all, but something is offsetting the malt. The high alcohol content is well hidden. There's a hint of caramel with some fruity undertones, but I can't quite put my finger on it. Mouthfeel is actually rather watery. Plenty of foam, but there's very little aftertaste. It's lacking the crispness I expect from a good bock. Drinkability...eh. I could have a few of these and I'll buy it again if it's on sale, but it's nothing special.

name: Saxer Dark Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Ok bough in a six pack of 12 oz brown long necks at the "cheapo canned food warehouse" place..$3.99..a little past spring but here goes.. Wow this is one handsome looking beer, not pretty this has a manly look to it! A dark ruby/garnet red with a lovelly off white head..that goies but leaves some nice lacing..beautiful. Smell is rather a step down from the looks but it seems to be reasonably malty and fresh. Taste is malty but there is a "grapfruit" hop flavour too..I cannot taste the high alcohol though..well hidden. Was rather dissapointed by the mouthfeel it ended half way over my tongue then nothing,,feel cheated! A drinkable enough beer..but could have been way better.

name: Saxer Dark Bock
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Nice dark brown color,small bubbly tan head that last a short time.malty sweet aroma with a faint hint of fruit and hops.The taste is sweet roasted malt with a slight caramel note and mild hop presence,and a pretty decent chocolate as well.The after taste was mostly malt and chocolate with a mild hop character at the tail end.Nice feel in the mouth not to thin but just right for the way i like it anyway.IMO this is a pretty decent bock and well worth having quite a few around and also very easy to drink considering the alcohol manages to stay nicely hidden and never really makes a dramatic appearance.

name: Saxer Lemon Lager
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: From old tasting notes. Bright yellow gold color. Huge rocky white head. Intense lemon aroma. Tangy lemon and malt flavor. Little character or depth. More like a shandy.

name: Saxer Lemon Lager
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: 355ml bottle tried many years ago poured a pale golden color with a finger of white head that left a few spots of lacing on the glass. Aroma was lemon and cereal grains with some pleasant hops. Taste was nice malty sweetness with light hop bitterness and lemon. Was a nicely balanced brew with well balanced flavors and quite enjoyable.

name: Saxer Lemon Lager
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: I had this beer on a tour of the northwest u.s.a. in the late 90s. I have enjoyed beers all around the world, and this was by far one of the best in memory. It did not! Taste like lemonade you idiots. It was crisp, clean, refreshing and went very well with grilled salmon steaks. It was the only beer Ive ever wokeup in the morning in the majestic mountains of durango, colorado and thought....mmmm Id rather have this than coffee . Now Ivereturned and am trying to locate this beer only to find it extinct....so sad.

name: Saxer Lemon Lager
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Saxer Brewing Company--Lemon Lager--1999 12 oz. Bottle. 4.50% ABV. (3.25 / 5.0) Fruit Beer--Lemon. Clear bright straw golden color. Strong, not citrusy, lemon aroma and front backed by sweet malt body. Lemon declines after a few sips leaving nicely balanced light crisp brew. Lemon clean finish. 7/16/1999. Saxer Brewing Company--Portland Brewing Company--Lemon Lager--2003 Clear 12 oz. Bottle. 4.50% ABV. 20 IBUs? (4.0 / 5.0) Mild white lace head. Clear bright thin lemon golden color. Zesty floral lemon mild hop front. Sweet tangy rich lemon mild Pils malt body. Dry sweet overwhelming lemon citrus mild hop end. Tasty. Sampled 11/12/2004.

name: Saxer Lemon Lager
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Yellowish lager. Nose is a bushel full of lemons. Taste is smooth lemon, malt and citrus. Very tasty. One of the better beers Ive had in this style. Rated 5/11/04

name: Saxer Lemon Lager
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: The best of the lemons, better then Sams or anyone elses Ive tried. A great summer beer, light and refreashing

name: Saxer Lemon Lager
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Name: Lemon Lager Date: 06/01/1995 Mode: Draft Source: Taco Mac, Sandy Springs clear lemon yellow, sudsy head, high carbonation, fresh lemon aroma with a refreshing lemon taste that lasts through the aftertaste Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 16/20 Rating: 3.4/5.0 Score: ***/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Saxer Lemon Lager
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Bottle - sicky sweet lemony dishsoap aroma. Looks like a Bud Light. The flavor ... the flavor. What the hell are they thinking? This is just horrible.

name: Saxer Lemon Lager
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Bottle Pours a straw pale yellow. Hazy and with a nice full white head. Dry faint aroma of leamins and light malts. Flavor was lemony but like gatorade. Thin and light weght.

name: Saxer Lemon Lager
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Bottle: Very very pale yellow color, big puffy retentive white head. The nose is a bit tart with some lemon peel and extract sweetness, a touch of ricey notes too. The flavor is a bit odd with some underlying poor lager along with a slightly sweet lemon extract flavor. The finish has a light body and a bit of pleasing lemonade characteristics. Just a bad combination, more like a gimick or an alcopop.

name: Saxer Pilsner
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Saxer Brewing Company--Pilsner Seasonal--1998 12 oz. Bottle. 5.50% ABV. (4.75 / 5.0) Rich straw golden color. Characteristic Pilsner, but bigger and hoppier than others. Sampled 9/15/1998. Saxer Brewing Company--Pilsner--1999 12 oz. Bottle. 5.50% ABV. (4.75 / 5.0) Rich clear light golden color. Good head intros strong Saaz front, but rich light textured really makes brew with its smooth light sweet ester cream body. Finishes clean with a light spicy hop note. Sampled 6/3/1999.

name: Saxer Pilsner
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Pours a gold color in the glass. Good head. Nose and taste of pines, grass, spices and hops. Rated 1/24/2000

name: Saxer Pilsner
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Pale clear golden color with lots of head & sticky lacing. The aroma is fruity, malty with some pilsner malts. The flavor is balanced, a little tangy but pilsnery. Not too bad!

name: Saxer Pilsner
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Golden and still with nice solid head. Very malty tones with an odd stringent, melon-like character.

name: Saxer Pilsner
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Loose, soapy white head and golden body loaded with planktonic matter. Nose is wheaty and nutty with dark honey and a hint of grass. Spicy, hoppy quality with some wood, raw nuts, and more honey. Very organic flavor. Id call this a hybrid pils. Very unique. I dig this.

name: Saxer Pilsner
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: This one pours a clear yellow, or should I say a golden color. The head is white and rocky, and the lace adheres to my glass to stay. Nose is of freshly roasted malt, and hops to back it up. For a bottled beer, this smells remarkably fresh. Taste is what it says on the bottle "Classic Bohemian Style Golden Lager". Very drinkable, nice for a hot sunny day, but as far as bohemian pilsners go, this is right in there with Czechvar and Pilsner Urquel. Good, but nothing new., Brisk roasted malt followed by a crisp hop balancing act. Another good pilsner.

name: Saxer Pilsner
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: I like this Pilsner. Real malty nice hoppy flavor, too. Delicious. Good American Pilsner.

name: Saxer Pilsner
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Dark straw color, quickly dissipating head, sporadic lace and hazy for a Bo. Pils. Malty and floral hop aroma w/ the slightest hint of diacetyl. Malty start w/ a hop flavor and bitter finish. This bottle is slightly oxidized, but not horribly so. Carbonation is a little high and prickly for Bo Pils and my taste, but the overall body is a medium feel. Very slightly astringent, but doesn't really take away from my overall impression of this beer.

name: Saxer Pilsner
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: Pretty good as far as pilsners go. Aroma is all saaz, flavor is slightly sweet malt with saaz, finish is a pleasant saaz. In other words, everything a Pilsner should be.

name: Saxer Pilsner
brewery: Portland Brewing Company (Cervecera Costa Rica - FIFCO)
review: I didn't mind this too much. Not stinky like most pilsners, and pretty easy to drink. Not bad at all. Goes well with Cheeze-Its, but will probably go well with real food too.

name: Widmer Brothers Hefeweizen
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Backlog, bottle that pours a hazy orange color with medium head. Nose and flavor of bubblegum, banana, lemon zest, wheat, and grain. Lighter to medium bodied with fruity finish.

name: Widmer Brothers Hefeweizen
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Low formation foam, low density and very short duration. Liquid is yellow, very cloudy, with a juicy aspect. Aroma is very poor. I hardly could feel the hops and the wheat notes. Even the yeast were hidden. On mouth, things get better. The wheat comes in a shy way, then the hops but not truly aromatic, just a pleasant bitterness. The aftertaste is the best part. Little bit higher bitterness and the wheat taste. Not even fat the best American Wheat I have ever tried, but it is refreshing for hot days. Only worths in a very good price, otherwise, id prefer other brewries. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Widmer Brothers Hefeweizen
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Low formation foam, low density and very short duration. Liquid is yellow, very cloudy, with a juicy aspect. Aroma is very poor. I hardly could feel the hops and the wheat notes. Even the yeast were hidden. On mouth, things get better. The wheat comes in a shy way, then the hops but not truly aromatic, just a pleasant bitterness. The aftertaste is the best part. Little bit higher bitterness and the wheat taste. Not even fat the best American Wheat I have ever tried, but it is refreshing for hot days. Only worths in a very good price, otherwise, id prefer other brewries.

name: Widmer Brothers Hop Jack
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Still digging through old note pads/books. I used to drink a lot of this some years ago when hoppy beers werent always easy to find. All I noted was roast malt and a lot of hop. Well a lot of hop for 7 or 8 years ago. I remember loving the bottle and label - not to mention the beer. For me it was right in there with the old bottle conditioned Bridgeport IPA. If I found it, I would drink it again.

name: Widmer Brothers Hop Jack
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Very typereal American pale ale with great persistent foam. Aroma of fruit reminiscent of apple and good hops. The taste is full-bodied, with soft fruit tones, light citrus and pleasant long hops bitterness.

name: Widmer Brothers Hop Jack
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Retired? Draft at the brewpub. Clear golden color. Aroma of light grass. Taste is plain but balanced.

name: Widmer Brothers Hop Jack
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company, Ltd.--Hop Jack Pale Ale--1998 12 oz. Bottle. 5.50% ABV. (4.25 / 5.0) Pale Ale--Excellent Hop Character. More like an IPA. Amber color is more typical of a pale, but intense floral hop aroma and rich body are definitely IPA. Very good IPA. Sampled 10/30/1998. Widmer Brothers Brewing Company, Ltd.--Hop Jack Northwest Pale Ale--2000 12 oz. Bottle. 5.00% ABV. (4.0 / 5.0) Pale Ale--Rich slightly hazy amber golden color. Light sediment. Rich flowery hop aroma. Medium rich caramel malt body. Mellow mild sweet hop flavor. Ends light with mild hop profile. Classic NW Pale Ale. Sampled 4/7/2000. Widmer Brothers Brewing Company, Ltd.--Pale Ale--Hop Jack Pale Ale 200112 oz. Bottle. 5.00% ABV--38 IBUs. (4.25 / 5.0) Pale Ale --Slightly hazy rich golden color. Delicate 38 IBUs floral Cascade hop front. Doughy sweet caramel NW malty body. Clean mild and crisp. Balanced mild malt citrus Tettnang hop end with spicy IPA note. Sampled 10/24/2001.

name: Widmer Brothers Hop Jack
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Nice pale golden coloured body with a white head. Medium-bodied; Strong assertive cascade hops up front with some mild malt and a bit of cardboard behind. Aftetaste shows some nuts, sugars and a lot of lingering hops. Overall, a nice beer - definitely worth trying if you can find it! I sampled this on draught at Growlers Pub South in St. Louis, MO on 13-August-2005.

name: Widmer Brothers Hop Jack
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: 1/19/08 On draught at the Portland brewhouse. Aroma is all C-hops with a very faint sweet malt background to balance. Appearance is clear gold with a low white head. Flavor is earthy bittering hops forward with a light sweet malt balance again. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium/high carb texture. Overall, not bad, but fairly typical for the style.

name: Widmer Brothers Hop Jack
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: On tap at Widmer Gashaus in PDX--Poured nice copper-amber body with a medium white head. Nose of sticky, floral hops and mild malts, Well hopped, fruity and floral. I coudl drink this all day and night. Nice beer

name: Widmer Brothers Hop Jack
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Had this beer on 8/2/1999. Color is a hazy gold with good carbonation and light head. Aroma is light and but hoppy. Taste is hoppy and smooth. It starts with a medium body that goes down very smooth and a nice hop flavor coming on. The finish is this hop flavor backed by a light hop bitterness. Its not the best pale Ive ever had but I do like it

name: Widmer Brothers Hop Jack
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: On draught at the Widmer brewpub in downtown Portland. Sampled during ABA Beer Tour 07. Pours a golden pale amber brew with a thin white head that dissolves quickly to a fine film. Aroma of light bready malt, lemon and citrus zest, with a touch of mango. Taste is well carbonated, medium bodied, with fruity malt flavors with citrus character. Finish is light, crisp with a slight citrus aftertaste.

name: Widmer Brothers Hop Jack
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Widmer Hop Jack Pale Ale is an outstanding example of American Pale Ale that showcases hop aromas and flavors. Unlike many over the top APAs, that tattoo your taste buds with an all out acid wash of hop bitterness, Widmer takes a little different approach. Widmer brews German beer styles, and make use of malts such as Vienna, Munich, and Carapils, that you will not normally find in APA. These malts join the grain bill of pale and caramel malts, which are the traditional malts used in the brewing of APA. Widmer Hop Jack is hopped with three different hop varieties including two PNW classics; Cascades, and Centennials, as well as Tettnager, for bittering. Five malts, and three hop varieties, make for a very well crafted and flavorful APA. I really enjoy this beer. Widmer Hop Jack pours to a hazy, deep pale golden color with a thick white head, and a moderate amount of carbonation. The nose on this beer is wonderful. Very fragrant, zesty, citric hop aromas flood the nose. This is paired with a nice backdrop of biscuit like malt aromas, but the hops really shine in the nose. The palate is firm, with very good pale and caramel malt flavors paired with just a touch of grainy malt flavor as well. Widmer Hop Jack finishes with more good malt flavor up front, then ends with a nice herbal/spicy hop bite that slightly lingers.

name: Widmer Brothers Springfest
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company, Ltd.--Springfest Alt--2001 12 oz. Bottle. 4.90% ABV. (3.75 / 5.0) Alt Bier--Clear thin copper color. Light floral hop mildly toasted front. Thin dry body with light sweet cherry caramel toast flavors. Prominent spicy roasted hop end. Rich different thin flavor. Sampled 6/21/2001. Widmer Brothers Brewing Company, Ltd.--Springfest Alt Beer. 2000 12 oz. Bottle. 4.90% ABV--42 IBUs. (3.0 / 5.0) Alt Bier--Clear bright rich copper red color. Light hop flavor with nice clean malt taste. Slight toasted citrus flavor and refreshing body. Slightly bland, but clean and smooth. Missing hop end. Sampled 3/31/2000. Widmer Brothers Brewing Company, Ltd.--Springfest Original Alt Beer. 2002 12 oz. Bottle. 4.90% ABV--42 IBUs. (4.0 / 5.0) Alt Bier--Light sediment. Clear dark copper color. Light brown lacy head. Crisp malt mild floral front. Toasted smooth caramel biscuit body. Light cherry citrus sweetness. Mild clean crusty citrus hop end. Sampled 4/8/2002.

name: Widmer Brothers Springfest
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Had this beer on 4/17/2000. Aroma is a light citrus hop scent. Color is a nice golden brown with light carbonation and head. Taste is sharp, rich and bitter. Starting with a medium body it goes down with a rich malt feel that is sharp on the end. The finish is this sharp feel turning into a bitterness. Its not well balanced and doesnt make for a good spring brew.

name: Widmer Brothers Springfest
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Widmer Springfest pours to a beautiful, bright, deep amber/light brown color with a nice stiff white head, and a lively amount of carbonation. The nose on this beer is very inviting with some nice herbal/spicy hop aromas paired with some light sweet malt aromas. The palate is soft with good clean, slighty sweet and nutty malt flavors on the tongue. The body on this beer is just so round and smooth, making it a very clean and drinkable beer. Widmer Springfest finishes with a short, snappy, vibrant burst of herbal hop bitterness that slightly lingers. This is a well done domestic example of a very local German beer style, altbier. What I love about alt bier is that wonderful balance of malt and hop flavors and aromas. Nice balance of both in the nose, a malty body, and then that snappy burst of herbal hop bitterness makes this just a wonderful beer to enjoy. Springfest is not quite up to snuff with the Germans, but this is a nice beer.

name: Widmer Brothers Springfest
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: From the bottle this brew pours a deep red with mahogany tones and a small off-white head. Very dry grain, not overly sweet, but very earthy with a medium bitter finish. Light caramel notes show as it warms but doesnt last long as the flavors finishes bitter.

name: Widmer Brothers Springfest
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: I disagree that this is "assertively hoppy" but it's probably not the first time. This is easy to drink but not something I would want to drink on a regular basis. It is smooth and refreshing though.

name: Widmer Brothers Springfest
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Brown with decent off white head. Acidic nose. Vinegary flavor. I obviously had a bad one.

name: Widmer Brothers Springfest
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Worty, malty aroma. Bit of molasses and fruity hops. Nice ruby-brown color with light tan foamy, lacing head. Medium-high carb, kind of fizzy with medium watery body. Malts in the mouth, but not sweet - lagerish. Prominent bitterness/nutty finish and after - sticks on the back of the tongue. Definitely not as good as German altbiers.

name: Widmer Brothers Springfest
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: pours a kinda of a copper color with decent head, malty aroma and taste balanced nicely with hops

name: Widmer Brothers Springfest
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Medium brown color, medium head. Nicely hopped and malted Alt ale. Finish is crisp. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.Nice beer.

name: Widmer Brothers Springfest
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: I thought this was rather modestly hopped actually. Grains were very apparent (especially in the bouquet) and tasted rather "unfinished" balanced with the of malt. Although I find it rather refreshing to find a beer so prevalent in grains, this didn't seem to blend well with the rest of the beer.

name: Widmer Brothers Wildwood
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: 12oz bottle. Poured a deep golden color. Heavy red apple aroma. Taste is like a thick rich apple champagne with a mild tartness.

name: Widmer Brothers Wildwood
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Pours a dark golden yellow color. Aromas of apples and other fruit. Flavor crisp with a nice dry finish.

name: Widmer Brothers Wildwood
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: This is the first cider I have rated, so I dont have much reference. This thing was just found aging for a few years, more accidently aged, or misplaced, but still really nice flavor. Aroma is lightly spicy, more apple and less alcohol. The flavor on this was well mixed together, very smooth. Rating this against beer is tough, but i guess i would rather rate this brew better than some shitty macros, but I would never take this over a craft brew.

name: Widmer Brothers Wildwood
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Definitely taste the "unfermented apple juice" flavor that supposedly composes 20% of this. Almost a cherry undertone. Mix of sweet and dry. Takeable, but unremarkable. Maybe give me something I can remember next time. On the flip side, it didnt scorch my throat like dry ciders sometimes do.

name: Widmer Brothers Wildwood
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Appears like a carbonated apple juice. Fresh apple nose. Nice tart flavor with a bitter finish. Good cider.

name: Widmer Brothers Wildwood
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Pale and effervescent, smells like cheap wine, reminded me of Boones Farm. But really and truly not bad in the taste, a bitter aftertaste though.

name: Widmer Brothers Wildwood
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Smells like a tasty apple wine. Good apple flavor with a crisp and clean aftertaste.

name: Widmer Brothers Wildwood
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Fresh apple aroma, nice sweetness and a nice touch of tart. Smooth and rounded, a nice morning starter.

name: Widmer Brothers Wildwood
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Cider. Whoohoo. Liked it more than I expected, but it's still hard cider and not really beer. Nose is very apple, flavor is very apple (it's an apple cider, duh). Also has a sugary sweetness. Fizzed, a bit spritzer-like. Surprised I actualy sorta liked it, didn't at all expect to.

name: Widmer Brothers Wildwood
brewery: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Clear apple juice body. Aroma is sweet apple. Taste is of lightly fizzy apple juice. Bleah -- I don't need spiked carbonated apple juice -- I'll just stick with the apple juice.

name: Stoneys Beer
review: By far and away this has to be the worst beer made in the U.S. Its embarrassing to even call it beer. It smells like garbage just like it tastes.

name: Stoneys Beer
review: bottle from the local rip and run in Warren, Pa. right out of the bottle, its has a weird glut like smell and taste. also in the mouth is metal. this is total crap.

name: Stoneys Beer
review: Pours a light yellow with a thin white head. Slight metallic taste. Not the greatest beer Ive had but I have had worse. At $6.99 for a 24 pack, I had to try it.

name: Stoneys Beer
review: 12 ounce bottle. Pours a clear yellow color with a large white head. A light sweet grainy nose. The flavor is light mostly clean malts, honey, cereal. Ok lager. Metallic.

name: Stoneys Beer
review: Thanks to someone for sharing this at bu11zeyes 10,000th tasting in April 2012. Very light yellow pour with a white head. The aroma and flavor are nothing but grain and are not good. Thin mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

name: Stoneys Beer
review: Bottle from Fratto. Hazy color, not clear at all. Smells a bit sour. Tastes sour an bitter. Not my cup 'o beer.

name: Stoneys Beer
review: Can courtesy Fratto. Pours a clear light straw yellow color with a light bubbly head. Aroma is bready, sour grains, biscuit and tart notes. Flavor is bready, sour bready, and sweet. Grainy. Not great. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Stoneys Beer
review: To all those Stoneys haters on this site, I present you with this Haiku in honor of my new favorite beer: four ninety nine twelve pack Sure as hell cant beat that, man tastes delicious too

name: Stoneys Beer
review: On tap at Genes Place in Oakland (Pittburgh, PA). I always found this beer to taste better on draft than in the bottle. A good old fashion cheap american pale lager.

name: Stoneys Beer
review: Golden copper color with a light rim head and no lace, light ascending carbonation bubbles. The taste is caramel malt cut toward the finish with harsh carbonation. Typical of big box beers, perhaps a little more going on. Probably good for slugging.

name: Stoneys Black and Tan
review: From a can, beer pours (in Chimay glass) a dark brown-red that light can penetrate. No black or tan detected - did they mix? Head is white and dissipates quickly. Aroma is of licorice and molasses. Flavor is of halloween candy flashbacks - the black cow, the candy corn with a dry, slighty bitter finish. A nicely different brew, but nothing special to keep drinking it. Sampled at 71 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Stoneys Black and Tan
review: A B&T but not a psecial one! tatse was there but not strong & lacking something. Not below average but not far above either!

name: Stoneys Black and Tan
review: I really wanted to love this beer. I thought maybe Jones was finally gearing up to challenge Yuengling with a good Black & Tan. Unfortunately, it didn't live up to my expectations. Frankly, it tastes like Stoney's Lager with caramel color added. I'm detecting very little malt character...one would expect some black and chocolate malt in a black & tan but it's not really apparent. No noticeable hops flavor. I guess this is a fair training beer for those wanting to venture into the world of craft beers. Close your eyes and you'd think you were drinking any domestic lager.

name: Iron City Beer
review: 26 ounce can at the house. Smells sweet. Pale yellow in color. Small white head. Tastes sweet and grainy. Light bodied and easy to drink. Grain aftertastes. Just a lawnmower beer. Good though. Cheers!

name: Iron City Beer
review: 12oz bottle. Pours a dehydrated piss yellow with some white suds. Aroma is corn, grain, and yeast. Taste is watery, sweet grain and some acrid yeast. Light body. Medium carbonation. Watery.

name: Iron City Beer
review: Poured from 12 oz bottle into pint glass. A thin white head drops quickly with little to no lacing. Color is clear gold with mild streaming carbonation. Aroma is mild with grain and water dominating. Mouthfeel is light with a dry finish. Flavor is also mild just some sweet toasted grain and light hop presence. Overall: a decent beer for eating with a burger or pizza, but nothing exciting here

name: Iron City Beer
review: 12 ounce bottle at Primanti original. No idea what the color is. Drank from the bottle. A basic pale lager that goes well with ok but you know you should try it food. It was cold.

name: Iron City Beer
review: Here is a belated review for you all. Last drank this in the late 70's and early 80's. A river rat punk rock favorite based on how much party liquid you could get for your money, about $4 a case in returnable bottles. Aptly noted as "swill" by those readily chugging the stuff. An awful, bottom of the low cost beers made in the Ohio River Valley, that's why tastes like it was shipped on barges. Iron City is appropriate given its hideous metallic aftertaste. At least when you accidently "swill spill" it is no major loss!

name: Iron City Beer
review: Can. Pale yellow color with a thin white head. The aroma is corn with a malty taste. Ok big brewery lager.

name: Iron City Beer
review: Bottle. Pours a sparkling light amber color with fizzy tan head. Aroma of grain and corn. Sweet flavor with minimal hop presence, mostly just sweet. Light bodied. Pretty much exactly what you would expect.

name: Iron City Beer
review: Really weak, really bland lager. Kinda fun find considering its history, but not much to speak of as a drink.

name: Iron City Beer
review: I had one of these in a Penguins bar in Cranberry, PA. Some head dent named Troy was yammering about how Gretzky was overrated and he kept guzzling Iron Cities. So I tried one and decided to get on the first plane with a free seat to get far away from this beer and this metro area forever. Turns out I ended up in Yellowknife and drank whale blubber smoothies and both were much better. Thanks, Troy!

name: Iron City Beer
review: Taste: crisp, grain and malt, some hop character. Nose is mild, fermented cereal grains. Gold, clear, some foam head with delicate lace. Lite body. Old fashioned slightly water beer.

name: Victory HopDevil
review: A well designed beer. It has a slight fruity start with a hard bitter end. It's a beer that encourages you to try stronger hop recipes.

name: Victory HopDevil
review: Rocky light brown head stayed on a hazy caramel coloured still body. Pine, caramel, resin & spices aroma. Medium bodied, nicely carbonated on the front, creamy over the tongue & sharp on the back with a cloying aft. Caramel, demerara, resin, malt, hops, grapefruit & spicy tastes with tangy finish.

name: Victory HopDevil
review: Bottle sample at a tasting at Yoav's place. Clear golden with white head. The aroma has notes of malt, citrus, old hops. The flavor is mild sweet and mild bitter with notes of old hops, malt, caramel, not fresh. Medium-bodied.

name: Victory HopDevil
review: On tap at BrewDog Brum. Pours clear amber with off-white head. Kinda bready nose. Tastes bit hoppy some candies, hmm, where are the hops?

name: Victory HopDevil
review: Bottle at a tasting. Hazy orange golden. Aroma of caramel, fruity hops and marmalade. Sweet, malty, caramel, tropical fruits, quite boozy, slightly stale with strong bitterness. Medium-full bodied, soft carbonation. Old school stuff, not very exciting.

name: Victory HopDevil
review: Bottle from BrewDog Online. It pours dark orangey - amber with a decent beige head. The aroma is sticky, oily, resinous, piney, grapefruit, orange marmalade, fruit cordial and toffee. The taste is dry, brash bitterness, punchy, resinous, piney, oily, rawness, pithy, zesty, grapefruit, orange rind, dull toffee, kick of alcohol, green and peppery spice with a drying finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Good old school West Coast number. A blast from the past, but in a good way.

name: Victory HopDevil
review: Bottle from BrewDog Online. Clear auburn with very little head. Barley sugar aroma. Earthy barley sugar, toffee, bitter stone fruit and rye.

name: Victory HopDevil
review: On tap@ Taproom Jungbusch. Bernsteinfarben klar. Cremiger Schaum. Blumen, Tulpen, Hopfen und Karamell in der Nase. Vielversprechend. Antrunk angebrannter Karamell und Hopfen. Irgendwas fruchtiges ist auch dabei. Stachelbeere? Blumen im Abgang. Endlich mal wieder ein IPA das aus der Reihe fllt.

name: Victory HopDevil
review: Pours clear reddish with a thick white head. Aroma of resinous hops. Taste has cedar and some grassy notes. Palate has grassy notes on the nose as well as earthy resin. Not bad.

name: Victory HopDevil
review: Mein bislang normalstes Bier von der Brauerei und nicht zu verwechseln mit dem Victory Hop Devil vom 1516 Brauhaus in Wien. Es ist ein schn fruchtig-frisches IPA mit netten floralen Einschlgen, das aber in der Masse an IPAs untergeht.

name: Victory Prima Pils
review: Sehr gutes Pils. Sehr harmonisch mit fein herber Note, milder Bitterkeit in guter Balance mit einer angenehmen Malznote. Benchmark Pils.

name: Victory Prima Pils
review: Bottle. Prominent yeasty pilsner aroma and flavor. Quite bitter with bitter aftertaste. Like a fortified pilsner, compared to Pilsner Urquell or even Heineken, despite relatively low ABV of 5.3%.

name: Victory Prima Pils
review: Pours a hazy straw color, with a small head and no lacing. Nose is very breath with lemon and pine complementing. Taste follows with plenty of bread, cereal, lemongrass, and light earthiness. Finish is bitter with just a smidge of biscuits. Much bolder than most pilsners...more like a bready pale ale which is fine with me.

name: Victory Prima Pils
review: Hazy amber with a thick fluffy head. Aroma of bread and grassy hops. Taste has light bread influences as well a floral notes. Palate has grassy notes on the nose. Good beer.

name: Victory Prima Pils
review: Flasche 0,355l: Helles Gold, deutliche Trbung, wenig eher flchtiger mittelporiger Schaum; fruchtig-frische Nase, fruchtige Hopfennoten, grne Frchte, Sternfrucht, grnes Getreide, Malz, Hefenoten, angenehme fruchtig-malzige Bitterkeit; sehr frischer + fruchtiger Krper, krftige frische Hopfennoten, Zitrusnoten, Grapefruit, Grapefruitzest, Malz, grnes Getreide, cremig, krftige Kohlensure, Hefenoten; angenehmer fruchtig-trockener Nachgangmit Hopfenaromen

name: Victory Prima Pils
review: Keg, Blind Tiger. Pale gold, bubbly head. Soft cereal and malt aroma. Clean taste. It's all rather subtle, and it's a decent pilsner but a bit anonymous. OK.

name: Victory Prima Pils
review: 6 3 7 3 14 Bottle shared courtesy of my Mum. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma of grain, light fruity hops, citrus and light malt. Flavour is above light sweet and bitter. Light bodied with moderate carbonation.

name: Victory Prima Pils
review: De Craftbeer-shop.com. En copa Teku. Jugando a Avernum 6. Correcta sin destacar. Limpia, carbonatada, con nota herbales, sabor a pilsen industrial buenecita y ligera acidez

name: Victory Prima Pils
review: 16 ounce draft at Winking Lizard Canton Ohio Smell the grain. Yellow in color. Thin white head Film on glass. Strong grain taste and after taste. Pretty smooth and light bodied. Decent beer. Cheers!

name: Victory Prima Pils
review: 1 oz can. Nice subtle pine aroma. Pours a hazy yellow in the glass. Nice bitter taste with malt in the background. The hops bring a little citrus to the party. Nice clean finish with a bit of bitter.

name: Victory St. Boisterous Hellerbock
review: Bottle from backlog notes. Pours a slightly hazy orange color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have toasted, bready malts, hints of caramel, floral hops, light fruity notes, mild spicy hops, soft finish, just ok.

name: Victory St. Boisterous Hellerbock
review: Some crisp barley aroma. Easy drinking. Golden pour with OK head. Light bitter finish. Tap at Churchkey

name: Victory St. Boisterous Hellerbock
review: Draft. Clear yellow color, medium white head. Aroma of grainy straw. Taste has cereal, straw, subtle white pepper. OK.

name: Victory St. Boisterous Hellerbock
review: Julio's not there when this was taste therefore she doesn't have any opinion on this overall it is okay don't have to go my way never have it again

name: Victory St. Boisterous Hellerbock
review: Draft at WOB Viera. Pale straw-yellow with no head. Not much in the aroma. Flavor is almost cloyingly sweet with little in the way of hops. Alcohol a bit too up-front. Meh.

name: Victory St. Boisterous Hellerbock
review: Rated on 5-17-2010 at 800 Degrees Pizza in Fort Wayne, IN. This draft beer pours a medium sized off-white head that mostly diminishes, transparent orange body, minimal carbonation, and spotty lacing. The aroma is malty, sweet, citrus hops, and light fruit. The taste is sweet, lightly bitter, malty citrus hops, and fruit. The palate is soft carbonation and this beer is medium bodied. Overall, at 7.3% ABV this beer is easy to drink and I would drink this again.

name: Victory St. Boisterous Hellerbock
review: Pours clear, amber with a small, quick head. Grainy malt aroma, apple. Taste has notes of fruit, honey, sweet grains. Older bottle, slightly oxidized..... But still, pretty decent.

name: Victory St. Boisterous Hellerbock
review: On tap at Joe Canals West Deptford. Appearance: Crystal clear golden body with a creamy light tan head. Aroma: Hops are prominent, but very mild at the same time adding a floral and slightly spicy presence. There is a fruity aroma I cant figure out, perhaps apples, with sweet malts to balance things out. Taste: The malt base is prominent, acting as a sweet foundation of caramel to support the dry floral hops that dry out the finish. Apples are noted throughout. Palate: Medium bodied, lively carbonation. Overall: This is a very good beer, it would be great on a warm Spring day!

name: Victory St. Boisterous Hellerbock
review: Growler from Canals in Lawrenceville, New Jersey. Pours a bright honey gold color with a medium-sized bite head and lovely clinging lace. Fresh grainy malt aroma with notes of citrus and honey. First sip yields a crisp sweet malt taste that displays remarkable balance and flavor. Very simple yet elegant and right on for the "maibock" style. The finish displays notes of honey, vanilla and citrus mixed with peppery hops.

name: Victory St. Boisterous Hellerbock
review: At brew pub. Pours pale gold with white head. Floral, honey, lemon. Moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Carbonated, but with creamy undertones.

name: Victory Festbier
review: Bottle from Nassau. Mild and nutty with some nice malts and apricot creeping in. Not a huge fan of the style but solid effort from Victory

name: Victory Festbier
review: Bottle from a Wine Rack in Retford. Pours amber with a cream head. Fruity malt aroma. The taste has sweet stewed fruits and toast.

name: Victory Festbier
review: Glad to see some fall seasonals hitting the market, as I am just about summer-beered out. It seems hard to mess up this style, and most marzens seem pretty close in quality. This is probably in my top 25% for Oktoberfests. Good sweet caramel flavor that's not overly rich. Mild hop to balance it out. I am really liking the feel, which is probably the best part. Something that I'll most likely get again, just not this year as I want to try a lot of new samples in this style.

name: Victory Festbier
review: 355ml bottle (5.6%) at home on 1 Jul 2017, from Good Spirits Company, West Nile Street, Glasgow: floral, malty aroma, amber brown, good creamy head, a few streams of bubbles, raisin toffee flavour with a bit of honey, oily, sweet.

name: Victory Festbier
review: Deep, amber color. Medium sized, off-white head. Toasted malt and herbal hops in the aroma. Sweet, malty taste with balancing, hoppy bitterness. Could be less sweet.

name: Victory Festbier
review: Pours a clear reddish amber color with a small tight beige head and good retention. Very good lacing. Caramel malts aroma. Sweet lager with strong caramel flavor. Smooth and clean. Best Victory brew I've had.

name: Victory Festbier
review: Deep amber with small head and the aroma of roasted malt. Taste is roasted and caramelized malts. Really decent Oktoberfest brew.

name: Victory Festbier
review: Super grassy, this one is probably over-malted for my taste. Not bad, but it becomes more of a slow sipper for me.

name: Victory Festbier
review: 12 oz bottle. Smells of malt and caramel. Pours a nice amber with a white head that goes quickly. Big round malty and yeasty flavors in a complex combination. Medium carbonation and a short finish. Good marzen.

name: Victory Festbier
review: From a beer hawk case. Pours with a thin head. Dark amber. Taste of toffee and malt. Sweet.

name: Victory All Malt Dark Lager
review: On tap at BitterCreek Alehouse clear redish deep amber Mild soft slightly sweet toasted malts very light hop character soft and smooth with a clean finish

name: Victory All Malt Dark Lager
review: Rated on 02-28-2013 at Victory B.C. This draft beers appearance is a small beige head with a short retention, transparent copper body, no visible carbonation observed, and spotty amounts of lacing. The aroma is caramel malt and toasty. The flavor mimics the aroma. This beers mouthfeel is smooth and this beer is light-medium bodied. A very quaffable session beer that I would drink again.

name: Victory All Malt Dark Lager
review: Pours deep copper with a half finger for white head with nice lacing. Aroma is of toasted malts, floral hops, grassy hops, sweet malts, caramel, and apple juice. Taste is similar to the aroma. Has a medium body with semi creamy mouthfeel and a semi bItter, slighty dry, medium finish. Overall, a very nice copper lager that is pretty tasty and drinkable.

name: Victory All Malt Dark Lager
review: On tap @ SL Liquors. Pours a rich mahogany color that has ruby highlights on the edges with a short creamy light tan head that fades to a thin collar. The aroma is fresh and floral up front, with notes of light roast, caramel, and fresh citrus character quickly following. The flavor is nicely balanced between a gently toasty malt and an underlying bitterness. It finishes clean and dry with a touch of toasted maltiness. Medium bodied, with a firm, crisp carbonation.

name: Victory All Malt Dark Lager
review: Draft at brewery. Pours a murky orange with a thin white head. Malty aroma with caramel, grains, and nuts. Flavor was sweet and malty with caramel, bread, subtle toffee, nuts and had a crisp clean finish.

name: Victory All Malt Dark Lager
review: On draft. Cooper color with thin white head. Malty aroma. Slightly sweet taste. Bready. Not bad, but nothing special.

name: Victory All Malt Dark Lager
review: Draft - Biscuit and grains. Clear pale gold with no head. Light grain notes, honey and a sweet finish.

name: Victory All Malt Dark Lager
review: Dark copper body, thin off-white head, sparse lacing. Caramel, toffee, dark bready toast, a touch of nuts, and wild grains. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, sweetness throughout. A little muddled, not particularly interesting, and given the sweetness, a little slow drinking.

name: Victory All Malt Dark Lager
review: On draft at PJs Downingtown. Copper color, a lot of lace. Malt and sugar aroma. Sweet candied malt flavor, medium body and duration. Solid lager.

name: Victory All Malt Dark Lager
review: Medium body lager that has a great amber appearance. Solid go to for any amber lager. Good refreshing taste. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Victory Old Horizontal
review: This is a 2016 bottle. The Aromas are caramel malt, prunes, raisins and Oak. Flavors are somewhat like nose, a little Sweet at First followed with a lot of bitter. Some spice in the aroma and flavor also. Slightly soft carbonation and decent body but the lingering bitter gets a little in the way. Booze starts coming out in the Finish.

name: Victory Old Horizontal
review: Aroma: los of toffee, butterscotch, grapefruit, little bit lemongrass or soapy, pine Appearance: mildly hazy reddish-amber color with a one-finger beige head. Lots of suspension. Taste: lots of toffee, syrup, grapefruit, pine, very high sweetness, medium-high bitterness Palate: full body, very chewy, almost syrupy texture, very little carbonation, bittersweet finish, booziness. Overall: It is without doubt a super malty bomb with robust hopiness from American variety and gives an impression of caramelized grapefruit. Its flavor is really nice, but the complexity is low, otherwise it would be perfect. Decent barley wine.

name: Victory Old Horizontal
review: caramel and fruity. Malt and some citrus fruit punch. hint of bitter and peppery hop and nutty. Juicy. Sneaky.

name: Victory Old Horizontal
review: Bottled, 355ml, aged 3yrs from The Ship & Bottle, Liverpool. Clouded brown, copper with off white head. There is a smooth, boozy character to this, fruity, plummy in nature. Heavy maltiness with a toast like character, roasty, sweet nuts. Big on the palate. It's a sipper but pretty decent.

name: Victory Old Horizontal
review: Versa un'ambiatura nebulosa, di colore rossastro, con una testa di un bianco medio, lunga durata.

name: Victory Old Horizontal
review: 2013 Bottle at home, shared with Dad, Christmas dinner, 16th December 18. Pours a dark brown amber beer, quite clear, white bubbly head. Aroma is candied orange, caramel, bitter pine. Taste is bitter sweet, spruce, pine, candied orange, citrus peel. Delicious bitter and refined barley wine, fantastic stuff.

name: Victory Old Horizontal
review: No clear smell. Cloudy copper colour, white head. Aroma of hops, nuts, alcohol, oak, maybe some vanilla. Flat carbon. Very sweet.

name: Victory Old Horizontal
review: Vintage 2013. Holds up very well, having grown an intense caramel backbone without turning syrupy or cloy. Molasses, dried fig, tobacco, and dried apple add heft to the middle, while the back end dries out, with a pine-laced bitter fade accented by toffee and a touch of maraschino cherry. Booziness has all but disappeared, leaving a thick, oozing pint of barleywine goodness. Buttered caramel on the nose. Pours red-amber with a brief off-white head and modest lacing. Delicious.

name: Victory Old Horizontal
review: Bottle, april 14th 2017. Dark amber body with a minimal tanned head. Aroma of toffee, piney hops, raisin, alcohol. Taste is sweet and boozy, tangerine and pine, bittersweet palate, boozy finish.

name: Victory Old Horizontal
review: 22 ounce bottle. 2016 vintage. Translucent garnet color. Small creamy beige head. Rich toffeeish toasted malt nose. Intensely bittersweet, chewy malt flavor. Notes of bitter herbal hops and burnt sugar in middle. Finish is freshly cracked black pepper, arugula and roasted nuts. Amazingly intense flavors, though smooth and approachable for an 11% ABV Barleywine.

name: Victory St. Victorious Doppelbock
review: Pours dark ruby amber with a thick, foamy head. Aroma is caramel and dried fruit. Taste is sweet plum, toffee and caramel. Finish is bittering hop. A decent doppelbock.

name: Victory St. Victorious Doppelbock
review: From Aug 2007 Received in a trade with Wasatch. Thanks, John! Best by date on this 12oz bottle is Jan 22 08 and it pours a clear deep amber-brown with a nice large head of foam that lasted right through the session as a solid 1 finger layer and it has plenty of nice lacing. The smell is light to my nose. I'm getting some fruitiness and a bit of roasted malt. The taste is malty and fruity with some roasty flavour and it's very smooth. Further sips in and as the beer warms, I start to taste some fig, raisin, toffee, and dark fruit as well as *some* chocolate. Man, this is a very complex Doppelbock and all the different flavours are working very well together. 8.5%abv, eh? I know the style can get up there but it's very well hidden here. Once again, kudos to Wasatch for sending this one. It's a winner for sure.

name: Victory St. Victorious Doppelbock
review: Draught @ Whole Foods - Bryant Park. Dark brown with reddish tint, large creamy beige head, caramel aroma, high carbonation, medium bitter caramel malt taste, thin body, long bitter caramel finish. Quite smooth and nice.

name: Victory St. Victorious Doppelbock
review: Pours a deep brownish red on tap with bubbly tan head that leaves moderate lace. Aroma of dark fruits, mild German yeasty esters, and a hint of booze. Taste is more of the fruit and booze, with caramel malts added and a light wheat note. Its a doppelbock, well made, but nothing amazing.

name: Victory St. Victorious Doppelbock
review: Poured from a growler (from the source/KS Victory). Nose is booze, dried fruits, and fruit cake holiday cake/dark bread. Appearance is a clear merlot without sediment. Taste is a brilliant trinity of sweet malt, hop bite (like an ESA), and smokiness. Mouth feel is velvety smoothness. A unbelievable beer. Cheers!

name: Victory St. Victorious Doppelbock
review: BB backlog, Bottle, Amber red color with a medium head. Flavor is lots of german malt, bread, light spicing, and pine hops. The malt was strong in this one. Some caramel and hay as it warms up. Light to medium mouthfeel. Alright

name: Victory St. Victorious Doppelbock
review: On tap at BitterCreek Alehouse Clear deep redish town modest tan head great Woody brown sugar carmelizes malt aromas and flavors. Woody slight bitter bite. Smooth and rich. Great example of a great style.

name: Victory St. Victorious Doppelbock
review: 4 oz pour on draft at City Tap House during the SAVOR Week event. Clear dark amber with beige head. Aromas of malt, caramel, dark fruit, light spice. Tastes of dark fruit, caramel, malt, light spice. Medium body with a dry finish.

name: Victory St. Victorious Doppelbock
review: Light coffee and lots of caramel. Light sweet finish. Brown pour with good head and lacing. Decent balance. Fairly sweet finish. Tap at city tap house.

name: Victory St. Victorious Doppelbock
review: Tap at the brewpub in Downingtown, PA. Half pint. Commomshawn, rosskyle, and samadouche in the house. Darker amber and brown cola coloring. Nose is soft caramel and toffee with a slight toasted nutty quality. Taste is on the sweeter end initially with a burnt sugar and caramel feel. Medium body with an alcohol punch without burning the doppel bock. Bready with some roasty malt notes. Its pretty decent...definitely come out victorious in some minor PA battles.

name: Victory Storm King Imperial Stout
review: Riecht sehr intensiv dunkelrstig. Pechschwarzes Bier mit einer feinen Schaumkrone. Im Antrunk wie l, sehr intensiv, sehr kernig, smig. Stark gerstete Kaffeebohnen, dunkelste Schokolade und zustzlich eine hopfige Herbe im Abgang die seines gleichen sucht. Nichts fr Weicheier

name: Victory Storm King Imperial Stout
review: As someone who is a big fan of Victory Brewing, my experience drinking the Storm King was the first time I've been disappointed by a product from this generally top notch Pennsylvania brewery. Currently trying my second bottle of a 2018 vintage with an August 2023 best by date, and although I'm getting more flavor and nuance on this second round, this beer falls short of its aim to challenge Great Divide's Yeti in the hoppy American-style imperial stout category. That being said, this beer is still very good, with a rich brown-black opaque appearance and creamy head, exceptionally smooth palate, and that intriguing interplay of bitter piney hop flavors and charred coffee malt flavors that again reminds me of the first time I had the classic Yeti. Some red fruit notes in the aroma and the taste, with hints of chocolate as well. I however did not pick up on the "massive espresso" as described on the bottle, which added to my disappointment. It does finish very smooth, but just doesn't strike me as particularly impressive in any category. A good American imperial stout, but fell short of high expectations.

name: Victory Storm King Imperial Stout
review: 0,33l bottle. Pours black with tan head. Aroma of roast, coffee, chocolate, licorice, vanilla. Taste is big, sweet, bitter roasted malt, coffee, milk chocolate, licorice, slight hint of smoke, with some bitter hops in the finish. Full body, very well balanced.

name: Victory Storm King Imperial Stout
review: A solid IPS. Super dark appearance with mocha colored head. Some hop in the aroma...not the typical soy-sauce smell. Chocolate and coffee malt. Alcohol is well hidden. Used half of my 2nd sample combined with Bells Kalamazoo in a slow cooked pot-roast.

name: Victory Storm King Imperial Stout
review: From the bottle. Dark, dark brown with a frothy to creamy beige crown that lingers for the duration. Aroma is ladened with an overtone of nail polish, which is undoubtedly the brews biggest flaw. Beneath it: licorice and coffee. Taste is bittersweet up front with a fairly sharp hops bite at the finish. Body is full, carbonation is soft. Okay but the flat hops bitterness covers the richer, malty undertones that I prefer to make more of an appearance in this style.

name: Victory Storm King Imperial Stout
review: A great aroma of malt, chocolate, coffee and some licorice, pours a dark brown color with thick tan head that lasted. A full bodied oily mouth feel with a taste of malt, mocha an de licorice with a boozy licorice finish.

name: Victory Storm King Imperial Stout
review: A 12 fl. oz. bottle with an enjoy by date of 27th January 2021. Poured into a snifter glass. It was a dark dark brown to black in colour with a thin mocha head that dissipated fairly quickly and left some sparse lacing. Aromas of piney hops, roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Tastes of roasted malts, piney hops, chocolate, coffee, dark fruit, light herbal and a hint of liquorice. Creamy, medium bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, a nice Imperial Stout, although Im not too fond of the liquorice and herbal mix on the finish.

name: Victory Storm King Imperial Stout
review: I've heard Victory is discontinuing production of Storm King shortly. Can anyone confirm or (hopefully) correct this? It's a favorite, so I hope it's incorrect. Bad enough that I had to stock up to get me through the summer each spring (smile).

name: Victory Storm King Imperial Stout
review: Poured from a bottle into a pint glass. Black with a thin, tan head with lacing. Nose is roasted oats and chocolate. Unbelievable smoothness for a high ABV. It has a warmth, but not a fiery boozy taste. Bitter dark chocolate and espresso tastes. I had this one many times over a decade. Great move going back to the six pack (four packs are too rich for me). Happy New Year!

name: Victory Sunrise Weissbier
review: Hazy straw pour from a growler into a glass with a large white fluffy head; looks amazing. Aromas of banana, cloves, sour yeast and sweet bread. Taste follows the nose as the German malts add a crisp yet smooth finish. Carbination is just right. Awesome Hefeweizen; a lighter more refreshing version of Victory's Mad King's Weiss in my opinion. Light bodied and very sessionable.

name: Victory Sunrise Weissbier
review: From Jul 2007 Purchased at Wilbur's Liquors in Ft Collins as part of a mixed 6 Pack. This one pours from 12oz bottle(best by May 24 08) a hazy straw colour with a good head of foam. After a few minutes there's just some spotting of foam and it does have some lacing. The smell has a strong nose of clove and banana and is nice. The taste follows the nose with a heaping helping of both clove and banana with a good citric background. Further sips in and I'm getting some good yeast flavour that hits my palate very well and the finish has a nice bitter-sour twang to it. Great summertime brew!! Now *this* is a very tasty Hefe and I'd be more than pleased if this was available locally. I recommend it!

name: Victory Sunrise Weissbier
review: Saw it slipped into the top 50 heres before rating. Had at brewey good, though some of these are hard to differentiate seems to lack some zip at the end.

name: Victory Sunrise Weissbier
review: 12 oz bottle at home. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. The aroma and flavor have pale wheat malts, tart lemon citrus, mild spices, cloves, light banana, this is pretty good for the style, but not something that I would go after often.

name: Victory Sunrise Weissbier
review: Sample from the brewery. Pours a clear pale yellow with a white head. Aromas of banana, fruity esters, bread. Taste is sweet with a light tang. Well done to style.

name: Victory Sunrise Weissbier
review: Tap. Fluffy white head, hazy bright lemon yellow. Nice clean banana, hay, and slight grassy twang in the aroma. Fruity, banana, hay, grass, but missing the citrusy burst I enjoy in the style. Light but firm and tightened carbonation.

name: Victory Sunrise Weissbier
review: this summer beer was quite nice as both a spicy wheat beer or hot weather quencher. soft body and feel, clove, banana and good wheat flavors all come through. nice."

name: Victory Sunrise Weissbier
review: Bottle: Pours clear gold with a giant white head. Lemon, wheat malt aroma. Taste is a sharp, citrus, strong lemon, wheat...acidic. Sharp, very crisp.

name: Victory Sunrise Weissbier
review: Wife ordered this daft at Victory brewpub, I snageed a few sips. Served in a Weisen glass, hazy light amber golden color with white head. Aroma of sweet pale malt, wheat, light banana/clove yeast note and some citrus. Taste adds some grass and a light earthiness to the aroma notes. Light body, moderate carbonation, dry, soft with slight bitter note on finish. Well done.

name: Victory Sunrise Weissbier
review: On tap at brewpub. Pours pale gold with thin white head. Wheat, banana, cloves. Lightly bitter and sweet. Watery body with light carbonation.

name: Victory Moonglow Weizenbock
review: An unfiltered heavy wheat beer. Has a cloudy amberish appearance. Smell has some tart fruit, wheat, yeast....a little piney. Mouthfeel is weighed down a little by the unfiltration and yeast. I messed up slightly on the pour so had to wait for it to settle. Not the best Weizenbock out there, but a good representation nonetheless. Only tried a single first to sample, but this is something I would get again.

name: Victory Moonglow Weizenbock
review: t contains all the best traits of both a bock and a weizen. Aroma is full of the yeasty/spicy notes of banana, clove and lemon zest - yet also sweetly malty. Flavor is more of the same.

name: Victory Moonglow Weizenbock
review: Not a good beer at all in my opinion. Would not buy another 6 pack or a case what so ever. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Victory Moonglow Weizenbock
review: Pours amber with a four finger off white head and an aroma of yeast. Tastes of malt and yeast: banana and bubblegum. Its medium bodied with minimal carbonation.

name: Victory Moonglow Weizenbock
review: 355ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Two months past the best before date. Pours hazy amber with a load of floaters and a small off-white head. Aroma is toffee, banana, phenols, light spiciness. Taste is sweet, slightly boozy, vanilla, caramel, wheat.

name: Victory Moonglow Weizenbock
review: 12 oz. bottle from Dutch's, purchased in 2014. Best enjoyed by 19 August 2015. Whoops. Didn't see that until tonight. Anyway, it pours a hazy chestnut color with a big off-white head that settles unevenly. Notes of toast, bananas, brown sugar, earth, leaves, chocolate, dried fruits, and wheat. Light-medium bodied, with medium carbonation and a sweet, relatively clean mouthfeel for the style. But that could be the age.

name: Victory Moonglow Weizenbock
review: Draught @ Roasthouse, Frederick, MD. Pours clear orangeish amber with airy off-white head. Clear aroma of malt and yeast, with notes of caramel and touches of grain and hops. Sweetish flavour of malt, banana and yeast, with sourish, grainy notes and bitter touches of hops. Dryish and acidic aftertaste with rough and spicy notes. Very decent.

name: Victory Moonglow Weizenbock
review: 355ml bottle (8.7%) shared with Stuartyboy at home on 12 Aug 2017, from Good Spirits Company, West Nile Street, Glasgow (bb 12 Aug 2017): sweet toffee, earthy aroma, amber brown with a thin lively cream head, caramel, toffee, fruity flavour, viscous, moderate fizz.

name: Victory Moonglow Weizenbock
review: 16 oz. on tap at brew pub. I can not understand the high ratings on this beer. Mild aroma, some malts. Bitter taste, malty. Smooth mouthfeel, I thought that the carbonation was too high and it was filling. Mediocre at best, my least favorite Victory beer yet.

name: Victory Moonglow Weizenbock
review: Bottle shared with Mr_H a deep amber brown colour beer aroma is ripe fruits flavour is toffee some carmel malts sweet ripe bannana with dough and yeasty notes sweet slightly spicy finish

name: Victory Populist Pale Ale
review: Middle of the road, drinkable beer, but not their best effort. Could use more flavor.

name: Victory Populist Pale Ale
review: quite a drinkable ale with a nice balance of flavors ......................

name: Victory Populist Pale Ale
review: Fair as a pale goes, which is not my favorite style. A nice malt front and nose, average hops, drinkable and clean tasting.

name: Victory Golden Monkey
review: People were saying banana and it turns out they were right, although there are other more tripely fruits as well. It doesn't quite have that Belgian lighter-than-it-should-be thing down. Dry at the end. Good, but not great. Poured from a can.

name: Victory Golden Monkey
review: Gold hay color with wheat, peppercorn aroma. Taste has mild banana, Belgian yeast, oak and spice notes. Pretty weak for a Tripel; still drank 6 in one night.

name: Victory Golden Monkey
review: Bottle from Public Wine. Golden straw, fairly clear. Thin head. Strong bitter banana aroma. Heavy on the sugar with some cloves. A little heavy handed

name: Victory Golden Monkey
review: Golden with a white head. Aroma of banana and apple with a touch of spice. Taste is a bit marshmallow sweet but yeasty. Pleasant enough.

name: Victory Golden Monkey
review: Sweet light baking spice with a touch of apple. Clear gold with a decent white head. Bubblegum and a touch of spice. Estery as hell and a bit too sweet.

name: Victory Golden Monkey
review: Can. I'm not a fan of Belgian style beers. This one was typical translucent straw colored beer. Way too strong 9.5% ABV. "Spicy," slightly sweet. Requires sipping, and I had to add ice to keep it cold, because it took so long to finish it.

name: Victory Golden Monkey
review: Bottle. Drank from bottle. Banana, spice, cloves, pepper, stonefruit. Medium body. Nice.

name: Victory Golden Monkey
review: Hier versucht man ein hopfenbitteres IPA etwas aufzupeppen. Das geschieht mit Zuckerzugabe (was auch den hohen Alkoholgehalt etwas dmpft) und einigen Tripel-artigen Gewrzen wie Koriander. Dadurch wirkt es wie einFabelwesen, dass weder IPA noch belgisches Bier ist. Der Vorteil ist, dass die Hopfenbittere ein gut trinkbares Ma erreicht und der Alkohol nicht zu brutal rberkommt. Aber dieser kastriert wirkende Hopfenwolf macht sich zu sehr zum verwirrten Affen, um wirklich zum Top-Bier zu werden.

name: Victory Golden Monkey
review: Pours clear amber with full off white head. Aroma is light dried fruit, light caramel. Taste is plum and caramel, moving to banana esters and Belgian yeast. Finish is Belgian. A decent tripel.

name: Victory Golden Monkey
review: Pours hazy gold with thin white head. Nose is overwhelmingly bananas with some bread, cloves, and apricots hanging around as well. Taste very strong in the bananas and apricots. Finishes very sweet with the taste of alcohol coming through as well. It is good for what it is, but not something I would drink on a regular basis.

name: Victory Altbier
review: I first had this "Old Beer" in D-Town. I believe it was a special offering after they expanded the brewery; for sure, they brewed it for their 10th birthday. Recently, I bought a growler at Kennett Square, and I poured into a pint glass. Theres a slight, sweet malt nose. Nice amber coloring with a white head (very similar to their Festbier). Expertly balanced with a strong malt presence and a bitter after bite. Has a heavy feel being a lager, but its easy going down at 5%. Cheers!

name: Victory Altbier
review: Transfer from BA review on 9-4-13- Served on tap in a pint glass Appearance  The beer is served a lighter copper-deep amber color with a one finger white head. The head fades relatively quickly leaving a very light level of lace on the sides of the glass. Smell  The aroma is lighter overall, but has notes of a lightly toasted bread and a bit of a herbal hop and a light sweetness of caramel. Taste  The taste is very much as would be expected from the nose. It starts with a lightly roasted bready flavor mixed with a bit of caramel sweetness. The sweetness fades a bit as the taste moves on all while a herbal and slightly grassy hop taste comes to the tongue. These flavors are joined by some more light earthy flavors, to in the end, leave a rather light and crisp flavor on the tongue. Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is rather light and thin with a carbonation level that is rather average. The thinner body and moderate carbonation are good for the lighter flavors and create a very crisp and easy drinking brew. Overall  More on the refreshing side, but a little bit low in the flavor profile which all in all makes for a nice easy drinking session brew.

name: Victory Altbier
review: big foamy head. pale yellah. smells a little like hops. yes, taste is hops poken thru. tongue gets more bitter as session moves on. fairly flat. some citrus baldness in the background.

name: Victory Altbier
review: Draft at Harrison Roadhouse. Pale yellow with a white head. Hay and pils. Biscuit and stuff...

name: Victory Altbier
review: On tap at Joe Canals West Deptford. Appearance: Clear amber body with a creamy head that lingers. Aroma: Light lemon with floral notes. Taste: Slight malts with a dry leaning feel, slightly bitter with some floral and lemon notes. Palate: Medium bodied, lively carbonation. Overall: This is okay, nothing I would buy again.

name: Victory Altbier
review: Draft at blue monk. Orange amber pour. Malt heavy, somewhat fruity, touch of earthy, very light peat. Nice alt

name: Victory Altbier
review: Draft at the brew pub. Pours clear copper with a small white head. The aroma Is very malty with mostly caramel, maybe a light smoke. The taste is lightly sweet and lightly malty as well. There is a slight hopliness. This is good but sticke and double sticke set a crazy expectation for the style.

name: Victory Altbier
review: Draft at the source. Clear golden color, thick white head, solid lacing. Aroma pf biscuity hay. Taste is similar.

name: Victory Altbier
review: On tap at Victory Brew Pub. Pours clear copper with two finger white head. Spruce, pepper, lemon, grass. Moderately bitter. A little salty. Somewhat acidic. Not bad.

name: Victory Altbier
review: Draft. Poured hazy brown color with an average frothy off-white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate complex toasted balanced aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Moderate toasted complex flavor with a moderate bittersweet finish of average duration. Good drinkable brew.

name: Victory Sunset Dunkelweizen
review: Draft. Pours hazy light brown. The aroma has some roasted malt and fruity esters. The taste is sweet banana, dark sugar.

name: Victory Sunset Dunkelweizen
review: Growler from brewery. Hazy brown with off white head. Malty nose, a hint of spice. Weiss spice in flavor, toasted malt, crisp. Nice flavor

name: Victory Sunset Dunkelweizen
review: Pours an opaque amber with a medium off white head. Aroma has light spicy notes...very earthy almost woody...a mild caramel sweetness. Flavor follows suit adding mild fruitiness and a nougat/nutty no the that comes across as chalky/inauthentic. Mouthfeel is medium and the finish is fruity/spicy lingering to earthy/chalky

name: Victory Sunset Dunkelweizen
review: Sampled at Big Brew Beer Festival (Morristown). Pours a hazy dark amber color with a small off white head of foam. Aroma of mainly light citrus and roasted malt. Taste mimics the nose. Nothing outstanding

name: Victory Sunset Dunkelweizen
review: This one poured a medium to lighter brown color with a beige head. Aroma was of wheat, light toast, nuts, and grassy hops. Flavor was simlar, incredibly balanced mixed of a hefe and dunkel. Another great Lager by victory.

name: Victory Sunset Dunkelweizen
review: On tap at Harris grill. This beer blew me away. I usually don't like this style at all but Victory really nailed this one. Slightly fruity slightly nutty aroma. The taste is light with a slight nutty finish. Medium carb. Just a really easy drinking beer.

name: Victory Sunset Dunkelweizen
review: Murky amber, high effervescence with thin oily top, lightest white ring. Rye grains and banana nose, softer than hoped. Bitingly spicy flavor is dark, husky malt, awesomely balanced, bit of undesired chocolate sweetness growing mid with warmth, lingering until the metallic, zesty-carbed end.

name: Victory Sunset Dunkelweizen
review: Tap at Victory Downington, 27/11/13. Hazed chestnut brown with a moderate light beige covering that retains well. Nose is yeast, toffee, banana, light spice, clove - classic dunkelweizen aroma. Taste comprises banoffee pie, vanilla, malt, light nana, clove. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, smooth on the palate, drying finale with underlying fruit and spice. Nice.

name: Victory Sunset Dunkelweizen
review: Draft from Downingtown. Good bold character dunkel. Malt and banana and spices. Balanced but not too exciting. Average.

name: Victory Sunset Dunkelweizen
review: Nice-looking beer, especially in a tall beer glass. But tasted unexpectedly bland, maybe even frightened. Ive had better dunkels.

name: Victory Workhorse Porter
review: A weet porter with a good balance of complex flavors. Satisfied my girlfriends sweet beer craving.

name: Victory Workhorse Porter
review: Cask @ Victory Brewpub. Beautiful black beer. Served a little too cold, but I could still smell the chocolate aroma. Very smooth, creamy mouthfeel with no bitterness. Very nice porter.

name: Victory Workhorse Porter
review: Tap @ Victory. Dark brown with decent head and lace. Rather faint nose (after I had a couple the milder brews smell rather faint to me). Very nice roasted flavor w mild unsweet chocolate, not sweet, quite smooth, a bit mild,( I don't remember hops here after drinking the nice, hoppy pils just before), just into the medium bodied category. I could have inhaled a gallon of this without much effort.

name: Victory Workhorse Porter
review: I wonder why they dont bottle more of their beers. It does have a nice chocotately character to it, as the description suggests. A little nutty, pretty good. Not a huge fan of the porter style but no complaints here.

name: Victory Workhorse Porter
review: Burgundy appearance with a small head and little lacing. Some caramel in the aroma that was also a little nutty. Palate was a bit thin for a porter. Maybe a little closer in style to a brown ale. More of a coffee edge as it warms. Finish was short lived. Had greater expectations.
