name: Victory Workhorse Porter
review: On tap at Victory. Poured a medium to darker reddish brown with an averaged sized off white head. Aroma and tastes of bitter chocolate. OK Porter but a little light all around.

name: Victory Workhorse Porter
review: Growler from the brewery. Poured a decent brown with an average head. Roast malt and chocolate in the aroma, although a little weak. The flavor was similar to the aroma with a somewhat thin mouthfeel. Overall, it was a little disppointing.

name: Victory Workhorse Porter
review: On draft at the brewery. Deep garnet pour with a medium head. rich metallic aroma, hard to gauge the aroma due to the guy next to me blowing smoke in my face. Roasted malt flavor, nice choco-bitterness to finish. Very easy drinking, the finish makes this beer.

name: Victory Workhorse Porter
review: Draft @ brewery. Very light brown for a porter as was the taste and body. Light, gritty cocoa flavor was mostly predominant here. Drinkable but a bit dissapointing.

name: Victory Workhorse Porter
review: Deep red. Light roasts in nose, vaguely roasty in flavor with a bit of fruitiness at the end. Quite underwhelming considering Victorys usual skills.

name: Victory ESB
review: BB Backlog, Pours a copper gold with 2 finger head. Smell is pretzel, bread, and other nutty malt notes. Taste was most of the same with some caramel, toast, and subtle grains. Mouthfeel was medium. Enjoyed this one even though its not my favorite style.

name: Victory ESB
review: Transfer from BA review on 5-23-12- Served on cask in a pint glass Appearance  Served an orange-copper color with a thin off white head. The head faded very fast leaving only a very light amount of lacing. Smell  The aroma is biscuit in nature mixed with a bitter hop aroma of earthy and citrus nature. There are light spice and herbal aromas mixed into the nose as well which overall create an overall very pleasant aroma. Taste  The taste is biscuit up front as the nose would have predicted. In the middle some of the citrus hop flavor and spice then comes into to the tongue. The citrus loses ground fast but the spiciness gets stronger. In the end the spice flavors mix with the bread an herbal/grassy flavor and an earthy hop flavor to leave a bitter spiced flavor on the tongue. Mouthfeel  Typical for a cask beer this one was creamy in body and low in carbonation. It was nice and smooth and very drinkable. Overall - The flavors of this beer taste and transition well making this one a very easy drinking bitter with a nice smooth feel and taste.

name: Victory ESB
review: Tap. Light orange pour with a thinner than expected head. Tea, earth, toffee, floral, and bread. Medium body with good carbonation and clean finish.

name: Victory ESB
review: draft @ redlight redlight. Fruity caramel notes on the nose. Pours orange with a reddish hue and dense white head. A fruitiness upfront with bread malts following finishes dry with grassy hop notes. Not bad, not bad at all!

name: Victory ESB
review: Tap at Coles. Lovely. Pours light orange with limited head but lots of lacing. Nose is quiet. Notes of English tea, earthy bitterness, limited toffee and some light fruit in background. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Medium body with lively carbonation, pretty dry finish. Awesome!!

name: Victory ESB
review: Hands down one of the best Ive ever had of this style. I tried 16 beers at Victory and this was the best of the lot. So smooth, with an amazingly full body despite low ABV. Incredible lacing. YUM!!!

name: Victory ESB
review: Copper colored body, large white head, spotty lacing. Cereals, toasted malt, floral and grassy hops. Medium bodied, gentle carbonation, clean and crisp finish.

name: Victory ESB
review: hazy amber, puffy large, large bubbled white head sinks fast to dormant volcano. Delicate, wood and resin ladened nose, lightly floral bouquet bursting forth from freshly sewed lawn. Flavor is more singular, soft carbonation appropriately allows for grass and tea, faint bread crust mid before rich, warm toast in finish. Awesome example, been so long since a low carbed esb graced my lips. Victory reminding all "trail-blazing" craft brewers again that brewing to style can be just as good.

name: Victory ESB
review: On tap at brewpub. Copper pour with marshmallowy off-white head. Earth, caramel, nuts, citrus. Moderately bitter and sweet. Crisp, medium body.

name: Victory ESB
review: Cask at the brewery A: Pours a transparent copper color with a medium-sized white cap. Retention is decent S: Soft pale malts give a light toasty note, hops give lots of earthy and spicy notes. Well balanced, and definitely English T: The low carbonation + the cask makes this really English. Subtle hops and malts are nicely balanced. Hops are spicy, earthy, slightly citrusy. Malts are light, slightly bready, and balance well MF/D: Carbonation is low, body is medium for the style. Finish is of spicy hops

name: Victory Whirlwind Witbier
review: What a pleasure to drink, very lively and powerful. Not such a fan of the label.

name: Victory Whirlwind Witbier
review: Tad above average beer and for the style. Just not a big fan of wheats and this one not really standing out. Wanted to get Victory's Summer Love again after trying it last year, but saw this along with a new review. Summer Love is better IMO. Whirlwind is cloudy medium-pale yellow. Tastes wheaty...the Hoegaarden kind though and not the hoppier American Wheat like I prefer. Glad I split this with my brother-in-law as I'll be going with other summer beers for the season.

name: Victory Whirlwind Witbier
review: From Jul 2007 Purchased at Wilbur's Liquors in Ft Collins as part of a mixed 6 Pack. This pours from 12oz bottle(Best by Apr 30 08) a cloudy yellow with a small head of foam. Not much is left after a few minutes other than a ring around the edge of my glass and some lacing. The smell is of yeast and citrus and wheat and clove and banana. It's not a bit shy on the nose. ;^) The taste is big and citrusy up front with flavours of clove and some banana but it all works up front only..the flavours fall off quickly midway through and it finishes really watery. If at least some of the flavour lasted, I'd have liked it more. Pretty disappointing for me and I'll not revisit this brew.

name: Victory Whirlwind Witbier
review: BB Backlog, Bottle, pours cloudy golden with medium sized white foam. Aroma is flowers, banana, clove, and other belgian spice. Flavor of orange peel, coriander, clove, and dark fruits. I could mix these in between some hoegarden and other wits.

name: Victory Whirlwind Witbier
review: Aromas of orange and spice. Flavor has too much orange, I didnt care for this beer at all. White beers arent high on my list.

name: Victory Whirlwind Witbier
review: Aroma is wheat malts with that belgian yeast touch. Slight banana. Taste is refreshing citrus with some herbal traces. Theres quite a lot of bitterness in the aftertaste, and thats what saves this little guy. Refreshing.

name: Victory Whirlwind Witbier
review: Hazy yellow. Aroma of clove, banana, wheat, yeast etc. Taste is refreshing lemon, cotrus, spice, coriander, banana and fruity esters. Tingles going down and crisp mouth feel. Not bad

name: Victory Whirlwind Witbier
review: Pours pale straw yellow with a thin white head with just a little lacing. Aroma is of wheat bread, spices, cloves, lemon zest, and some light floral hops. Taste is about the same as the aroma. Has a medium-light body with a slightly creamy mouthfeel and a slightly bitter, slightly dry, medium finish. Overall, a pretty nice, classic wit that is a nice refreshing summer beer.

name: Victory Whirlwind Witbier
review: Bottle at home, not that Victory is finally available in Arkansas. Pours a hazy light yellow with two fingers of white head. Aroma is wheat, yeasty, some lemons. Nice summertime beer.

name: Victory Whirlwind Witbier
review: Cloudy yellow pour, quickly fading white head. Nose is citrus and spice. Bittersweet. Middle is yeasty malt, bread notes, and lite cardamon. Finish is dry with subtle but persistent carbonation.

name: Dogwood Breakdown IPA
review: Five year old bottle so I didnt expect this to be as good as once before probably. Pours clody orange with a thick white head. Aroma of honey, pine, berry, and orange. Very good taste of resin and orange with a bitter finish.

name: Dogwood Breakdown IPA
review: Pours a light tan head with a cola-color body...i got the dregs tho. Smells of malt and mellow citrus hops. Tastes of floral and some spice hop and medium malt sweetness. Little dry. Wish the hops were more prevalent all-around.

name: Dogwood Breakdown IPA
review: Pours a hazy gold with foamy head. Aroma of citrus, pine, hops, lemon, some malts. Similar taste, buttery up front with some nice hop bite. Not bad for an 04. Thanks butters!

name: Dogwood Breakdown IPA
review: Five year old beer courtesy of Butters at his Cellar Reduction # 6. Old tasting but still going. Best by 12/9/04. Bitter hops. Resin and pine. Tastes like this beer might have active yeast in the bottle . I wouldnt be surprised if the alcohol content has risen over the years. Who knows. Interesting for its age but hardly a stellar beer

name: Dogwood Breakdown IPA
review: Bottle (12/9/04) shared from springslicker at the 6th Cellar Reduction. Gusher upon opening. Pours a near clear orange with solid white head. Nose is a weird sweet fruity honey malt, with big alcohol notes. Apple, butterscotch flavors. Still has a decent bitterness on the finish. And im not sure, but I think this got more alcoholic with age, lots of warming. Extra points on the age.

name: Dogwood Breakdown IPA
review: btl opened by Springslicker. Lemon sour like butterscotch and apple starburst. Very musty flavor of old wood. Semi sweet that fades to a bitter that is far from pleasant. Very foamy and thin. A beer that did not hold up well with age. Rated out at 2.7 but with a best by of 12/9/04 I rated on a curve officially.

name: Dogwood Breakdown IPA
review: 12oz bottle-pours a thin white head and cloudy gold color. Aroma is sour, lemon. Taste is sour, lemon-hops, secondary medium malt, butterscotch. 2.9 Thanks to springslicker for sharing. Best by 12/9/04 therefore 3.2

name: Dogwood Breakdown IPA
review: Bottled, thanks to SpringsLicker for the brew! Poured hazy, deeper golden, and almost still.. a dusting and a light ring of white head stuck around. The aroma was warm and welcoming, and undoubtedly unlike how this originally came across.. deeper caramel, toffee, and barley give an aged, well-malted impression with just a touch of dried floral hoppage.. this aged gracefully with an old-ale appeal. The flavor had deep toffee, medium-skinned fruits, caramel, and barley again with mild floral bitterness.. well-aged and soft, with little hoppage left. Medium-bodied with very low carbonation.. let the malt show glide slowly, but gracefully across the palate. This was just delightful!

name: Dogwood Breakdown IPA
review: This was one damn good IPA! I wish this was still around. Nice malty flavor and lovely citrusy hops.

name: Dogwood Breakdown IPA
review: Date: 04/08/1999 Mode: Draft Source: Wild Wing Cafe, Marietta clear amber, headless, light floral hop aroma, light malt flayor, good dose of hops, light bitterness, after warming it turns into a wonderful brew full of hop flavor, but light on the bitterness, unique! Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 16/20 Rating: 3.4/5.0 Score: ***/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Dogwood Stout
review: (12oz bottle best by 5-22-03 thanks to Walt) clear dark brown with ruby edges and no bubbles. Nose of graham cracker, brown sugar, fudge. Taste of dry cocoa, unsweet chocolate, light oxidation, papery. Light body thats uncarbonated. Past its prime.

name: Dogwood Stout
review: Pours black with a thin tan head. Aroma of candy corn, peppermint and caramel. Taste is sweet caramel and milk chocolate with some bitter coffee finish. Smooth buttery texture.

name: Dogwood Stout
review: Pours a fading beige head with a dark brown body. Roasted and buttery aroma. Flavor is roasted and milky. Nice body and feel.

name: Dogwood Stout
review: Pours medium black. Aromas of licorice, butter, Mint chocolate. Nice clean finish.

name: Dogwood Stout
review: Sampled at the Butters Last Supper tasting. Pours a near black with thin hint of clearish brown head. Totally buttered biscuit from Hardees  aroma. Flavor is candy corn, roast chocolate, marshmellow, and a little oakey. Has held up fairly well. Thanks to Sprinslicker for the hookup!

name: Dogwood Stout
review: Thanks to OSCF for sharing this at his tasting! Hasnt quite held up as well as some of the other Dogwoods Ive had but it was a perfectly reasonable session stout. Thin, cola-ish pour with a faint prickly carbonation to it. Nice roasts still come through in the nose, though the bodys a bit too thin to substantiate the flavors at this point. Decent though.

name: Dogwood Stout
review: Pours a dark black with a thin tan head. Nice extraction. Nose shows mild soy, chalky, chocolate, some paper. Age not doing it well. Flavor is thin, papery, chocolate, some roast and coffee. Thin palate.

name: Dogwood Stout
review: 12 oz bottle via Mys Swap 3.0 (thanks shp555!). 2004 bottle...4 yrs old...with a Troeggs cap...She pours a near pitch black with an average size beige head. Nose is roasted grains. Taste is roasted grains, semi-burnt coffee, a little chocolate, and some licorice in the aftertaste. Body is medium, carbonation is perfect. This is nothing overly special or complex, but is a nice solid roasty stout that seems to have aged well with no oxidation or off-flavor issues.

name: Dogwood Stout
review: A nice beer here, that is...who knows how old. Received in a trade with someone. Forgot exactly who sent it, but thanks. The beer was nice. As nice as a dry stout can be. Granted, its not one of my all-time favorite style, but this was still very nice. An aroma of coffe, in fact it damned near dominates the nose. Some light aroma of dark chocolate is barely detectable. The flavor of chocolate and coffee dominate as well. A bit of a puckering twang was also picked up, perhaps due to the malts.

name: Dogwood Stout
review: Bottle thanks to shp555. 2004 edition. Pours a dark brown with a beige head that goes down pretty quick. The aroma is heavy brown sugar, some dark fruits perhaps. The taste was mostly a dry burnt malt, brown sugar, some hints of dark fruit, and overall a sweet chocolate flavor. This is a decent beer that has left us. Thanks go to Steve for sharing this.

name: Dogwood Summer Brew
review: Golden hazed wit with a thin white head. Aroma of coriander and bananas with light oranges. Light wheaty malt with light orange notes. Lighter bodied than Blanche de Chambly. Trade with Goldtwins, if I remember. Tasted Spring 2006.

name: Dogwood Summer Brew
review: Another gusher from Dogwood. Pretty tasty but not great. The level of spicyness was just about right.

name: Dogwood Summer Brew
review: Date: 07/10/1997 Mode: Draft dark yellow, thin head, slightly sweet orange aroma, strong clove flavor -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 05/11/2001 strong on the orange character throughout, no clove, Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Dogwood Summer Brew
review: (12 oz bottle: Obtained in trade with goldtwins, thanks Larry!) Best before 15-Nov-04. Hey, Im just glad I get to try another brew from the now-defunct Dogwood Brewery. But frankly, its been my experience that these Belgian whites handle aging very well. This pours a hazy yellow body with a small whitish head. Within a couple of minutes, the head has faded to a thin ring around the edge of the glass. The mildly aromatic nose consists mostly of lemony citrus and some light coriander in the background. However, coriander shows much more presence in the flavor, and the mildly bitter orange peel is unmistakeable in the finish, tasting like, well, biting into the rind of a fresh orange. Pleasant fruitiness, only lightly sweet and minimal bitterness. Very slight breadiness to the wheat malt base, probably a hint to the aging this beer has seen. Body is light-medium, and while not more than lightly carbonated, the citrus and spice still make the beer fairly refreshing on the palate. Overall, a pretty nice beer, especially for one that should have been consumed 14 months ago.

name: Dogwood Summer Brew
review: Its long story how I got ahold of this one. I jumped at one last opportunity to rate this retired beer knowing full well it may have gone bad. Well the smell has the same citrusy aroma Im used to. It still has that cloudy orange color. The taste is slightly spicy with hints of orange. Thank goodness it hasnt gone bad. Unfortunately it was never a great beer to begin with.

name: Dogwood Summer Brew
review: light yet crisp aroma, nice yellow golden color with a slightly off-white head, nice whole wheat flavor, slight lingering bitterness, wonderful sweet summer beer. Sad to have lost such a high quality brewer

name: Dogwood Summer Brew
review: Cloudy yellow to orange colored white beer with a little head that died away instantly. Aromas of orange, lemon and citrus in there, some notes of coriander too. Medium bodied beer with a dry malty finish. Too low on carbonation and a watery finish.

name: Dogwood Summer Brew
review: Goodbye Dogwood! This brewery will be sorely missed in the Atlanta market. This is a good summer beer with just the right balance of orange & spice.

name: Dogwood Summer Brew
review: This beer poured a medium yellow to slight orange color with a slight soapy white head, but it died off very quickly. There was also a slight degree of cloudiness in this beer. The aroma was light with definite coriander, orange, lemon and citrus in there. Light to medium bodied beer with a dry, malty but tart finish. Its definitely a summer brew but it had a nice mellow long-lasting finish. It began to smell and taste like a grassy field in the middle of Kansas as it warmed but it was definitely very light on the carbonation. Relatively unexciting, but worth the try!

name: Dogwood Summer Brew
review: Medium orange gold color. Small to no head. Aroma is orange, coriander and lemon. A light to medium bodied white. Malts are fruity, with lots of orange and a ton of coriander. Light and refreshing, kind of grassy tasting. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet. Might have been a little bit old, carbonation was kind of flat.

name: Dogwood Winter Ale 2001
review: 12 oz. bottle from TheBeerSommelier- thanks, Matt! Wow, first rating in over three years. This one pours a cloudy, deep gold color with a white ring. Sweet aroma of toffee, cookies, brown sugar, honey, and a coppery metal note. The flavor also has that copper note finishing toffee, brown sugar, apples, and honey. Light-medium bodied, with low carbonation and a sticky mouthfeel. This one is not bad after 11 years. We all enjoyed it.

name: Dogwood Winter Ale 2001
review: Appearance: Pours a hazed, orange-amber body with a thin, oh-so tired ring of white bubbles. Smell: Interesting aroma of a particularly fruity, aged past its peak wine, like a Viognier, perhaps, served up with a pairing of local jams and jellies. Taste: Sweet candyish, honeyed flavor with a blend of fruit flavors: golden raisins, yellow apples, and peach jelly. Light oxidative hints throughout, but nothing to fret over. Nil bitterness as the hops long ago picked up stakes and moved on. Mouthfeel: Medium-plus body. Medium-low carbonation. Rather sticky mouthfeel at this point. Drinkability: Its interesting to see how this has changed and morphed since it was first released, though Ill echo the sentiment of its initial reviewer, beergirl99, and say that, years later, it is still a very nice ale.

name: Dogwood Winter Ale 2001
review: Bottle shared by kp. Pours a hazy light golden amber with a small off-white head that didnt hang around for long. The aroma was fairly sweet with lots of light fruits and some esters from the yeast. Taste followed the aroma with a dominate light fruit sweetness and some Belgian yeast. Mouthfeel is pretty carbonated given the age and sticky sweet in the finish. Despite showing some signs of age with hints of oxidation in the aroma and taste, this one has held up exceptionally well for the age.

name: Dogwood Winter Ale 2001
review: (12oz bottle, thanks artusory) Small beige head atop lightly hazed light amber body. Aroma is medium sweet, stewed apple, apple wine, alcohol. Taste is medium sweet, apple wine, some yeast. Medium body. Hard to believe the ABV was that low.

name: Dogwood Winter Ale 2001
review: 12oz bottle, courtesy of artusory. Thanks, Ryan! Pours a hazy, golden orange color; off-white head with solid, medium-bubbled retention and lacing. Lots of apples, chewy yeast character and wheatiness, candy sugar in the aroma; some dried caramel from the oxidation, but a very pleasant yeast character overall. Medium-to-full mouthfeel: lively carbonation; almost to the point of champagne-like apple cider; solid acidity and a dense yeastiness and caramel-apple note; probably a bit past its prime, but this is still very generous and very good at this point. Lengthy finish, showing honey, apple, and yeast.

name: Dogwood Winter Ale 2001
review: Hazy, light amber with a small white head. Sweet nose with tons of apple cider, some caramel, herbs and riesling. The flavor is lightly sweet with lots of apple, peach, caramel, rye, light oxidation and spice. Medium body is light and lively with high carbonation.

name: Dogwood Winter Ale 2001
review: Bottle courtesy of ? (most likely TBC or slob). Pours mahogany with some spritzy bubbles. Smells of ginger, dry malt, touches of spice. Tastes of pepper, sweet malt, sugar, some molasses, hints of spice. Considering its age and ABV, this one held up very well.

name: Dogwood Winter Ale 2001
review: A little smokey and quite refreshing for a winter brew. The wheat comes out as the beer warms.

name: Dogwood Winter Ale 2001
review: Name: Winter Date: November 06, 2002 Mode: Draft Source: Twains, Decator, GA Vintage: 2001 Appearance: hazy dark yellow, whispy head Aroma: spicy sweet aroma Body: thin body Flavor: dry malt flavor with a spicyness from start to finish, slightly alcoholic but masked by a hint of sweetness, just a touch of bitterness in the finish Name: Winter Date: November 06, 2002 Vintage: 2001 over the last year this beer has gone from a sweet malty beer with a strong spicy burst to a mellower drier beer with a mild spicyness from start to finish Name: Winter Date: October 30, 2003 Vintage: 2001 big aroma with a very smooth flavor, only a hint of alcohol Name: Winter Date: January 10, 2009 Mode: bottle Source: GMoT tasting Vintage: 2001 sweet and spicy, holding up well, Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 16/20 Rating: 3.5/5.0 Score: *** /4 The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Dogwood Winter Ale 2001
review: Pours out a nice orange color with a nice white head. Aroma is very yeasty with some spicy notes to it. Flavor was very much the same with a bit of sweetness to it. Unfortunately, this beer had alot of oxidation in the flavor as well. This brew was certainly past its prime.

name: Dogwood Octoberfest
review: A little light for a marzen. Could have used more Munich malt. A good malty flavor though - but nothing special.

name: Dogwood Octoberfest
review: Date: 09/10/1998 Mode: Draft Source: Wild Wing Cafe, Marietta clear yellow, whispy head, light malt aroma, light malt flavor, hint of bitterness in the finish, not much to it, good but boaring -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 10/12/2000 well balanced, but still not true to style - needs malty sweetness -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 10/11/2001 Score: i to ii opaque rust, thin fine beige head, light fruit aroma, rich body, fruity, lots of belgian character, light bitter finish, balanced, gets better every year, very good, but an octoberfest? -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 09/19/2002 hazy light amber, thin fine off-white head, sweet fruity aroma, rich malty flavor, still more of a belgian than an octoberfest Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.7/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Dogwood Octoberfest
review: Thaks to kp for this one. This was surprisingly good for a two year old beer that is not from a style known for cellaring abilities. Pours with a large white head over a clear medium amber body. Malt dominated aroma that is bready and lightly toasted malt. A bit fruity (apple) for an Ofest/MArzen. Sweet well balanced flavor. Some oxidation present as expected, but not overpowering enough yet to disguise the fact that this was a fairly decent beer in its day. Good body and finish.

name: Dogwood Octoberfest
review: On tap.. Poured a clear copper color with a small white head. Aroma is sweet with some roastedness. Flavor has some sweetness then finishes with some sour notes and bitterness. Light to medium body. This came in an imperial pint glass and I really didnt want to finish it.

name: Dogwood Octoberfest
review: Wasn't too bad. An average beer from dogwood. Way better than the bock and summer, but worse than the decadant.

name: Dogwood Octoberfest
review: Heavily carbonated and it sure doesn't taste like any other octoberfest I've ever had. More fruity than malty. I don't think it's a good representation of the style... I'll take a sam adams or paulaner any day.

name: Dogwood Octoberfest
review: Pale copper golden color with a thin head and mostly flat body. Bland macro-like aroma of stale hops and corn grains with some apple juice. Body really tastes like apple juice with some grainy maltiness and a sugary finish. Not much of an oktoberfest if you ask me. Probably closer to a cider.

name: Dogwood Octoberfest
review: What a strange take on an Oktoberfest. Mine was a cloudy yellow color with a rather large head. Flavor was sour and slightly hoppy? This was like a watered down APA. I thought this style was supposed to be very malty? This may be the worst Dogwood I've had yet. And perhaps they should read up on what an Oktoberfest is suppose to taste like. An ok beer I guess.

name: Dogwood Octoberfest
review: A nutty, caramel aroma and a pleasing malty taste. Not too heavy, but it did have a "gummy" aftertaste. A little too hoppy for the style, but still smoother than their ale varieties.

name: Dogwood Octoberfest
review: 12 oz bottle, goblet. Large, frothy, creamy head is white and diminishes slowly. The body is a hazy orange-peach color with little visible carbonation. Nurtty, caramel malt (mod); flowery hops (mod); corriander and date aromas. The aroma is very nutty and spicy; it reminds me of a brown ale. Moderately sweet, lightly bitter flavor becomes a lightly sweet, moderately bitter, lightly acidic finish. Lingering, bitter, nutty flavor. Medium body, watery texture, soft carbonation. The bottom line is: yeah it's hoppy for an O'fest so...think of it as a malty pilsner.

name: Dogwood Bock
review: A little fruity and thin. Caramel and malt along with a little hoppy flavor.

name: Dogwood Bock
review: Date: 02/11/1999 Mode: Draft Source: Wild Wing Cafe, Marietta amber, frothy white head, good sweet malt flavor, touch of carmel, hint of esters, balanced but not hoppy or bitter, complex for a bock -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 04/11/2002 creamy malt flavor, low bitterness, malty but dry, great carmel character -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 04/15/2004 still very rich carmel malt flavor with only a touch of sweetness and just enough bitterness in the finish to keep it honest Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 16/20 Rating: 3.4/5.0 Score: ***/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Dogwood Bock
review: Pours a rich golden brown with a 1/8 inch tan head. dissipates quickly but leaves some persistent lace. Smell is malty and lightly fruity. Taste is malty and light sweet caramel. Fruity too. Lightly bitter in the aftertaste. Medium bodied with the caramel aftertaste. Stickiness lingers after its gone. Cant put my finger on it but there is something in the finish that I dont like the taste of. Not bad. A pretty fair bock beer.

name: Dogwood Bock
review: I was very sad to see Dogwood close and it was because of this beer. I first tried it as a sample at the Rusty Nail on Buford Highway and immediately went to Greens and bought a 6-pack. While not the greatest beer in the world, it was intriguing enough for me to see if Dogwood could bottle a consistent beer. This was the only beer made by Dogwood that I ever had that didnt have a skunky bottle in the pack.

name: Dogwood Bock
review: On tap at Summits Wayside Tavern...NOt one of my favorites but unfortunately i have lost my notes on this one..

name: Dogwood Bock
review: Poured a rather hazy amber color with a pretty light head, even with a vigorous pour. Not too much complexity in the aroma The flavor was very malty, which I enjoyed as I am not a huge fan of hops. On the whole however, this beer did not impress me, and will surely ot be one of my repeats.

name: Dogwood Bock
review: I like wacky label art as much as the next guy, but this one seems to suggest that goats and beer bottles were delivered to Earth by U.F.O.s...not sure why theyre implying this, just seems a little bit weird... Cloudy, dark amber color, with a fizzy, buzzing, active, slim cream-colored head. In the nose, a toffee-ish sweetness, soft, sweet, fruity. In the taste, more of the same, well-modulated, nice and juicy...pretty nice bock bier, I says. Ah, nice flavor rising up with every sip. Medium bodied, nice, sweet finish. Got to hand it to Dogwood, UFOs or no, this is a beauty of a bock.

name: Dogwood Bock
review: Poured amber with a moderate, short-lived white head. Rich of aroma of malts -- and thats just about it. The flavor was much the same, a sweet caramel maltiness but just not enough hops to balance. And the beer was too thin for my tastes. Not a bad brew, but not remarkable in any way. For a brewery that I hold in such high regard as Dogwood, Im disappointed. Im even more disappointed, however, to see Dogwood closing its doors. Farewell to a great brewery.

name: Dogwood Bock
review: Bottle. Brought this bottle back from GA and it was worth the trip. Rich amber color with a medium head that dissolved into just a thin sheet of light bubbles. The aroma is malt, smoke and yeasty. The first thing I get from the taste is a light hop bite then a full malt taste that blankets the tongue. Ive noticed Dogwood uses malts very nicely, subtle and not too rich. I usually dont use "chewey" to describe a liquid but this description fits here. Caramel taste as the beer came up in temp.

name: Dogwood Bock
review: Not much head out of the bottle. Its not that important. Dogwood beers have been great so far. Again, this is very good. Dark Amber color, Good hops/malts, smooth with nice gravity and a quality mouthful feeling. This is one of the beers from Ross whos a great trader and should be congratulated for passing 400 beers a couple of days ago. Thanks Ross great beer!!!

name: Paulaner Premium Pils
review: (Draught at Maximilians, Berlin, 8 May 2019) Golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty, hoppy nose with notes of bread, cereal, grass and herbal hops. Malty, hoppy taste with bread, cereal, grass, herbal hops and a dry finish with a balanced bitterness. Medium body, quite dry. Fresh and tasty pilsener. Quite enjoyable.

name: Paulaner Oktoberfest Bier (Wiesn Bier)
review: Illatban szinte csak az alkohol rzdik. Egy kis citrom egy kis szegf, vagy nem tudom igazn mg mit lehetne belle kirezni. zben szinte ugyanez a helyzet. Nem egy itatja magt kategria. Kedvenc semmikpp sem lesz.

name: Paulaner Oktoberfest Bier (Wiesn Bier)
review: One of the better is Oktoberfest beers. But still has that odd quality of most that I dont like and cant quite identify. Konsum dresden

name: Paulaner Oktoberfest Bier (Wiesn Bier)
review: Ganz lecker und berraschen guter geschmack. Aus der dise deswegen keine eiteren angaben.

name: Paulaner Oktoberfest Bier (Wiesn Bier)
review: 500ml can. Clear golden yellow with a foamy white head. Flavors are bread, sweet/biscuity cereals and honey with spicy and herbal notes. Light to medium, good carbonation, smooth texture.

name: Paulaner Oktoberfest Bier (Wiesn Bier)
review: Color amarillo cobrizo, cristalina. Dos dedos de espuma con buena retencin. Aroma herbal y ligero cereal. Gusto a cereal, pan integral, notas de miel y amargor herbal. Cuerpo acuoso. Marzen de manual, ideal para beber a litros.

name: Paulaner Oktoberfest Bier (Wiesn Bier)
review: 2 x 50 cl bottle @ home, BBE 08/2020 Aroma is grainy with malt and butter. Flavour has grainy malt, butter, some grassy hops and mild menthol. Clean, somewhat crisp and malty and nicely balanced. Traditional mrtzen at its best.

name: Paulaner Oktoberfest Bier (Wiesn Bier)
review: 6%ABV. Festbier. Tapped out clear gold. 6SRM. Nose has aromas of grain and fresh-baked bread. There are pleasant beery aromas. Clean nose with hints of DMS and diacetyl. Mouthfeel is light with moderate carbonation. Perfectly clean, clear, lager mouthfeel. Palate has flavors of toast, bread crusts, toasted grain. Overall, the malt backbone is clean grain without much else, soft, and pronounced without being full. Hop flavors are herbal, minty, hint of wood and forest-y. Finish is clean with a light herb-like minty bitter. Overall, a really good style example. Always pleasant, glad to have put this down in writing finally. Enjoying a good Bavarian lager is like enjoying roots cuisine, its sometimes nice to appreciate what a well-made basic beer tastes like again.

name: Paulaner Oktoberfest Bier (Wiesn Bier)
review: 0.5 bottle. Vilgos, bzakalsz szn, szp tiszta, habja apr lyuk fehr. Illata nem tl intenzv, inkbb a koml fel hajlik, a bajor malta ellen :) Kzepesen testes, desks, kesernys nmet alap lager z, tbb alkohollal. A gyrtl a Salvator a kedvencem, a bzi kiemelkedek, ez oktoberfest lttre nem nagy szm, de szp kis kerek nmet nagyzemi.

name: Paulaner Oktoberfest Bier (Wiesn Bier)
review: On tap at the Siren's Calling, Portishead 4/10/2019. Golden in colour, with a thin white, head and moderate carbonation. A touch of floral hop, sweetish malts, some lemon fruit, giving way to a lingering, bitter finish. Fine.

name: Paulaner Oktoberfest Bier (Wiesn Bier)
review: Bought at BC liquor stores in 2012, $12 CAD, cellared for 7 years. Attack: crisp bite, incoming maltiness Mids: lvl4-sweetness, liquid barley malt Finish: metallic, fishy astringency Overall: basic flavour for the style, barely drinkable, the metallic fishiness is off putting.

name: Paulaner Hefe-Weissbier
review: En copa, cerveza trbia con una generosa capa de cremosa espuma blanco hueso. Aroma predominante a cereales, junto con pan, grano, levadura, pltano maduro y levadura. En boca, textura espesa, se carbonatacin baja/media y amargor suave. Sabor dulzn a cereales blancos, con una mayor presencia de fruta madura como pltano, grano, pan y un fondo de levadura. Una Weissbier clsica, y a la vez de las mejores de su estilo, bien equilibrada y completa. Si la hay disponible, siempre la pido.

name: Paulaner Hefe-Weissbier
review: Big beautiful whitehead, very foamy. Very murky nice appearance. Fresh aroma, a little bit fruity and alcoholic.

name: Paulaner Hefe-Weissbier
review: One of the best of its kind. Fresh, delicious, all in the right place. Must

name: Paulaner Hefe-Weissbier
review: Aroma is bananas, sweet grains, and cloves. The taste is sweet wheat notes, bubblegum and banana esters.

name: Paulaner Salvator
review: I really surprised about the moderate ratings here. This beer is absolutely amazing.. Nothing wrong here. All on this beer is very pleasand and great.. First of all the aroma is very fruity and remind you some classic Trappist Belgian beer.. The taste and the mouthfeel is simple wonderful. Many caramel and fruity notes here and the finish is just amazing.. Malty and slightly bitter finish that remind you very strong some Belgian beer.. Also the beer is dangerous drinkamble and you cant notice the 7.9% ABV.. Overall one of the best German beers i have try so far. All here is very balance and beautiful.. Difficult you can find something bad..

name: Paulaner Salvator
review: Bottle pour with a light brown color. Aroma of brown bread. Flavors of the same with a hint of molasses, a hint of sweetness with a medium body.

name: Paulaner Salvator
review: Color naranja oscuro, cercano al marrn, ligera neblina, translcida. Espuma beige amarillento de ms de dos dedos de espesor y buena retencin. Aroma a maltas tostadas, ciruelas y vino tinto al servir, al atemperar aparecen canela, frutos secos, almendras sobre todo, madera, pltano maduro, pasas y caramelo. Sabor en esa lnea y en ese orden, final de amargor herbal y alcohlico medianamente intenso, alcohol agradablemente notable. Textura entre acuosa y oleosa. Carbonatacin media baja

name: Paulaner Salvator
review: 11.2 oz. bottle. AROMA: Very sweet with scents of bread, brown sugar, and caramel. APPEARANCE: Pours an opaque, orange-brown with a dirty-tan head that dissipates quickly and minimal lacing. Overall, its appearance is a bit on the "muddy" side. TASTE: Tastes almost exactly like it smells ... sweet, with notes of brown sugar, malt, and caramel. MOUTHFEEL: Full-bodied with a slick and creamy texture. Carbonation seems a bit low for a beer of this type. There is not much of a finish at all. OVERALL: This is what I would consider a "typical" doppelbock. Which is to say, it is a pretty tasty beer. But there's nothing to make it stand out from all the other ones. Basically, if you put one in my hand, then I will drink it and graciously thank you for it (while asking you for another). However, if I go to a bar, then I'm not going to remember that I've ever had this beer, much less that I actually enjoyed it.

name: Paulaner ThomasBru (Original Mnchner Alkoholfrei)
review: Bottle at a Restaurant in krn. Pours hazy orange. Nose is earthy, malty, faint weizen notes. Palate also mostly malty Sand like Aroma, hints of citrus and banana . Not too bad for a alkoholfrei.

name: Paulaner ThomasBru (Original Mnchner Alkoholfrei)
review: Almost clear golden appearance, medium head. Malty aroma, sweet. Decent Low Alcohol beer.

name: Paulaner ThomasBru (Original Mnchner Alkoholfrei)
review: Bottle. Clear light gold pour with a small soapy white head. Sweet grain and bread. Clean. As far as NA beers go, this is decent.

name: Paulaner ThomasBru (Original Mnchner Alkoholfrei)
review: 330ml bottle into a shaker glass; served cold. Aroma: Yeasty and bready. Like a fresh loaf of honey wheat. Appearance: Clear gold body with a pretty large, but dissipating, foamy, white head. Taste: Fresh bread. Light, mildly sweet, and no hop bitterness. Palate: Light bodied, but not watery. Short, mildly sweet finish. Overall: Im kind of shocked I like an NA beer this much. Its pretty tasty!

name: Paulaner ThomasBru (Original Mnchner Alkoholfrei)
review: Pours clear yellow with a small white head. Smell straw and an odd kind of rice quality. Taste sweet grainy, lager yeast and wet hay. More of the yeast seems to come out in this than a regular lager. Light bodied and sweet Not bad

name: Paulaner ThomasBru (Original Mnchner Alkoholfrei)
review: Appearance: Golden color with a fine white head that leaves a nice lacing. Aroma: Wort and mild fruity. Palate: Medium body. Slightly sweet and a almost no bitterness. Average carbonation. Taste: Mild wheat, wort and fruity notes. Overall impression: An acceptable ok low alcohol beer. Personal stats: Bottle from Haxen Kiraly Etterem in Budapest, Hungary

name: Paulaner ThomasBru (Original Mnchner Alkoholfrei)
review: Golden coloured beer with a medium white head. Aroma is sweet malt with some cereal notes. Flavor is sweet malt with some some honey notes. One of the better low alcohol beers.

name: Paulaner ThomasBru (Original Mnchner Alkoholfrei)
review: Golden with a thin white head. Aroma is sweet and grainy with an odd stagnant water smell - swampy? Flavor is rather neutral with some redeeming bitterness and (as with all NA beers) a short finish. Not the best NA beer, but certainly not the worst.

name: Paulaner ThomasBru (Original Mnchner Alkoholfrei)
review: Slight lemon and mushroom aroma. Earthy. Pour is a crystal clear brushed gold with a while head that lingers and leaves some slight foam down the glass. Taste is cereal grain. Some soapiness in there. Quick, crisp finish. At the very end there is some nice chewy-ness. Very good for an NA.

name: Paulaner ThomasBru (Original Mnchner Alkoholfrei)
review: From bottle to tall glass. Has the same aroma as Paulaner original Munich lager but much more faint. Earthy, stone, damp, and fresh. Looks like any other pale lager. Taste is slightly on the sweet side with a cancelling bitterness. Very soft and somewhat oily, sticky feel. Goes down like water. Very easy drinking. Overall, I like it. Its good to have beer available that wont put you on the floor.

name: Paulaner Bock
review: New to me. Draft at Fado in Philly. Cloudy copper pour that starts with a large foamy tan head. Toasted wheat flavors. Bit unusual to have some ruby red fruit as well. Plums. Challah. Hefty bock with some deep red fruit. Not so bad.

name: Paulaner Bock
review: Compact foam and of good persistence. Veiled and enough loaded aspect. Strong aroma, much alcoholic and sweet one.

name: Paulaner Bock
review: Nice bitterness. Not overly carbonated but not flat. I like this one and would get it again any time.

name: Paulaner Bock
review: In Munich in the beer houses, it was stated every time that this and Hacker-Pschoor Maibock were the same beer. They tasted the same. I love one I love the other

name: Paulaner Bock
review: Great full bodied, malty high alcohol taste, nice hop bite for a bock.......

name: Paulaner Bock
review: Has some backbone and thick alcoholic overtone that a beer drinker looks for. You will like this.

name: Paulaner Bock
review: If all bocks were this good, and it's my fourth favorite beer from the real royalty of brewing. Strong and tastey if your a seasoned drinker, you will like it.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Hefe Weisse
review: Top notch world class hefeweizen. Deep and funky and full, chewy, bubblegum. D&s dresden

name: Hacker-Pschorr Hefe Weisse
review: Dirty amber with an abundant head. Banana smell. Banana taste with a certain bitterness and acidity. Strong carbonation. Banana aftertaste. I never had a Hefeweizen with that much banana flavour before.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Hefe Weisse
review: 500ml bottle brewed in Germany at 5.5%. Cloudy, somewhat vibrant orange. Smallish quickly dissipating head. Aroma of wheat rusk, slight citrus, and banana. Moderate+ carbonation. Initial citrus slightly orange-juicey hop hit, a little rough on the tongue, seguing into a perhaps subdued classic weissbier finish of creamy rusky wheat and a touch of banana yeast. Seekers of a hoppy weissbier should definitely give this one a try, but although it holds its end up with the yeasty, wheaty aspects, they feel a little overshadowed here, with the beer perhaps even feeling disjointed between how it starts and ends in the mouth. Not quite the full-on creamy banana weissbier hit I love, but more than decent.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Hefe Weisse
review: On tap at Der Pschorr. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Big wheat bouquet. Wow, its all wheat but is absolutely fantastic. Great body and mouthfeel. So creamy and refreshing.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Hefe Weisse
review: Uma weiss bem balanceada, aroma agradvel e cor dourada turva. Sabor suave e bem maltado.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Oktoberfest Mrzen
review: Drank by the liter at tents is Munich during Oktoberfest, this beer is decent, but I', sure I wouldn't like it otherwise. Pours a clear golden yellow with fluffy white foam that leaves moderate lace. Aroma and taste of clean yeast, floral hops, and light malt. Does the trick.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Oktoberfest Mrzen
review: W zapachu trawiaste chmiele oraz aromaty cytrusw - gwnie limonki. W tle sodowo. W smaku lekko sodowe w typie skrki ciemnego chleba, leciutki karmel oraz oczywicie cytrusy - znowu limonka. Goryczka niska w typie trawiastym. Piwo ok.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Oktoberfest Mrzen
review: 500ml bottle brewed in Germany at 5.8%. Crosses the line from gold/yellow lager colour into a very light tawny brown! Mild grassy aroma, slight spiciness developing. Fairly large but shortish-lasting head. Moderate carbonation. Grassy hops, with slight(!) tangerine-y citrus spiciness, merging perfectly with a plain brown-bread malt. A little sweet overall. This is like their Muenchner Gold with more flesh on its bones. Superbly simple, splendid with food, doesn't wow in any regard but is salubrious from start to finish. Unconcerned with impressing, only with being pleasant. Super clean and uncomplicated, without feeling conspicuously stripped-down or overly focused. The drinker's Maerzen. Connoisseurs might not find enough to interest them much, however, and perhaps lacks some of the robustness that typifies the style - this one really is light in its caramel-y nature.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Oktoberfest Mrzen
review: On tap at the Siren's Calling, Portishead 4/10/2019. Amber in colour, with a thin white, head and moderate carbonation. A touch of floral hop, rich and sweetish malts with a vaguely spicy edge, giving way to a lingering, bitter finish. Good.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Oktoberfest Mrzen
review: Bottle picked up from Edeka, Freising 'Steine Park' and consumed at home, Attenkirchen, Friday 18th October 2019 listening to Iggy Pop on 6Music. Pours light amber with a white head, quite malty on the nose, hinting at the sweetness that will follow. This doesn't really stray from the track much, it's what it says on the tin *bottle. Good.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Oktoberfest Mrzen
review: 0,5 l bottle. Clear dark red golden in the glass with a two finger foamy head. Looks really good. Taste is malty, low roasted, little bit fruity, scratchy palate in the second part. Some hop bitterness in the aftertaste. Below average carbonation.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Oktoberfest Mrzen
review: Birra ambrata dal leggero retrogusto amaro. Sensazioni di lievito, fiori e sentori di miele. Schiuma pressoch inesistente se spinata dalla bottiglia. Apprezzabile con carni chiare tipo maiale e pollo.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Oktoberfest Mrzen
review: Keg. Pours amber, off white head. Toasty caramel aroma, noble hop profile. Well balanced. Soft carbonation.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Oktoberfest Mrzen
review: Pours and amber with a golden edge and white head. Malt forward aroma and taste, slight floral hop character. Notes: on tap at the Hacker Pschorr tent at Oktoberfest Munich, Oct 19

name: Hacker-Pschorr Oktoberfest Mrzen
review: Bottle poured a clear amber with a small lingering ivory head. Aromas of toasted malt, graininess and light caramel. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of toasted malt, graininess and a hint of earthiness with a crisp dry lingering grainy finish.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Dunkle Weisse
review: Pleasant banana ester aroma with a banana bread taste. Slightly sour finish, not as much caramel as the higher rated Bavarian dunkelweizen. Still a must try for fans of the style.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Dunkle Weisse
review: Trbe, dunkelbraune Farbe mit weier Schaumkrone. Fruchtiger, hefiger, malziger Geruch. Geschmacklich fruchtig mit Banane und Karamell, hefig, malzig, leicht wrzig. Mittlere Se mit leichter Bitterkeit, mittlerer Krper mit aktiver Kohlensure.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Dunkle Weisse
review: Bottle, hazy orange color with a smaller to medium sized top. Light lacing. Nose and flavor of banana, apple, caramel, pear, grass, and florals. Lots of fruity wheat complexity as it opens up. Medium bodied with quick finish.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Dunkle Weisse
review: Tap at the Hackerhaus - clear light brown color, beige head. caramell, dark malts, yeasty, medium sweetness, good!

name: Hacker-Pschorr Edelhell
review: On tap at Der Pschorr. Served in a chilled glass, its a vibrant yellow pour with a white head. Bread and malt highlights run the show. Hints of bitterness, hints of caramel, with a creaminess factor to it. Average body and mouthfeel.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Edelhell
review: From Holzfass at Der Pschorr. Clear golden liquid with medium egg shell white head. Aroma of bread, floral hops, light earth, light grain and very light sulphur. Taste is very light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of floral hops and bread. Medium bodied with low to medium carbonation. Nice stuff.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Edelhell
review: From the wooden cask at Bayerisch Donisl Thursday 17th January 2019. We had this with an early lunch of Kraut-Schupfnudeln mit Speck und Salat. Pours crystal clear gold with a white head. Fruity with a good bitterness, nice beer a little dry finish. Really enjoyed this. A6 A4 T8 P4 Ov14 3.6

name: Hacker-Pschorr Edelhell
review: Draught off a wooden cask at Del Pschorr, Munich, Germany (5.10/0.5l). Poured a crystal clear gold with 2-3cm of bright white open foam that retained very well and laced well. Carbonation low, average and fine. Aroma subtly of malt and very subtly of citrus. Taste is quite malty with moderately strong sweet citrus; tasty enough. Light body. Smooth, crisp and moderate sweetness on a moderately long finish.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Edelhell
review: Fat @ Der Pschorr. Klar guldfrgad med ett vitt skum. Dofter av malt och rter. Smakinslag av malt, citrusskal, grs och rter. Frisk och ren. Gott i vrmen.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Edelhell
review: Tap at Der Pschorr in Munich. Pours gold with a large white head. Mild Nobel hop aroma. Flavor is some and bready. Sort of Kolsch on steroids. Nice on a warm day.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Edelhell
review: Holzfass. Golden with a lasting white head. Malty aroma with a touch of herbal hops. Full bodied sweetish malty flavour with herbal hops and a yeasty touch

name: Hacker-Pschorr Edelhell
review: Kzepes hab, mly szke szn. Kellmes, gabons, jl cssz, knnyed, egsz ests sr.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Edelhell
review: From old tasting notes. Labeled as "Hackerbrau Edelhell". Huge white head tops a brassy gold liquid. Faint sweet malt nose. Zesty tart malt flavor. Citrusy malt finish. Light hop traces. Tasty but uninspiring.

name: Hacker-Pschorr Edelhell
review: Tap at Der Pschorr, Munich - Bright golden color with nice white head. This is your standard bavarian Helles from a big company. Nothing exceptional.

name: Lefebvre Floreffe Double
review: Fles 33cl thuis gedeeld. Caramel, anijs, droog, hazelnoot, fruitje, chocolade, beetje cappuccino. (15-11-2019).

name: Lefebvre Floreffe Double
review: This is an ok double. Light on the overall mouthfeel and low in alcohol. Nice head when poured. Fruity and medium to low sweet. Ok but not a deal breaker.

name: Lefebvre Floreffe Double
review: Aroma van karamel, zoethout, anijs, sommige donkere vruchten, kersen, lichte chocolade en subtiele kruiden. Uitzicht: Een robijnrode kleur met een medium beige kop. Smaak: donker fruit, kersen, chocolade, wat bruine suiker, zoethout, licht anijs, een beetje karamel en subtiel kruid. Mondgevoel: Gemiddeld met matig koolzuur. Afdronk is zoetig, fruitig.

name: Lefebvre Floreffe Triple
review: Donkergele Tripel met zeer grote witte schuimkraag. Licht zoet met een klein bittertje in de afdronk. Mooi in balans

name: Lefebvre Floreffe Triple
review: Stevige tripel met fructose geeft een goudgeel bier met goede schuimkraag en prima balans tussen zoet en bitter.

name: Lefebvre Floreffe Triple
review: the aroma is fruity and floral with hints of sweet citrus, apple, esters, apple stone and some spices... the taste is fruity and floral with notes of sweet and bitter citrus, esters, fruit stone, apple and grass hop... the aftertaste is sweet, bitter and dry...

name: Redhook IPA
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: It's been a while since I had this beer, but I remember it being a good IPA. I think I bought it at a Safeway or Fred Meyer in bottles. One of the first beers I drank when I started drinking Craft beers a number of years ago. Redhook Brewery has been making good beer for quite awhile now.

name: Redhook IPA
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Exactly what you think of when you go into a craft brewery and ask for their ipa. Light crisp. Hops but not overly hoppy. Balanced. Bottle

name: Redhook IPA
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Light orange color, citrus hop aroma. Very fizzy, and not having much flavor.

name: Redhook IPA
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: A mild aroma of citrus and hops. Pale amber color not much head. A pleasant balanced taste with just a touch of bitterness. A short lasting slightly bitter palate.

name: Redhook IPA
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Reviewed from notes. The appearance had a orange-copper cloudy body with a small white head, no lacing. The smell was hoppy, floral with some grassiness and lemon notes. The taste had strong hops, yet still some spices come out as the beer warms. The palate was about a medium, sessionable, strong hoppy grassy finish, no aftertaste. Overall, this was a pretty good AIPA, Id have this again.

name: Redhook Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: From old tasting notes. Cloudy, yellowish gold color. Big bubbly white head. Huge citrusy wheat malt aroma. Crisp, spicy wheat malt flavor has a peppery character that lays on the palate.

name: Redhook Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Below average hefe, a bit watery, not much taste going on, pretty much run of the mill, not really too impressed.

name: Redhook Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Hefeweizen 1998 12 oz. Bottle. 4.75% ABV. (3.75 / 5.0) 1999--Wheat Flavor Medium Bodied 12 oz. Bottle. 4.75% ABV. (3.75 / 5.0) Light unfiltered straw golden body. Light wheat body. Fruit flavors tasty but not overpowering. Body would be richer if pellicle were not so hard packed. Nice delicate brew. Sampled 11/29/1999. 2000--New Red Logo 12 oz. Bottle. 5.20% ABV. (4.0 / 5.0) Very hazy lemon orange juice color. Big rich tight pellicle. Rich wheat front with minimal yeastiness. Malty mildly spicy body with hint of banana clove. Minimal citrus notes and rich textured finish. 8/29/2000.

name: Redhook Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: I havent seen this in 6 packs in years, but I do recall the days when Id get this and meticulously roll the bottle back and forth on the table to release the sediment so I could have a nice, cloudy pour. A bit uninitiated to beer-nerddom at the time, I took it for what it was worth, a nice tasty beer. Im sure nowadays itd pale next to 99 out of 100 other hefes I try, but I liked this enough to take the time to rate it. Last time I drank this was in Dallas, TX back in 1997.

name: Redhook Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle at Chicos. Pours a standard hefe- cloudy gold, with good white head. Aroma is yeast and a bit of citrus, not overpowering. Taste is refreshing and moderate spice- could use a bit more flavor. Very little hop.

name: Redhook Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Had this beer on 4/3/1999. Color is a pale hazy gold with very good carbonation and good head. Aroma is an odd sour malt scent. Taste is a little more bitter than other Hefe-Weizens Ive had. It starts with medium light body that goes down crisp with a bitter feel. The finish is odd, theres bitterness coming from the malt flavors as well as the hops. There is also a hop flavor in there somewhere. Overall it doesnt fit as a Hefe-Weizen and is not much fun to drink.

name: Redhook Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: cloudy yellow in color. some yeasty smell and a little citrus. No bitterness really and seems to need a little something to round it out.

name: Redhook Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Date: 05/14/1998 Appearance: cloudy dark yellow, Aroma: slightly sweet citrus hop aroma, Flavor: tangy wheat flavor, light bitter finish Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: Redhook Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Nice light yello with that white lace along the glass. Nice wheat phenolic flavors. Good drinking summer type brew

name: Redhook Hefe-Weizen
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Very light, with a german light hop aroma and cloudy appearance. Has a light easy does it mouthfeel, that has some phenolic spiciness to it. Finishes very dry and smooth.

name: Redhook Double Black Stout
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: This was the beer! When this first came out 2 decades ago or so, this was the beer that got me hooked (no pun) on craft beer! I've always put this at the top of all beers. Not because it's 20 % alcohol, or barrel aged for 3 years in 5 different barrels. This beer was just pure coffee stout at its finest. Made and discontinued twice, remade under Budwiser (which was not good) and then gone forever. Dark, silky smooth, Starbucks coffee, rich like Founders or Nebraska beers have been for the last 10+ years. The price was great, and the beer for its time, had a finish that started just like the 1st sip. Thanks Redhook for all the great memories on that beer! I still keep my last original bottle unopened from 2003 in the 1st spot on my top ten shelf!

name: Redhook Double Black Stout
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: From old tasting notes. Opaque black color topped by a bubbly tan head. Rich roasted malt aroma hints at coffee. Bittersweet roasted malt flavor has notes of chocolate, coffee and licorice.

name: Redhook Double Black Stout
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: "this reflects a higher grade than id ever thought id give a Redhook beer, and a lower score than i give most strong stouts. it was just good. nothing special, and there are better beers for the price, or less. the body left a little more to be wanted, and it was a little on the bitter side, and not in the mouth watering hoppy good way."

name: Redhook Double Black Stout
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Rated on 10-30-2011. This bottled beer, Batch 08-0410, pours a small tan head that is fully lasting. This beer has a black opaque body with very little carbonation and spotty lacing. The aroma is malt, chocolate, coffee, and lightly roasted. The flavor is sweet, lightly bitter, malt, coffee, chocolate, roasty, light hops, and a dry finish. The mouthfeel is lightly tingly and this beer is light-medium bodied. This beer has a lingering roasty coffee aftertaste and is a beer for coffee drinkers.

name: Redhook Double Black Stout
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: 22 oz bottle, probably a year old, served in a tulip glass. Pours dark inky brown with medium thick body and creamy brown head. Aroma is chocolately dark roasted malt and sweet espresso on the finish. Taste is smooth rich roasty malts, mild dark chocoate sweetness, subtle coffee flavor, and sharp spicy hops bring bitter balance to the finish. A really rich tasty brew; belies the fact that its only 7%. I think this has been retired for a while now, which is a real shame - shows what Redhook is capable of and is way better that most of what theyre brewing these days.

name: Redhook Double Black Stout
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle. Black pour with thin fast dissipating head. Aroma is coffee and berry. Lightish body and flavour has roast and coffee notes. Light coffee finish. Earlier Rating: 11/26/2008 Total Score: 3.8 Bomber. Poured black wtih thin fast dissipating head. Aroma of caramel, malt and coffee. Coffee flavour on a solid malt backbone. Caramel notes. Lingering coffee finish. Worth going back to.

name: Redhook Double Black Stout
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Draft at brewery. Pours dark brownish black with a very thin head. Strong bitter coffee flavor. Medium body and medium carbonation. Smells like coffee beans and burnt chocolate.

name: Redhook Double Black Stout
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Tap. Pours opaque black with average, creamy tan head; decent retention and lacing. Aroma is roasted and chocolate malts, coffee, figs, plums, earthy hops, and light vanilla. Flavor is roast malts forward with supporting ash, chocolate, coffee, earthy hops, and light toast; dry finish. Medium body and low carbonation.

name: Redhook Double Black Stout
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: 22 oz. bottle- Pours black with a one finger dark tan head that is reducing fairly quickly. Aroma is roasted malts, coffee, and chocolate, could be more assertive. The taste is the same as the aroma, the coffee they used is high grade, good. The body could be fuller, but the carbonation is spot on. Overall this is a good coffee stout, not the best out there, but not bad.

name: Redhook Double Black Stout
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Pours a pitch black color with a fluffy khaki head with light lacing. Smells of chocolate caramel and coffee. Tastes of all the same things I mentioned in the smell with plus vanilla. The coffee comes out more in the flavor. Mouthfeel is light and watery. Overall this is one of the better tasting beers Ive tried from their blueline series.

name: Redhook Blackhook Porter
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Backlog rating. Pours a deep brown to black with a finger of beige head that lingers, then dissipates. Roasted malt nose with coffee and light chocolate and berry notes as it warms. Roasted malt and coffee on the palate, light fruit character heading towards the finish. Balanced, light and easy drinking.

name: Redhook Blackhook Porter
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Grunt fill from Albertsons. Dark brown, almost black, small beige head, streaky lacing. Looks great. Muted aroma, roast grains, coffee. Taste is also a straight forward porter, sharp bitterness. Finishes quick. Good entry level porter.

name: Redhook Blackhook Porter
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle 12 ounce bottle, poured to tulip Sight: pours black, big brown foam that slowly dissappears, Smell: fragrant Taste: very good, bitter Mouth feel: good carbonation Overall: very good beer, repeat: no look for: no

name: Redhook Blackhook Porter
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle. Bronze brown color. Aroma: sweet, caramel, fruit and berry jam (blackberry), a little milk. Taste: sweet, jam, candied berries, caramel, light dried fruits, mild hop bitterness.

name: Redhook Blackhook Porter
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Dark black with an off white head. Nose is roasted coffee, dark malt and a hint of dark chocolate. Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, and coffee grounds. Lightly bodied, with light carbonation. This is an average porter. It doesnt do anything unexpected.

name: Redhook Blackhook Porter
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Deep brown, moderate off- white head. Aroma: roasted malts, caramel, dry fruit, citrus hops. Similar taste. Quite dry. A bit watery. Pretty drinkable.

name: Redhook Blackhook Porter
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Pours dark chocolate brown with a decent buff head. Aroma features roast malt, molasses and subtle licorice tones. Flavor offers roast malt, smoky hops, and touches of molasses and licorice. Mouthfeel presents good body, sassy fizz, and a smoky roast malt and charred hops finish. Hooked on Porter!

name: Redhook Blackhook Porter
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle pours black with a one finger brown head and light lacing. Aroma is of coffee and bread. Taste is mostly coffee, some light sour bitters, a touch on the grainy side, especially in the aftertaste. Bitterness is mild and the aftertaste is fairly pleasant. Decent.

name: Redhook Blackhook Porter
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: 355ml bottle from Bliznetsy in Moscow. Pours dark brown with as small tan head. Aroma is mild roasted malt, bit of lactose, quite weak. Taste is malt, dark fruit, caramel. Very ordinary beer that tastes like it could have been made by any old brewery.

name: Redhook Blackhook Porter
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: (12oz bottle) AROMA: roasted notes, dark bread, coffee, APPEARANCE: rich dark, tan head TASTE: roasted corn/grain, dark chocolate, raisins, bran, PALATE: moderately rich, soft, creamy, some oiliness. OVERALL: a decent porter with classic coffee and chocolate and roastiness. Not too heavy, relaxing and warm.

name: Redhook Blonde Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Easy to drink, mild malts and not much bitterness. Passable session, reminds me of college.

name: Redhook Blonde Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Nothing here except crystal clear bubble h20. I guess on hot day no infections or wierd stuff going on. What youd expect n a blonde. Id drink over any of big boys sucky stuff.

name: Redhook Blonde Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Reviewed from notes. This was poured into a pint glass. The appearance had a golden blonde color with a one finger white bubbly and somewhat foamy white head. There was some light lacing that slid into the beer. The smell had a light sweet corn, light citrus and a piney hops to it. The taste followed the nose. On the palate, this one sat pretty light and came across pretty sessionable. Overall, decent to good blonde ale I could see maybe possibly having again depending upon what else was there.

name: Redhook Blonde Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Ive always loved the session mild drinkable beer, its been a staple for me since its release, and it is being released again in 2014. It is clean tasting and refreshing.

name: Redhook Blonde Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: 8/17/2011. From bottle. Pale yellow with a white head. Corn, malt and hay aromas. Little going on in terms of flavors. Light hops, watery and just boring.

name: Redhook Blonde Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Another beer I had awhile back but apparently forgot to rate. A ho-hum beer (like so many redhook beers to me).

name: Redhook Blonde Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Not great but not horrible. Aroma and flavor is very mild. Not very complex and a bit watery. Just boring.

name: Redhook Blonde Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Pours a pale bubbly yellow with aroma of hops mixed with a slight sweetness of fruit. Taste is slightly sour with a hint of hops that dissapates after the swallow. Overall a decent blonde golden ale with no complexity.

name: Redhook Blonde Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a deep gold with about a finger of white head. Aroma of light citrus and a little bready wheat. Taste is lightly bitter. Medium-light bodied with a somewhat thin texture. Lively carbonation and a decently long finish. Overall, not bad. Nothing I would seek out but I would drink it again.

name: Redhook Blonde Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Clear golden color, some carbonation, very small head, light lacing. Grain and biscuity malts, with a bit of hops giving a dry finish.

name: Redhook Winterhook Hoppy Dark Lager
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle, that pours an amber red with a medium khaki colored head. Alright lacing. Nose is caramel malt, squash, bread, fruit, and other weird veggie type stuff. Flavor most of the same. Medium or lighter bodied.

name: Redhook Winterhook Hoppy Dark Lager
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Pours a clear reddish amber with a thick creme head. Aroma of sweet earthy malt and grass. Taste has resinous hoppy malt. Palate has oak. Good beer, very much like an IPA.

name: Redhook Winterhook Hoppy Dark Lager
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Roast and lots of wood. Very astringent for what it ought to be. Pours mahogany with good head and great lacing. Astringent end. Tap at brewery.

name: Redhook Winterhook Hoppy Dark Lager
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Pours a dark amber with a tan head. Smells better than it tastes. The roasted malts, coffee, and dark fruit on the nose dont come through as well on the tongue. Its a pretty mild beer with a surprising bitterness.

name: Redhook Winterhook Hoppy Dark Lager
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Love the bottle. Aroma of hops and malt with some dried fruit. Overall I found it to be a medium body. A solid beer.

name: Redhook Winterhook Hoppy Dark Lager
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Nice and interesting but quite bitter ad most of this brewery works. NICe shape and great aroma.

name: Redhook Winterhook Hoppy Dark Lager
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Pours a deep dark caramel. Minimal smell of dark malts. Taste is lightly bitter, but not hoppy. Slight vegetable taste. Medium bodied, but alcohol is noticeable.

name: Redhook Winterhook Hoppy Dark Lager
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Backlog rating. Pours a deep amber to brown with a finger of beige head that lingers. Toasted malt aromas with some caramel and floral hops. Earthy on the palate, with some mineral notes, caramel, toasted toffee and soap. Bitter finish, with herbal/floral notes with faint alcohol.

name: Redhook Winterhook Hoppy Dark Lager
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle at the Wine-Boutique, Felixstowe. Pours mid to dark maroon brown with a lasting bubbly off-white head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, dark fruits and hops. Moderate sweetness, medium plus bitterness. Medium body, slight oily texture, average carbonation.

name: Redhook Winterhook Hoppy Dark Lager
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Hazy Brown with foamy beige head Aroma is sweet mild fruit and grain blend with hints of chocolate Flava is grainy woody with mild hop spice and nice balance with a malty backbone Feels medium with nice zingy fizz Finishes dry mildly bitter

name: Redhook Nut Brown Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Aroma and flavor is nutty malts, mild fruit and a standard brown ale/smooth finish.

name: Redhook Nut Brown Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: "Fairly typical brown ale, which is to say, pleasant enough but nothing special. I guess thats all i could have hoped for. Ive only had a couple standouts from RH. Anywho, light roast and caramel, with a hint of nut and chocolate in the nose and aroma. A tad too carbonated.

name: Redhook Nut Brown Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle sample from old notes. Pours brown with auburn highlights and a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor have nuts, brown sugar, caramel toasted malts and light citrus. Some earthy notes to the finish. Average at best.

name: Redhook Nut Brown Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle, pours brown with a cream colored head, toasted malt taste with some caramel and nuts. Not bad.

name: Redhook Nut Brown Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Appearance: Clear dark browns with garnet edges under a khaki head that fades into a creamy layer. Swirls thick but with no lace. Nose: Chew sticky caramel squares. Skor bars. Cinnamon and nutmeg along the edges. Cinnamon spiced apple slices in the middle  soft. Chocolate powder drifts along an Autumnal breeze. Graham crackers on top. Palate: Medium to medium-light weight. Dry in the middle with apple skins, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Slick along the sides with a mixture of melted treacle, toffee, and caramel. Whisper of diacetyl in the back mingles with a nondescript nutty bitterness. Chocolate powder in the breath. Final Thoughts: Not too shabby of a nut brown ale from Redhook; Id drink it again. The only slightly off-putting note was the weird sweet bitterness in the end, but maybe my bottle was old. Overall though a pleasant surprise which I enjoyed from first quaff to last.

name: Redhook Nut Brown Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Drank straight from the bottle. Leftover from a tailgate in which the game was so bad that the beer remaining became the highlight of that swirly Saturday evening. A smooth and medium bodied brown ale with nice barley notes and a bit of sweetness. Not bad.

name: Redhook Nut Brown Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: 12 oz bottle pours brown with a thin tan head. Aroma of caramel, nuts, and a hint of pine. Taste is roasted malt, nutty and bread.

name: Redhook Nut Brown Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Not very complex but it did the job on a hot summer day and was very sessionable. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Redhook Nut Brown Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Dimpled mug. Reddish brown with no head or lacing. Very little nose. OK taste of nuts and malts. Ends with a slightly thick mouth feel. This was an old bottle and I am unsure what if anything to attribute to that. Very disappointed

name: Redhook Nut Brown Ale
brewery: Redhook Brewery (Craft Brew Alliance - AB InBev)
review: Bottle 12 fl oz Aroma: malty , sweet sided , slight nutty hop hints, touch of black tea , tannins. Fruity finish. Look: dark amber with hint of brown, mi lighter fizzy creamy cap. Taste/palate: sweet front with soda like feel , plenty of caramel. Sweet mellow mid. Too sweet even for me. Far too sweet. Slight hint of lemongrass at finish.

name: Morland Old Speckled Hen (Filtered)
review: Bij de philip thuis een amber kleurig lichaam met een witte kop en met een amber fruitig aroma een kruidig mout caramel fruitig droge bitter smaak met een bitter einde

name: Morland Old Speckled Hen (Filtered)
review: Ar: toffee, malt, caramel Ap: copper, creamy head T: malty, med sweetness P: thin/med body

name: Morland Old Speckled Hen (Filtered)
review: Kolor bursztynowy, klarowny. Piwo przykrywa bardzo wysoki, biay, spieniony puch. Dugotrwaa piana pozostawia sporo zdobie na szklance. Aromat: mocna, intensywna sodowo okraszona przez chmielowe nuty trawiaste, miesza si z akcentami spalonego karmelu i odrobiny toffi. Smak podobnie, karmel, sodowo, troch toffi i moe nawet nieco masa. Goryczka, hm ... no jaka tam jest ale nic szczeglnego. Wysycenie rednie do wysokiego. Treciwo na poziomie rednim.

name: Morland Hen's Tooth
review: Bottle. Pours a clear deep amber colour with a frothy off white head. Aroma of bready malts, fruit, some toasted grain, slight yeast, a hint of nuts, caramel, ginger and subtle spicy hops. Taste of bready malts, toasted grain, slight nuts, caramel, fruit and subtle spicy hops. Medium bodied and soft carbonation. A dryish, spicy fruit and toasted malt bitterness in the finish. Expecting a lot worse to be honest. Very malty, traditional, sweet on the tongue. Then some English hops, spice and fruits. Not bad actually.

name: Morland Hen's Tooth
review: Piwo wypite jaki czas temu. Tylko oglna ocena w celu uzupenienia profilu.

name: Morland Hen's Tooth
review: Fles 50cl thuis. Maltig, zoeten, kleffig, droppig, ook bittertonen, syrup. (1-2018).

name: Morland Hen's Tooth
review: 17Mar2018 Twigs, bitter grain malts, straw, grass, hay. Clear gold, small, creamy, white head. Light sweet. Bitter grain malts, straw, some caramel appearing, more twigs, grassy bitterness in the finish. Not great. Bottle from Tesco, Amersham.

name: Morland Hen's Tooth
review: Piwo wypite jaki czas temu. Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnie z degustacji, w ramach uzupenienia profilu.

name: Morland Hen's Tooth
review: Bottle from Tesco. Clear deep amber. Nose is sweet resinous and caramel malty, biscuit, toffee. Tastes caramel malty, sweetish, wood, light bitter, light boozy, biscuit.

name: Morland Hen's Tooth
review: 500mL bottle from Vintage Wines. Malty aromas, skunky hops. Clear amber with a mostly fading white head. Strong, sweet, malt-dominant, light booze, lightly herbaceous. Full bodied, sticky.

name: Morland Hen's Tooth
review: 500ml bottle. Poured a clear copper colour with a frothy white. The aroma is malt, rich sweet red berry fruit, woody hop. The flavour is moderate bitter light sweet with a rich sweet malt, fruit, dry crisp woody hop bitter palate and a long bitter finish. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

name: Morland Hen's Tooth
review: Piana obfita o rednich i duych oczkach, utrzymuje sie. Kolor klarowny bursztyn. Aromat sodowy owocowy przyjemny. Smak uderza wysokie nasycenie i elazo. Jest sodowoc karmel, lekko owocowe. Klasyczne angielskie ALE z redni do wysokiej goryczk lekko wyczuwalnym alkoholem. Przyjemne dobre. Ciekawe, warto sprbowa cho zachwytw nie ma.

name: Morland Hen's Tooth
review: Butelka 0,5 l. Barwa ciemno miedziana, klarowna. Aromat chlebowy, delikatnie karmelowy. W smaku brak peni.

name: Morland Original Bitter (Bottle)
review: March 2008: clear 500ml bottle, no BBD found, it must last forever! Poured into a pint sleeve.
