Good healthy looking copper/amber colour, clear with a few bubbles rising up to the white foaming head. A sweet almost candy aroma hits your nose at first, it peters away to not much of anything, almost aroma-less towards the end. Fairly bitter and refreshing taste, like a good English Bitter should taste. Hops and malted barley both evident, a good strong flavour when first tasted. Although it has bite to it, there is a flaw in the beer. It doesnt have enough umph to stay flavoursome in the mouth, it fades away very quickly to a nothingness. Better than I anticipated, and not bad really.

name: Morland Original Bitter (Bottle)
review: Bottle. Amber colour with a thin white head. Sweet aroma. Caramel and som hop in the flavour. A bit waterish.

name: Morland Original Bitter (Bottle)
review: Rating from an old notebook. Bottle. Amber, thin head. A thin and boring bitter thats actually quite a chore to drink. This is a decent bitter on cask but in the bottle it is not good by any means.

name: Morland Original Bitter (Bottle)
review: Bottle from Morrisons. Aroma is typically green king, appley toffee yeast character, herbal nd grassy hop. Taste is similar, its actually well balan ced, however i can never get passed the apply toffee character.

name: Morland Original Bitter (Bottle)
review: Dark amber in colour. Smell of malt and hops. Slight malty taste. Fizzy. Wouldnt say it was bitter as it stated on the bottle.

name: Morland Original Bitter (Bottle)
review: Bottle. Amber with an off-white foam. Aromas are sweet caramel and biscuit with earthy hops. Flavours are caramel malts with tea and some light herbal notes. Dry towards the finish. Has hints of cardboard. Similar to Old Speckled Hen.

name: Morland Original Bitter (Bottle)
review: 500ml bottle from Morrisons. Amber clear colour with disappearing beige head. Lots of candy sugar on aroma with some faint hop. Bit of yeast. Its a dullish bitter in the mouth with poor pasteurised flavours. Some yeast flavour. Very faint hop presence on end. Bit of toast.

name: Morland Original Bitter (Bottle)
review: Copper amber. Medium malty aroma. Taste is initially sweet and malty, but a nasty metallic quality lurks beneath ready to spoil it. Not much else to say.

name: Morland Original Bitter (Bottle)
review: Clean, shining and dull. Nose of vague nuttiness, wood, caramel. Trickles of lace. A dram of hopless stale malt. Soft and watery with butterscotch and soapy metallic hops. Slightly vile, bluntly bitter.a waste of pence and units. My least favourite kind of filtered dead cardboard ale.

name: Morland Original Bitter (Bottle)
review: Pretty boring really, especially when compared to Speckled Hen and Hens Tooth from the same stable. It has a bit of that Hen maltiness, but not much else - pretty bland.

name: Morland Tanners Jack (Bottle)
review: Pretty decent bitter. Light and smooth, though not as smooth as I'd like. Bitter finish more pronounced than expected. Light honey and some grass. Tried for the first time back in 2010 and only now transferring the rating.

name: Morland Tanners Jack (Bottle)
review: Bottle from old backlog notes. Pours a clear orange color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have grainy and lightly sweet malts, toffee, floral and light herbal hops, thin and nothing pops, seems old, I wouldnt (and havent) revisit this.

name: Morland Tanners Jack (Bottle)
review: 12 oz bottle pours amber with a white head. Aroma of sweet malts, floral,and grain. Taste is malts and grain.

name: Morland Tanners Jack (Bottle)
review: Nice malty aroma. Nice brown colour with good head. Very nice nutty flavour and smooth finish. Medium body with very low carbonation.

name: Morland Tanners Jack (Bottle)
review: Veryt nice with the English style in there. Creamy and not ritring. Easy to drink and fine aroma there.

name: Morland Tanners Jack (Bottle)
review: Pours copper-amber with a frothy, parchment coloured head. Aroma is slightly skunked, (clear glass) caramel malt, flowers. Taste is slightly nutty, slightly stale, caramel malt. A bit of earthy, leafy bitter. Ok, but a bit bland.

name: Morland Tanners Jack (Bottle)
review: Bottle - good size foamy head, clear light copper color, sweet malty and corn aroma and flavor, mild hop bitterness, not bad overall ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Morland Tanners Jack (Bottle)
review: Pours a copper color with a decent head that fades to some lacing. Aroma of citrus and mild malt sweetness. Taste of malt, some caramel sweetness and mild citrus in the background. mild bitterness and a fairly dry finish. Moderate body and smooth with a nice balance. Enjoyable Bitter, nothing fancy but still quite solid.

name: Morland Tanners Jack (Bottle)
review: Drank directly from a crystal clear bottle. This beer is classified as a bitter but I find very little bitter attributes within. Very mellow and easy to get along with. Some cabbage on the pop but that is to be expected considering the bottle. Nice clean lookin almost brown pale beer. Yes, goes down fairly easy. These lower alky beers are fun to deal with. There are some ale attributes present but fer sure its better than some of those moreland beers Ive had like speckeld hen but this may not be as good as the golden hen I had on cask. On the finish this beer is trying to a little bitter but never quite gets there.

name: Morland Tanners Jack (Bottle)
review: 12oz bottle. Good clean hoppy aroma, caramel. Smooth, lighter crisp carbonation, light body - impressively easy to drink. Good light bitter taste. Clear orange color, nearly no head. Light bit of honey? Much better than expected

name: Ruddles County (Filtered)
review: 4,3%. Medium bitter aroma with notes of green pepperfruit. Clear amber with a very long lasting white head. Medium sweet taste with a touch of bitterness. Medium body, creamy texture & soft carbonation.

name: Ruddles County (Filtered)
review: Balanced, malt, toffee and hops. Notes of Blackberry and nice low CO2 level

name: Ruddles County (Filtered)
review: Can. It pours clear amber with a creamy off white head. The aroma is grassy and fruity with bready and caramel malty notes. Moderate bitter hoppy flavor with some malty sweetness.

name: North Coast Red Seal Ale
review: Bottle from Worcester MA Total wine & more. Pours caramelly amber with big, light mocha head, slightly oily. Aroma rather light: fruity and piny hops, noticeable malts. Tastes very good: resinous hops, pronounce, tasty bitterness, soft, sweetish malts, decent richness, well made. Very enjoyable.

name: North Coast Red Seal Ale
review: 4 month old bottle A: Poured a short thick tan head atop a deep orange gold body with visible bubbles. Average retention before head fell to a lasting ring. S: Light scent of pine, orange spice and dark toast. T: Zesty orange hop bitterness with some bread and caramel sweetness balancing nicely. M: Light body, lively carbonation and a very clean finish. Begs another sip. O: Maybe not outstanding by today's standards but hits all the right marks to make it an all around great pale/amber even at this age.

name: North Coast Red Seal Ale
review: Better than average across the board for an amber. Lighter brown appearance...balanced nice. Feel is borderline 4, but not quite that crisp. I'd say this is more like a seasonal, as it's just ehh for North Coast.

name: North Coast Red Seal Ale
review: Bottle at Golden Gate Taproom. Amber with a frothy head. Aroma of roasted malt and fruit hops. Flavour is red berry fruit, caramel malts, floral finish, a little pepper on the base.

name: North Coast Red Seal Ale
review: [12oz bottle from Albertsons, Fullerton, CA.] An amber pour with a thick cream head; earthy malt aroma; sweet malty taste with a burst of citrus; and a caramel fudge finish. Way too sweet for me.

name: North Coast Red Seal Ale
review: Bottle from a branch of Total wine in Sterling, Virginia. Deep amber in colour, with moderate carbonation. Light, citrus hops, rich, slightly toasty malts, red berry sweetness, caramel richness and lingering, dryish finish. Good.

name: North Coast Red Seal Ale
review: Coffee and dough, very strong and I for once think the label does a good job describing what the drinker is in for.

name: North Coast Scrimshaw
review: On tap. Clear golden body. Smells of lightly sweet and bready malt and a touch of floral hops. Tastes of a little bit of spicy hop up front with a bready malt profile. Back end has very little by way of hop presence. Light body. Easy to drink. It's fine.

name: North Coast Scrimshaw
review: Well I picked up a six-pack of this pilsner earlier this summer just to try something different from North Coast other than their Rasputin imperial stout. Overall in my experience this was a pleasant and refreshing mild pilsner that was light and quaffable while maintaining a traditional European noble hop presence. This consistently poured a bright full golden color with moderate carbonation, and with a classic pale pilsner maltiness on the nose. The pale malts are a little sweeter than usual in the taste, but the palate dries out quickly with a crisp herbal hoppiness in the finish. Not quite medium-bodied, this is a nice sessionable pilsner that admittedly isn't as full-flavored and bitter as a proper German pilsner, but it's a good balance of drinkability and character. Non-GMO certified ingredients are a bonus!

name: North Coast Scrimshaw
review: Medium gold pour, thin but steady head. Nose is Pilsner malt. Middle shows a medium mouthfeel, little oily on the tongue, sweet (almost carmelized) malt, some steady herbal hops. Finish is mild herbal bitterness with a little length. A little sweet for the style, but a very pleasant beer.

name: North Coast Scrimshaw
review: Bottle pour. Clear yellow with a foamy white head. Light sweet malt aroma. Light to medium smooth body. Small bitter with a little salty finish. Very easy to drink.

name: North Coast Scrimshaw
review: Backlog, bottle that pours a yellow gold with a small white head and average lace. Notes are bland hops, heavy malt, grains, and light spice. Probably a bit too sweet for a pils. medium bodied with lighter carbonation.

name: North Coast Scrimshaw
review: No, this isn't some super complex thing. It's a beer that is crafted well and can be an all day easy drink, so calm down hipsters. Not everything needs to be a mona lisa to be good.

name: North Coast Scrimshaw
review: Bottle from a supermarket in California - golden color, white head. an average good pils with some hoppy notes. medium bitterness. okay.

name: North Coast Scrimshaw
review: Bottle. Golden pour with malty aroma. Mouthfeel is a bit watery but the hops and malt are well balanced. What really makes this shine is that (per their website) this only has 100 calories a bottle and only 2 carbs. It's already impressive but that's just icing on the cake. A light craft beer that tastes good? Wow.

name: North Coast Scrimshaw
review: On tap. Pours a clear golden color with a small head. Aroma of grass, quite floral and hint of malt. taste of light malt sweetness, trace of grain and herbs. Mild bitterness and a clean finish. Light body, smooth, easy drinker.

name: North Coast Scrimshaw
review: Bottle. It pours a clear gold color with a white head. It is effervescent. It is malty with a clean, crisp and dry finish.

name: North Coast Old No. 38 Stout
review: Bottle@Fat Cow, Shanghai. Dark brown-to-black, rocky tan head. Aroma coffee, malts, old paper. Medium light body. Moderately bitter taste, in line with aroma.

name: North Coast Old No. 38 Stout
review: Creamy tan head stayed on a rich dark brown body. Malt, demerara, parkin & Christmas cake aroma. Medium to full bodied, silky & smooth on the palate with a tingly clean back. Sweet tasting with malt, liquorice, raisin & milk chocolate with slightly burnt roasted finishing.

name: North Coast Old No. 38 Stout
review: 12 fl oz bottle. Pour is very dark brown black and topped off with a finger of light tan froth which persists briefly. Aroma is roasty and malty, coffee notes everywhere! Taste is more of the roasted malts, light itter, black espresso coffee, and some smokiness in the dry finish, as par for the course for an Irish dry stout. A little light bodied at times, but otherwise easy drinking as promised.

name: North Coast Old No. 38 Stout
review: On tap at the brewery pours out a dark brown almost black topped with a cream tan head. Nose is nice big roast malts coffee chocolate some sweetness. Taste is more of the nice sweet chocolate ash roast and coffee.

name: North Coast Old No. 38 Stout
review: Wygld: cakowicie czarne, piana beowa, rednio obfita, nie utrzymujca si zbyt dugo i szybko stajca si jedynie lacingiem. Aromat: delikatne nuty palonoci. Smak: delikatna palono, zbyt niska, by przesza w kwasowo, brak sodyczy, cho nie jest zupenie wodniste. Jak na lekkiego, wytrawnego stouta jest bardzo dobre.

name: North Coast Old No. 38 Stout
review: Ppurs black with small head. Aroma: coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate, touch of vanilla and marshmallow. Taste: roastiness, dark chocolate and marshmallow. Everything very smooth and drinkable, but with character.

name: North Coast Old No. 38 Stout
review: From Saveur Biere. In Ikea's pint glass. At lunch, with macaronni bechamel. No bb date but old. Pleasant dry roastyness with a ending sweetness. Strong bitterness and a tad smokey. Leaves a long, delicious aftertaste

name: North Coast Old No. 38 Stout
review: Bottle at Kill the Cat, Brick Lane. Kinda heavy malted, but a little bit bland.

name: North Coast Old No. 38 Stout
review: Black with a nice dark tan head. Aroma is roasty with caramel notes. Taste roasty, espresso, burnt toast. Nice and dry finish.

name: North Coast Old No. 38 Stout
review: Bottle @ Vagabund Tap Room. Served in Tulip. Deep black body with a small, vanishing, good lacing beige head. Aroma of vanille and plums. Taste is more coffeish. Bitter. Medium bitter finish. Medium to full body, soft carbonation,oily texture.

name: North Coast Blue Star
review: [12oz bottle from Total Wines, Huntingdon Beach, CA.] A hazy amber pour with a fast fading white head; weak grainy aroma with a touch of orange; sweet grainy body, with more orange juice; and little in teh way of a finish. Drinkable, but forgetable.

name: North Coast Blue Star
review: Draft at EPCOT food and wine festival. Pours hazy golden color with white head. Aromas of wheat and fruit. Slightly fruity and wheat flavors. Medium body with average carbonation.

name: North Coast Blue Star
review: 355ml bottle. Pours a cloudy gold-yellow with a medium, foamy, short lived, ecru head that laces. Mild aroma of grainy wheat malt, yeast, orange peel and black pepper. Sweet flavour of bready wheat malt, lemon, yeast and floral hops in a crisp, dry finish. Light body with a smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Refreshing and easy to drink, but a little weak.

name: North Coast Blue Star
review: Pint at Winking Lizard in Copley Ohio. Draft. Smell wheat and slight orange.. Golden in color with a hint of orange in the tint. Light white head. Taste the wheat. Nice and smooth. Medium bodied and easy drinking. Orange aftertastes. Nice beer and good for summer heat. Cheers!

name: North Coast Blue Star
review: 12 ounce bottle into pint glass, bottled on 11/6/2017. Pours fairly hazy/cloudy medium golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy off white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of lemon, orange, citrus zest, peach, pear, red apple, wheat, cracker, bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light pepper, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. A bit too fruity/yeasty aromas, but not overwhelming. Nice aromas with good complexity and solid balance of citrus/earthy hops, fruity yeast, and pale/wheat malt notes; with good strength. Taste of lemon, orange, citrus zest, peach, pear, red apple, wheat, cracker, bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light pepper, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Mild herbal, floral, grassy, spicy bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of lemon, orange, citrus zest, peach, pear, red apple, wheat, cracker, bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light pepper, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/earthy hops, fruity yeast, and pale/wheat malt flavors; with a nice malt/bitterness balance, and no astringent flavors after the finish. Moderately crisp/clean finishing. Lightly increasing dryness from lingering bitterness. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready/grainy, and lightly sticky mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.5%. Overall this is a delicious American pale wheat ale. All around nice complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/earthy hops, fruity yeast, and pale/wheat malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the mildly bitter/drying finish. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Perfectly balanced noble hops, fruity American wheat yeast, and pale/wheat malts. A very enjoyable offering, and impressive style example.

name: North Coast Blue Star
review: Kind of harsh taste, not much wheat beer kind of flavor. The bottle I got, bottled 3 months prior, had chunks of sediment, some of which stayed on the surface.

name: North Coast Blue Star
review: I admit, it suckered me in. That sassy little blue star on the label had me thinking of the great and glorious Dallas Cowboys......oh wait, this is 2018, not 1993! And the "taint" of Jerry Jones is strong indeed. From a feared franchise to this abysmal mess. It's true. When you want the CHAMP stick with Blatz. That shit is World Champion FOREVER. This "beer" was probably brewed by Jerry Jones, and strained through Charles Haley's mouldering jockstrap. Never again.

name: North Coast PranQster
review: We had this bottle of beer at home it was a very nice golden Belgian ale I enjoyed it in September 2019 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: North Coast PranQster
review: What a great ale. Pleasant Grassy smell Golden and hazy Up front taste is perfect and after taste is as well Highly recommend this golden ale to no beer drinkers and avid ones, as well. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: North Coast PranQster
review: 12 oz bottle. Smells a little floral with a hint of lemon. Golden yellow in color with a slight haze. Tastes sweet. Tastes of a bit of honey, banana, a bit peppery, with a touch of a floral taste as well. Finish is clean with a slight sweet aftertaste. Lively carbonation. Very nice and quite enjoyable if you are in the mood for a Belgian.

name: North Coast PranQster
review: This was good but I am not sure where it was aiming for -- is it a Belgian, is it a Saison, is it a ?. Poured yellow/golden color, 0.75" head which receded quickly with minimal lacing. Medium body which provided a nice mouthfeel. Aroma and taste were ok but more muted than I would have liked. I was hoping for something more boldly Belgian but this came up short for me. Decent, but not great.

name: North Coast PranQster
review: Let's face it, most American Belgian ale suck, mainly because of poor yeast. This is an exception!! Very good yeast, good body, smooth, good flavor throughout.

name: North Coast PranQster
review: 12 oz bottle.pours a hazy gold with no head. Scents of lacquer and yeast. Yeasty sweet flavors with a banana overtone. Oily mouthfeel with no carbonation. Pretty classic Belgian style character. Not bad.

name: North Coast PranQster
review: How much I wanted to like this...but didn't. Sweet and skunky aromas. Less than ideal mouthfeel with an alcoholic quench or the thirst. Decent flavors of golden raisins and leaves. Not bad but expected more. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: North Coast PranQster
review: Bottle from Earth Fare. Golden color. Thinning white head. Aroma is floral, fruity and yeasty. It has a nice maltiness to it as well.

name: North Coast PranQster
review: Aroma: yeast, malt, touch of spices Taste: malt, Belgian yeast, fruits and spices and pilsener hops.

name: North Coast PranQster
review: Aroma: fresh hop flower & malt Appearance: amber lightly hazy, smallish white head Flavour: hemp hop flavour, some toffee & malt Palate: thin but lingering

name: North Coast Traditional Bock
review: From old tasting notes. Hazy deep orange color with a creamy tan head. Delicious toasted malt aroma. Wonderful toasted malt flavor has a fair amount of hops upfront as well as in the finish. A sweet underlying maltiness throughout. Very tasty.

name: North Coast Traditional Bock
review: Date: 03/26/1998 Mode: Bottle Source: Chevy Chase, DC clear amber, whispy white head, candy sweet carmel malt aroma, heavy malt flavor, almost cloying, slight floral hop character, hint of bitterness, Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.8/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

name: North Coast Traditional Bock
review: Decent Bocky, breadey, slightly sweet malt nose with the slightest touches of alcohol and sulfer but very little head. Slightly hazed amber body is quite lovely but the lack of head retention still kinda bugs me. Mouth feel is a bit on the thin side at first but becomes more substantial a bit after warming. White bread, sweet malt, slight berry, earthy and herbal hops. Finishes spectacular with tons of nuts and grassy herbs. Long lingering bread dough and a little alcohol for warming.

name: Flying Dog Doggie Style Pale Ale
review: Very good beer. I love their heavier beers, but this is a light version of the Raging Bitch. Not a ton of bite, but still has some flavor. Awkward aroma until it hits your tongue. After taste lacks a little but still a very good beer

name: Flying Dog Doggie Style Pale Ale
review: # 451; 9/2016. Na APA chu pomrn zvltnho ovoce (ten). Celkov ale nepli poveden, slad, sladov, karamelov pivo s nepli vraznou, sladovou a mrn nahoklou dochut.

name: Flying Dog Doggie Style Pale Ale
review: Keg at the Draft House Northcote Road, Battersea in 2013. Clear mid golden with a dense white head. Aroma of grassy hops, pine and some perfumed notes. Those same hoppy, bitter flavours with a crisp finish.

name: Flying Dog Doggie Style Pale Ale
review: Muy buen aspecto con ms color de Amber Ale que de Pale Ale y espuma blanca de buena adherencia. Algo plana en nariz. En boca destaca el amargo, muy expresivo pero nada agresivo. Textura media-ligera y carcter muy refrescante. Para repetir.

name: Flying Dog Doggie Style Pale Ale
review: Cerveza con una cabeza espumosa color beige, de baja carbonatacin y ligera. Aroma dbil a lpulo y caramelo. En boca tiene un sabor ctrico, con un dejo a caramelo y lpulo. Fcil de beber.

name: Flying Dog Doggie Style Pale Ale
review: 4 month old bottle A: Crystal clear washed out pale orange with 1/2" of thick beige foam. Very good retention and thick lace. S: Orange, earth and lots of caramel or even chocolate. T: Moderately bitter with zesty orange, pith and pine hops. Malt notes of biscuit and bittersweet chocolate. Hops dominate but very well balanced. M: Medium light with a smooth chalky cocoa powder texture and very clean finish. O: This seems light years from the Doggie Style of old and although I have a nostalgic preference for the old one, I found this quite enjoyable.

name: Flying Dog Doggie Style Pale Ale
review: Bottle. Hazy pale amber color with a medium thin off-white head. Sugary aroma of pine and floral hops. Sweet taste, some bitterness. A bit oily feel. Medium body.

name: Flying Dog Doggie Style Pale Ale
review: Kaskilinnassa 2/2019. Hoppy, balanced pale ale, nice aftertaste. Enjoyable.

name: Flying Dog Snake Dog IPA (through 2007)
review: One of the first craft IPAs I sampled. Must have been around 1999-2000. Don't really recall how it compares to the recent one, which I just sampled last week. Seemed kind of mass produced on both occasions...with about average quality for the style. At the time though....it was one of the better choices...not so much nowadays.

name: Flying Dog Snake Dog IPA (through 2007)
review: Lovely label. Good beer. Ipa like an an ipa should be. Mouthfeel could be better. Aftertaste a bit too alcoholic imo.

name: Flying Dog Snake Dog IPA (through 2007)
review: From old notes. 330ml bottle. Light unclear golden orange color with off white head. Malty and hoppy aroma, caramel, citrusy fruity, light pine. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.alcohol,

name: Flying Dog Snake Dog IPA (through 2007)
review: Old rating. Bottle from Old Town. Pours a copper color with an off-white head. Aromas of floral hops, citrus and some malt. Taste is fairly well-balanced if not boring. British style IPA for sure.

name: Flying Dog Snake Dog IPA (through 2007)
review: From an old bottle. Pours amber with white head. Aroma is light malty with hoppy aroma. Flavor is malty, some hoppy. Pretty good.

name: Flying Dog Snake Dog IPA (through 2007)
review: average white frothy head. translucent thick dark yellow body. fair lacing. mostly diminishing. aroma: orange, flowers, heavy hoppy, honey, caramel. if: light bitter moderate sweet. ff: moderate bitter sweet; long duration. palate: light body, lively carbonation, watery texture, metallic finish. average, nothing special. R$40. 60s

name: Flying Dog Snake Dog IPA (through 2007)
review: .35l bottle @ Vihre Haltiatar Pours clear golden with low head. Leaves lacing. Aroma is hops, yeast, malts and dried fruits. Flavor is hops, malts and fruits. Some yeast.

name: Flying Dog Snake Dog IPA (through 2007)
review: Bottle. Pours amber with white head. Aroma is light malty with spizy hoppy aroma. Flavour is malty with bready caracter, some citruzy hop caracter.

name: Flying Dog Snake Dog IPA (through 2007)
review: Obviously been a minute, but I dont remember this being so different than the newer version, so heres the same rating: Well balanced well hopped single IPA. Nothing special here, just a good drinking brew, especially in summer!

name: Flying Dog Snake Dog IPA (through 2007)
review: This rating is a memory of the old brew. Ive always been a fan of Flying Dog (and have also long been a fan of IPAs) and remember being very excited to try this years ago. The result was not what I had expected and was a huge disappointment. Having had the newer brew on numerous occasions I have to say it is much more like what I expected out of a flying dog IPA when I first had this a long time ago.

name: Flying Dog Old Scratch Amber Lager
review: 12 ounce bottle drank at room temperature for a change. A bit tart for an amber lager but otherwise okay. Really weird label.

name: Flying Dog Old Scratch Amber Lager
review: Old rating. Never one of my favorites from them. Fairly malty body, some graininess. Pretty light bodied overall.

name: Flying Dog Old Scratch Amber Lager
review: Bottle. Deep Amber in colour. Very malty (biscuity malts, caramel). Fruity (citrus). Slight grassy hops. Sweet malty fruity beer. Easy drinking. OK. (2008)

name: Flying Dog Old Scratch Amber Lager
review: Originally had Jan. 2008 oured from a 12oz. bottle. Appearance: Pours a nice golden brown with a 2-finger head. Smell: Nice malt aroma and some nuts also. Taste: Malty & smooth with a faint bitterness in the aftertaste. Mouthfeel: Citrus-like in the mouthfeel, subdued but balanced, with very mild hops. As it warms, nut-like aspect and a certain wood quality is apparent. Maltiness maintained throughout. Drinkability: Very sessionable, smooth to drink. Though sampled in winter, would make a good summer brew.

name: Flying Dog Old Scratch Amber Lager
review: Originally rated on 7/22/08. Beer no. 1 out of a 12 pack sampler. Pous a nice deep amber body with lots of carbonation, but a small yellowish head. Aroma was a little nutty, and hints caramel as well. Flavor of roasted malts, nuts and caramel. Decent finish.

name: Flying Dog Old Scratch Amber Lager
review: I remember drinking this and thinking "Why does this weak ass lager taste like such a hoppy pale ale?" Its bitter in a way that isnt enjoyable and it has no fun qualities to make you come back for more.

name: Flying Dog Old Scratch Amber Lager
review: BOD 250/15. Pours a clear medium amber that is light garnet in intense light. World class head volume, lacing and retention. Somewhat light nose of caramel and earthy hops. Medium body that has a somewhat creamy texture. Superb carbonation with an effervescent burst in the middle and a nice prickly finish. The flavor profile is very good. Reasonably intense, slightly complex and very well balanced. It begins with a slightly charred caramel that is more nutty than sweet. The middle brings a mild earthy hop bitterness and flavor. Underneath is the strongest caramel appearance. The finish is a slow fade of the above coupled with a subtle tart fruit note.

name: Flying Dog Old Scratch Amber Lager
review: Nicely persistent foam. The aroma is weak, but suggests malt and a little fruit. Mouth feeling is tingling due to much carbon dioxide, but the taste does not fail immediately something. It has a tart fruity filling allowing only sporadic touches of caramel malt. Hop bitterness is intrusive. I think the hops are a little too dominant.

name: Flying Dog Old Scratch Amber Lager
review: 330ml bottle. Light hazy amber color with off white head. Malty and hoppy aroma, caramel, light grassy, light fruity. Sweet and light bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

name: Flying Dog Old Scratch Amber Lager
review: Botella 33 cl en el lpulo en octubre 2011 con fech de cons preferente para antes 13-02-2011 (R1340). amber suave ligeramente amarga, de lo mas sencillo probado de la marca. cuerpo ligero con 5.3 vol y 19.5 ibus de lo mas corriente. Normal.

name: Flying Dog Road Dog Porter
review: 12 ounce bottle from the sampler case. Above average on all counts. Totally bizarre label that takes a lot of getting used to and ruins the experience of an otherwise calming porter.

name: Flying Dog Road Dog Porter
review: On tap at Gillys in Rockville, MD. Clear, but very dark rusty brown with a small khahi head and fair lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, bitter chocolate and tomatoes. Taste of dark chocolate, dark fruit, bread, cola and licorice. Medium/full body and medium carbonation. This needs to warm a little for the flavor to come out.

name: Flying Dog Road Dog Porter
review: Backlog rating. Multiple bottles from Old Town. Pours a deep brown with a finger of tan head that dissipates quickly. Dark baker's chocolate aromas with some light prune and roasted malt aromas. Chalky dark chocolate, lightly sour prune and more roasted malt. Body is think and easy drinking, but the flavors don't come together as good as most do for the style. Lingering roast on the finish.

name: Flying Dog Road Dog Porter
review: Fles 33cl thuis. Stevig bitter, citrus maar ook wel wat vlak. (3-2013).----.

name: Flying Dog Road Dog Porter
review: After being sort of down on Flying Dog, I was expecting to not care for this much. Somebody had a variety pack at a camping trip and offered me a beer. This was the only one that interested me so I couldn't refuse. I know I bought the variety pack about 5-6 years ago, but couldn't remember what was in it so never got around to reviewing them, thus even more reason to try their porter again. The appearance was actually pretty decent....a dark brown near black. Not much aroma, which I find typical of most porters. I was hoping it would have a bit more flavor, but wasn't really expecting it to. Tastes of chocolate malts, slight coffee, enough hops to balance it out ok but a little light for a porter. I found this to be on the watery side, sort of like Yuengling's Porter, but for near-swill microbrew, an overall above average beer. I would recommend this as a "budget beer", but for what Flying Dog is charging can probably do better.

name: Flying Dog Tire Bite Golden Ale
review: 12 ounce bottle from the sampler case. A bit more tart than similar types but overall crisp and refreshing. Better than average.

name: Flying Dog Tire Bite Golden Ale
review: Draft at Moriartys. Orange pour. Appears to be an old keg. Malty golden ale with tropical fruit. Mango. Orange. Spruce. Wheat bread. Still has some spark. Spicy hops but smooth. Not complex but not bad.

name: Flying Dog Tire Bite Golden Ale
review: Originally rated on 7/22/08. Beer no. 2 out of my 12 pack sampler, poured a nice well carbonated body, white 1 finger cap. Flavor and aroma was a mix of a few hops, and sweet malt, a decent balance but slightly bitter. Overall not a bad beer but i probably wont try it again.

name: Flying Dog Horn Dog Barley Wine
review: Pours mahogany with thin, light tan head. Aroma is dried fruit and light roast. Taste is plum, moving to roast and building hoppiness. Finish is hoppy. A decent barleywine.

name: Flying Dog Horn Dog Barley Wine
review: Aroma - fig, caramelized sugar, alcohol. Alpearance - dark brown clean color, small beige head. That fades into a small collar. Taste - dark, fig, caramelized sugar, and slight bittersweet. Palate - body is medium, texture is slightly viscous, carbonation is average, finish is slightly boozed and bittersweet.

name: Flying Dog Horn Dog Barley Wine
review: Bottle from Norm's in Vienna, VA Aroma: caramel, licorice, alcohol Appearance: hazy amber with an off-white head Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, Tasty

name: Flying Dog Horn Dog Barley Wine
review: Mono, malce sladko, odlien barley wine. Steklenica. ......................

name: Flying Dog Horn Dog Barley Wine
review: Malty, faint plum aromas. Dark red in color with light head. Taste is malty of plum, raisin, faint black cherry

name: Flying Dog Horn Dog Barley Wine
review: From Apr 2007 This one pours from 12oz bottle a clear dark brown with reddish hues and a very small head of foam. The foam doesn't really shrink much from the pouring and there's some good sticky lacing there. Gorgeous looking brew to say the least. The smell has a lot of caramel malt and fruit to it. I note plum and cherry for the fruit. The taste on first sip is just like the nose. Big notes of plum and caramel malt with some cherry tartness that is especially noticeable when I swish the beer in my mouth. Quite complex and very flavourful. Further sips in and the alcohol is starting to make its presence known but not overly so....the malt and fruit of this BWSA just won't let anything get in the way of their domination. This may be the fruitiest example of the style I've ever tasted and for me, that's not a bad thing at all. Further sips in makes me glad I picked up a 4pack of this at Wilbur's in Ft Collins yesterday and...the price was darned reasonable at only $6.99!! I think the value for the money is really top notch. Well done, Flying Dog! Bottom line: An excellent sipping BWSA that I have no qualms in recommending. See some, get some.

name: Flying Dog Horn Dog Barley Wine
review: 2007 Vintage. Pours copper with almost no head. Sweetish bourbon and oak with vanilla, toffee and brown sugar. Just a little bit of oxidation, this has aged pretty beautifully. Full, round, vanilla finish. Very nice for this age, I thought it would be a drain pour.

name: Flying Dog Horn Dog Barley Wine
review: Pours a pretty copper w/ a tan head & plenty of lacing. The aroma is mostly malt w/ some booziness. The body is stunningly light for 10+%. The flavors of bourbon, oak, & malt really stand out. It has some caramel & slight bitterness in the finish. Complex, tasty, & overall a very nice offering!

name: Flying Dog Horn Dog Barley Wine
review: Bottled, 355ml aged 3yrs from S.H.Jones in Banbury, Oxon (when it was still open). Ruby to brown with off white head. If this were a wine I would class it as a dessert wine as it is sugary sweet more Muscato than Bordeaux. The sweetness lingers along with an apricot, alcohol note, warming, reasonably smooth. Unlike a wine I didnt spit as it is worth persevering with giving a glow on a chilly March evening. Went well with fried eggs, tomatos and potato if you are inclined.Reasonable.

name: Flying Dog Horn Dog Barley Wine
review: Dark tobacco brown with thin tan head. Brown sugar aroma. Heavy toffee molasses flavor and mouthfeel. Musty boozy finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Boddingtons Pub Ale (Can)
review: This is another one of my old reviews that RB has somehow lost. I'm estimating they're losing about 5% of old reviews. This beer is not as good as what I remember. Lots of solvent qualities in there.

name: Boddingtons Pub Ale (Can)
review: Pours very smooth and clean. Golden caramel color with a creamy white head. First smell impression was of honey and banana. Very smooth taste.

name: Boddingtons Pub Ale (Can)
review: Malt caramel aroma. Clear Amber colour great head and lacing. Malt caramel orange citrus flavour. Smooth palate.

name: Boddingtons Pub Ale (Can)
review: From can (a month past BB date) in dimpled mug. Pours amber w/creamy, slow-settling head, faint malt aroma. Smooth drinking, light caramel & honey w/very little bitterness in the finish.

name: Boddingtons Pub Ale (Can)
review: Can, Amber color with plenty of head and carbonation. Notes are so lacking and thin for the style. Some moldy bread, water, grain, rust and cream. Light to medium bodied. One and done on this beer for the rest of my life. Actually I would sip this one if the world was coming to an end in the very near future

name: Boddingtons Pub Ale (Can)
review: I bought this from the alko shop in Helsinki, I was really impressed with it so much better than the normal stuff

name: Boddingtons Pub Ale (Can)
review: Light and unintrusive, but overall pretty bland. Slightly creamy and bitter. Commendable head. Bonus points for sticking to 0.5 volume despite having nitro.

name: Boddingtons Pub Ale (Can)
review: Another rating from the old notebook. I never really enjoyed Boddies Gold, it came out in the era of creamflow as a fashionable serving method for bitter, which of course pretty much negated everything that was good about Boddies (pre-recipe changes) in the first place. So it was another weird creamy alcoholic liquid with a nondescript bitter finish, just marginally less watery that the creamflow ordinary bitter.

name: Boddingtons Pub Ale (Can)
review: Simply one of the worst beer i have ever had. watery and tasteless. The the only thing going right is its appearance as you pour it into the glass

name: Boddingtons Pub Ale (Can)
review: Surprisingly good, well served at Fiddleheads in Perth, surprisingly creamy head which add to the experience. With great company and great food, it was a perfect lunch while visiting this part of the province.

name: Boddingtons Draught Bitter
review: Can from Aldi. Amber with a fat coat of white head Pretty watery with a touch of cardboard as well as honey and a little stone fruit. But oddly the lack of body (combined with rather tentative nitro) brings the modest bitter finish into greater prominence - which for me makes it beat the Pub Ale. You could drink buckets of this but you wouldn't enjoy it much - if that isn't authenticity, I don't know what is.

name: Boddingtons Draught Bitter
review: Beer dark orange. Aroma bread and fruit. Bakery products. On the palate there is a slight bitterness mixed with honey-malt sweetness. aftertaste fruit and caramel tones.

name: Boddingtons Draught Bitter
review: Since it moved out of Manchester it was never the same, don't drink it anymore

name: Boddingtons Draught Bitter
review: Horribly watery with a metallic smell from the can. Mild malty taste, few hops. Really bad.

name: Boddingtons Draught Bitter
review: Tastes like nectar at the beginning. very drinkable. Could easily drink only this

name: Boddingtons Draught Bitter
review: I LOVE BOD, NOTHING GETS ME HARDER THAN THE THOUGHT OF ITS SUCCULENT TASTE TOUCHING MY LIPS OOoOOOoOOOo

name: Boddingtons Draught Bitter
review: The nitro widget makes no sense whatsoever... this is supposed to be a bitter! But it's a flat-tasting one, anyway.

name: Boddingtons Draught Bitter
review: Is there something I'm missing or is the reason that this tastes like flat beer because it pretty much is? Sorry maybe I just don't get Bitter.

name: Boddingtons Draught Bitter
review: Pint from keg. Bit malty, some light fruity notes. A bit sweet taste, but actually rather thin. Nitro style dense bubbles and head.

name: Boddingtons Draught Bitter
review: Can from Morrisons, Birtley, Gateshead. Dark golden coloured with a thick white head. It has a sulphur, metallic and toffee flavour with an extremely smooth, creamy, bitter earthy finish. Not bad.

name: Harpoon IPA
review: 9/11/2019. Can from Beer52. Pours pale amber with a short lasting off-white head. Aroma of hops, pine, leaves, sweet malt, caramel and syrup. Medium plus sweetness, light to moderate bitterness. Moderate bodym, sticky texture, average/prickly carbonation. Finishes with a bit of a spicy edge and some increase to bitterness. Not great.

name: Harpoon Ale
review: From old tasting notes. Amber orange color with a bubbly beige head. Fruity malt nose subtle malt flavor with a brief dry hop finish.

name: Harpoon Ale
review: Poured into an English pint glass, the appearance was a semi-golden bronzed sort of copper color to it. Some transparency in its body and has a fingers worth of white foamy to bubbly head. Quick dissipation. Sliding lace. The aroma had some bready malts with citrus in the background. The flavor takes the prior mentioned aromas and adds a dry woodiness to it. Nicely blended aftertaste with a smooth dry finish. On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fair sessionability about it. Good carbonation. ABV felt right. Overall, good for what it is, but didnt exactly look like an amber, everything else seemed mostly on par. Id have again.

name: Harpoon Ale
review: [2/2/17] Draught at Harpoon Brewery in Boston. Deep golden. Grainy, malt, bready, slightly fruity, a bit of citric hops, sweetish, bitterish finish.

name: Harpoon Ale
review: Pours a gold from a bottle, white head with some lacing. Fruity aroma, kind of a nondescript melon apple maybe? Similar flavor, some bitterness, rather big mouthfeel. Okay beer.

name: Harpoon Ale
review: Clear, amber color . Medium-sized , white head. Aroma of bread , roasted malt , herbs . Same notes in taste with moderate hoppy bitterness at the end. Decent brew.

name: Harpoon Ale
review: Smells of sweet bready malts slight citrus in the back drop. Clear amber color with small white head that dissappears quickly. Lovly flavor with wood like taste sweet bready malts smooth dry finish. Medium body with zesty crisp carbonation. This is a craft beer drinker light beer for sure. Love this one, Nice work.

name: Harpoon Ale
review: Amber color, clove malt aroma real lean. Not too plalatable for drinking more than one. A lighter berr ok but too cloying for a middle road brew

name: Harpoon Ale
review: On tap as Thoms Olde Ale at Harpoon Brewery, Boston. Pours orange with white head. Caramel malty, bit spicy, bit watery.

name: Harpoon Ale
review: Pours amber in color. A light malt aroma. Taste is rather light with malts, hops, citrus, and fruits. A light body and not a lingering aftertaste.

name: Harpoon Ale
review: Nice amber color; Medium body; Aroma of malt, & some citrus; Flavor of slight sweet malt, hops, citrus, and some caramel; Overall, a bit light - decent.

name: Harpoon Dark
review: Thick beige capped mahogany wafting sweetly with sarsaparilla spice, Allsorts, Jamaican ginger cake crumbs, molasses, bit of glossy preserved cherry. A bit big regional English but pleasant. Sweet layered malt with black cherry, lactic chocolate on caramel, Allsorts, a scatter of rust on black bread. Decent.

name: Harpoon Dark
review: 6/11/2019. Can from Beer52. Pours dark brown with a short lasting off-white to beige head leaving something that looked quite insipid. Aroma of moderate roasted malt, chocolate, dried fruit, caramel and light molasses. Medium plus sweetness, light bitterness. Moderate body, watery texture, average carbonation. Sweet roasty finish. Not great and not much of a beer to have had to bring up my USA 500.

name: Harpoon Dark
review: 330ml can from Beer52 in 2018. Dark brown. Aroma of dark malt, dates and brown sugar. Fairly thin body. Very light roasty flavours that build slightly in the finish.

name: Harpoon Dark
review: Aroma: Caramel, bread and some faint red fruits. Appearance: Deep red, clear. Creamy, white head. Taste: Sweet, a bit sour!? Medium bitterness. Palate: Medium body, average carbonation, quite smooth. Overall: Malty and smooth like it says on the can, but also slightly fruity and sour, real deal breaker for a lager.

name: Harpoon Dark
review: Can at home. Pours deep brown, nose is roasted, caramel, sugary, meaty, taste is similar, sweet.

name: Harpoon Dark
review: Can: Poured a dark brown black with a bubbly fast dissipating cream head. Aroma is toasty and roasty. Taste is dark malt, chocolatish, but metallic nails that screws it up.

name: Harpoon Dark
review: Creamy light brown head left a spotty cover on a rich dark brown still body. Dark chocolate, caramel, malt & zesty aroma. Medium bodied, tingly on the tongue with a smooth sticky back. Demerara, nutty, roasted, rich dark chocolate & lactose tastes with a tangy fruity finish.

name: Harpoon Dark
review: Can from Beer52, shared with Ashton McCobb. Pours clear red-brown with a thin white head. Aromas of chocolate and nuts. Taste is more of the same. Clean finish.

name: Harpoon Dark
review: Can thanks to allmyvinyl. Appearance - dark brown with a fluffy cream coloured head. Nose - toffee and nuts. Brown bread. Taste - creamy caramel and more hazelnuts. The bread is lighy burnt this time. Palate - creamy and roasty in texture. Medium bodied ish. Dry roasty finish. Overall - good example of the style.

name: Harpoon Dark
review: Can from Beerbods Appearance - pours deep dark polished wood brown with a reasonably large foamy head which died back quickly Aroma - toffee / stewed fruit sweetness and some rye/cereals, nice. Taste - rich, there's a strong sweet fruity christmascake note, but also a counteveiling toasted maltiness. Body - perhaps a touch thin, and therefore coming across a tiny bit hot. Needs to be fuller. Overall - sweeter than German Dunkels I've had, but it's brewed to an ancient-by-craft-beer-standards American recipe, so good as far as that goes.

name: Harpoon Pilsner
review: From old tasting notes. Bright copper color. Big creamy beige head. Fruity malt aroma is clean and fresh. Soft fruity toasted malt flavor. Pleasant spicy hop finish.well rounded and nicely balanced. A decent American Pilsner.

name: Harpoon Pilsner
review: Out of retirement and back with a Bohemian vengeance. Just finished my last one of these 12oz bottles. Probably had a dozen over the summer. They sure nailed this back into existence. Vibrant deep gold. Low, persistent lacing. Buttered wheat toast and hints of sweet lemon zest on nose plus a sprinkling of something green and herby. Taste follows smell with near perfect palate feel. Prolonged beefy and bitter middle tapers beautifully to a balanced clean, dry finish. A stunner of a return. I sure hope its this good next year. A note on pilsner in CT: NO LOVE. The CT distributor sold off their large remaining portion of this beer out of state cause they couldnt sell it here. Get over the cult beers, Connecticut, and drink some classic works of art. Congrats, Harpoon, but please bring back your perfect little Belgian-style pale.

name: Harpoon Pilsner
review: A beer that isnt produced anymore, but was actually quite enjoyable. Recently found an orphaned 6-pack at Kappys in Medford. Pale straw color with slight head. Crisp taste of malt on first tasting. Smooth aftertaste with only a hint of hoppiness. Wish Harpoon would re-release this so I could get a better batch to try.

name: Harpoon Pilsner
review: A buddy of mine dropped one of these off for me and said he found it in his closet...and didnt know where it came from, or how long it had been there...Hehe. Clear pale gold. Crisp clean malt nose. Small white head. Sweet at first, quick, light bodied, clean dry lightly hopped finish. Nothing special, perhaps thats why it isnt produced anymore.

name: Harpoon Pilsner
review: Once again Harpoon put out a beer that I can say I like. This is a beer that the unknowledgable beer drinker as well as the beer afficianado could drink together. A simple traditional pilsner with obvious flavor that sets it apart from the mass produced pilsners.

name: Harpoon Pilsner
review: Bright yellow/gold. Nice and hoppy with high carbonation. I agree with Volgon, this is a good first craft brew to have your Bud friends try.

name: Harpoon Pilsner
review: It's OK for a pilsener. Would be good for introducing a Bud drinker to real beer

name: Harpoon Pilsner
review: Amber color; crisp and Saazy. Good head, by the way. A solid American Pilsener.

name: Harpoon Pilsner
review: Clear gold, bright white head and good lace to cling to the glass, nose is malt, crisp, clean, front is slightly sweet, top light, the finish is dry, acidic, and lightly hopped.

name: Harpoon Pilsner
review: A nice bubbly head out of the bottle & throughout the pint, a bright golden color, not much of anything in particular in the aroma, very clean & crisp, refreshing, nice balance, very nice pilsener

name: Harpoon Light
review: I had this on special tap at the brewery, and for a light, its not bad. But you can still tell its a light. Bland, a bit watery, and seemingly a poor hybrid of their Ale and Summer. Smelled good, though!

name: Harpoon ESB
review: Draft Mostly clear, burnt orange ale with a small, wispy, white head. Decent retention. The nose is toasty, biscuity and grassy. Light to medium-bodied with a mildly creamy mouthfeel and tickling carbonation. The flavor leans bitter, but not by much. Pleasant, minerally hops lend to a crisp, moderately bitter finish. Thirst quenching, but lackluster.

name: Harpoon ESB
review: Draught. Reddish brown pour. Small thin head. Some spice and bitters with a mildly phenolic finish.

name: Harpoon ESB
review: Tap at the Saucer. Dark orange to almost reddish appearance. White head. Small aroma. Some amount of sweet candy on the nose but not much else. Flavor is immediately dry and bitter. Almost a smacky bitter; lingers on the tongue for a length of time. Slight sweet finish. Unimpressed.

name: Harpoon ESB
review: Copper in color with a small white head that faded quickly. Fairly average across the board. Some detection of hops and malt flavors, but all-in-all pretty bland.

name: Harpoon ESB
review: Draught > Gingerman. This was noted as Single Hop ESB on their sheet so I hope this is it. Im pretty certain it is. Anyway, I guess this brewery just doesnt do it for me. All their beers seem very average which is frustrating b/c Id like to like them as I think theyve got potential which is why I keep trying them but am ultimately not surprised that there are far better slections on the wall. So, this guy was thin and weak w/o head and leaning more towards an IPA than an ESB. Couldnt detect the malty backbone that I look for in ESBs yet are still pleasantly bitter. Again another Harpoon beer that is one and done.

name: Harpoon ESB
review: Nice copper pour. Nose and taste of caramels, breads, toffee and dough. Rated 6/8/02 4.1

name: Harpoon ESB
review: To say this is an easy drinking beer would be spot on accurate. An appearance of rusty orange, a nice size upon pour with about a 5 minute melt time which left decent lacing. Mouthfeel is light, soft and clean. Aroma is sweet, perhaps some caramel malts along with a low-level bitterness thats somewhere between "where is it?" and "I think I smell something". Taste is clean, refreshing although not very bitter, but it is slightly hoppy. Its mostly malty sweetness thats present. Overall, Id say its a decent session beer. Clean finish, nice taste but nothing to blow you away.

name: Harpoon ESB
review: Good session beer. Not quite up to an average ESB. Light copper color with a nice head and lace. Taste is a little too sweet for my liking but it does not linger or leave the palate bitter after having more than one.

name: Harpoon ESB
review: Way to hoppy for my taste, and ended up teetering on bitter to taste. Very, very dry finish. Served best cold, and tends to go very bad when slightly warmed in open. Looks good in the glass though.

name: Harpoon ESB
review: Light coppery texture gives way to reddish when the beer settles with a pinkish white head. Smells of pepper. Taste is much sweeter than I expect out of an ESB with a decent slightly bitter finish.

name: Harpoon Octoberfest
review: Pours clear, dark amber with a three finger, off white head. Aroma is caramel and light Munich hops. Taste is caramel, moving to roast and Munich hops. Finish is hoppy.

name: Harpoon Octoberfest
review: Pours dark amber with a thick white head. Aroma of sweetened malt. Hoppy and slightly resinous malt body. Palate has malty and hoppy elements, typical of the style. Good.

name: Harpoon Octoberfest
review: Pours a hazy amber color with a thin tan head. A little hoppy with some caramel flavor. Not too bad, but there are better Octoberfest beers!!!!

name: Harpoon Octoberfest
review: I poured it from the bottle into a dimpled mug. It pours a dark amber with a fluffy, off-white head and lacing. The aroma is earthy, caramel, and biscuit. The taste is caramel, biscuit, honey, and tea. It's smooth. There's a subtle sweetness and an earthy bitterness. This is an above average version of this style.

name: Harpoon Octoberfest
review: Tried a few different Oktoberfests this season, and although this didn't stand up to my favorite (Samuel Adams)...it was solid for what it is. The balance isn't quite there, as the background is the lagery Harpoon beer which is nothing special to me. But, there are some nice caramel flavors and spice in there. Also has a slight creamy texture to the mouthfeel. A slightly above average brew.

name: Harpoon Octoberfest
review: 12 oz. bottle from hayduke that we had together via facebook chat. Clear and coppery with some being head. Nice lacing falls down the glass. Aroma is malty and a bit earthy. Flavor is floral with gentle fruit. Caramel malts. No Fall spices noted. A bit of soap and zest. Pretty good for what it is.

name: Harpoon Octoberfest
review: Shared with Strykzone on Facebook Chat. Poured red copper with a beige head. Nose of caramel malts. Medium body. Flavor is very malty with no sign off hops Finishes almost sweet. Drinks OK however and is a decent enough beer

name: Harpoon Winter Warmer
review: Tin. WTF Beer52 are sending me this in July is anyones. Hot and thin with booze bullying a pleasant figgy sweetness. Nose alcohol, varnish, bocky dark bread, fruit loaf, liquorice and caramel. OK, its growing on me. The spices are there but discreet. Some vanilla pod, lactic chocolate and sticky dark fruit. Clear coppery brown with a cream head receding to a halo. Alright. But would I buy it? No chance.

name: Harpoon Winter Warmer
review: 33cl can from Beer52. Thick creamy beige head. Hazy amber pour. Quite herbal.

name: Harpoon Winter Warmer
review: Flavoursome traditional ale, with flavours of honeyed vegetables (reminds me of my winter/Christmas carrot recipe!), toffee and allspice. Looks lovely, wouldn't drink a lot of it.

name: Harpoon Winter Warmer
review: Can. Bronze coloured pour a beige head. Nose of cinnamon, allspice, toffee,ginger, caramel,sultanas. Flavours of toffee,allspice, sultanas. Sweet spicy finish.

name: Harpoon Winter Warmer
review: [12oz can from the Beer52 selection for January.] An attractive bright copper pour with a thick caramel coloured head; mild cinnamon aroma; sweet malty taste with restrained cinnamon and underlying demerara sugar; but lacking the promised warmth in the finish.

name: Harpoon Winter Warmer
review: 35.5cl can at home on 17th Jan 2019. Poured slowly into a Duvel glass, just to see what it looked like. Ruby hue to the brown body, clear and clean; off-white topping. Cinnamon rules the aroma and taste, fairly sweet and malt based brew all round with a crisp mouthfeel.

name: Harpoon Winter Warmer
review: Clear dark reddish-amber beer with a head that soon fizzles down to a film. Light smell of malt and spices. Flavour is cinnamon, caramel, dried fruit, malt. It doesn't have the richness I'd like from something with these sort of flavours but the flavours themselves are nice and leave a nice, spiced finish too.

name: Harpoon Winter Warmer
review: 12oz bottle. Pours a brownish amber with a small beige-ish head. Aroma is nutmeg, toffee, earth, some caramel, and some cinnamon. Taste is nutmeg, cinnamon, toffee, and some earth. Light-medium body. Moderate carbonation. Crisp-ish mouthfeel.

name: Harpoon Winter Warmer
review: Pours a clear copper brown on tap with fluffy tan head that dissipates to leave good lace. Aroma of vanilla, cinnamon, toffee, and caramel, a touch of earth. Taste has big cinnamon and light nutmeg, a biscuit and caramel malt middle, and earthy hop finish. Decent winter spice beer

name: Harpoon Winter Warmer
review: Poured from can, has a good caramel color with a pale head. Head retention dissipates quickly. Smell is good a nutmeg is discernible on the nose. Drinks easy and has no lingering aftertaste. Not tasting the cinnamon but is very drinkable.

name: Beck's
review: Purchase a 12 pack from my local Rite Aid. Thick white head on top of a pale yellow body. It's really bubbly. It smells sweet, kind of like sweet corn. It's a touch on the dry side but otherwise it's a perfect lager. it's slightly sweet with no hoppy bitterness there's a slight aftertaste I find unappealing but other than that a fine beer

name: Beck's
review: This beer it seems little more light than usual for the style to me.. It smells and taste like some ordinary "Pale Lager" but something missing here for me. First of all i dont get the malty aftertaste so much and instead i get little more bitterness on the taste. Also it is a very dry beer and very punchy.. Overall nothing too special to me. I can find better "Lagers" to drink and that is the fact. Otherwise is an "Ok" beer to drink and nothing more..

name: Beck's
review: Pilsnerfrgad klar med vit skum vit skum. Doftar och smakar helt ok men lite "solskaddad"

name: Beck's
review: 12 oz bottle poured into a pint glass. This particular beer is brewed in St. Louis, MO and is not an import. That said, was expecting a kat piss beer either way. Pleasantly surprised. Not the worst tasting beer, but not the best either.

name: Beck's
review: Light golden color, weak white head. Typical lager aroma of malts and fresh hops. Sweet malty taste, light hoppiness, just a slightly bitter. Light body, light mouthfeel, light carbonation.

name: Beck's
review: Pale gold with a thin head and a mild, malty nose. Well-carbonated with a sticky mouthfeel and a somewhat bitter, malty finish.

name: Beck's
review: When will they learn? Now brewed under licence in UK Not Becks any longer , just an excuse of a beer ...no longer premium Just do not even look at it as an option anymore Numptys!

name: Beck's
review: 0.5l can. Pours clear straw with white head Aroma of faint malt and cardboard. Taste is grainy and some lemon with a decent amount of bitterness. Definitely german, but a light one at that.

name: Beck's
review: Middle of the road lager. Does not specifically tastes german style but acceptable on a hot Sunny and lazy afternoon.

name: Beck's
review: Clear golden with a thin head. Strawy smell of hops. Flavourful at the attack, the whole sip is mainly bitter. Medium carbonation.

name: Beck's Alkoholfrei (Non-Alcoholic)
review: Einerseits aufdringlich herb, als wolle man zwangsweise den Eindruck vermitteln ein alkoholisches Bier zu trinken. Andererseits leider daneben wssrig und pappig. Letzteres ist auch das Gefhl was auf der Zunge verbleibt.

name: Beck's Alkoholfrei (Non-Alcoholic)
review: Having one at La Rusticana in Howald. Clear golden with a frothy head. Grainy, malty smell. Malty taste with an agreeable bitterness and a hint of acidity. A refreshing beer.

name: Beck's Alkoholfrei (Non-Alcoholic)
review: Fair enough low alcohol beer Not to much wort Quite refreshing when served cold [Bottle from EuroCash at Svinesnund in Sweden]

name: Beck's Alkoholfrei (Non-Alcoholic)
review: Sour bread aroma and taste. Malty, grassy, bitter barley. Okay option, but not tasty tbh

name: Beck's Alkoholfrei (Non-Alcoholic)
review: Zotej, barwy klarowne. Piana biaa, niezbyt trwaa. Aromat sodowy o niskiej intensywnoci. W smaku sodowe, troch wodniste, goryczka ledwo wyczuwalna.

name: Beck's Dark
review: This is pretty awful for a Dunkel when u compare it against others in the style. Brown color with smaller head. Notes are cracker, grain, light fruit. corn pops, and spice. Thin in the mouth.

name: Coors Banquet Beer
review: Pours golden with tracing carbonation. Thin white head. Aroma of yeast and sweet malt. Taste has light floral notes, sweet malt. Palate has light bread notes, sweetness. Eh.

name: Coors Banquet Beer
review: No aroma. Clear yellow pour with almost no head and very light carbonation (perhaps it is too cd). Taste is sweet and refreshing. Not much flavor.

name: Coors Banquet Beer
review: Metal bottle, one of Vegas's liquor stores. Clear golden, white head, medium lasting. Grainy, corn and vegetable nose, typical really. Sweet start, milder bitterness, peppery finish. Vegetables. Light Sparkly.

name: Coors Banquet Beer
review: This beer is lighter than I wouldve guessed. A solid blend of corn & wheat came through a little bit. Two tallboys for $3.98 in Louisiana. Cant complain much!

name: Coors Banquet Beer
review: Coors Banquet beer is probably the smoothest beer I've ever tasted hands down!! I would put it just past Budweiser.Not a dry after taste like most beers have.Just an excellent smooth beer period!! Thank you Coors people!!

name: Coors Banquet Beer
review: I haven't drank a Coors banquet in decades. I don't remember it being this weird tasting. It has a strange sweet medicine flavour. The type they put in prescription medicines to make it taste better for kids but ends up gross. I dont usually toss beer but I did not finish this one. I think this beer is popular due to being around for ages, commercials, and featured in media. I won't be buying it again, not even on sale.

name: Coors Banquet Beer
review: Take this beer for what it is: Easy drinking. Cheap You need a 24 that will last a few days at the cottage and goes down easy then this is it. I enjoy a good hoppy beer or strong ale for flavour but I enjoy this beer more when I want to crush back a few on a summer day. Maybe not as good as some lagers out there but nothing to complain about. I wouldn't mind a stronger alcohol content. Solid 3.5 stars out of 5 for me.

name: Coors Banquet Beer
review: Of course this is good beer. It's the beer that made Boulder famous. I love this beer and wish that I got invited to banquets more often so I could drink more of it.

name: Coors Banquet Beer
review: The facade of beer but not much else, like McDonalds salads, suburban houses, and soap actors.

name: Coors Banquet Beer
review: not a hoppy taste, pretty standard beer beer. reasonably light and crisp, nice when chilled.

name: Coors Light
review: Nothing tops a cold Coors Light on a hot sunny Florida day. Its like when someones cums on the roof of your mouth. Also, its a beautiful party drink, a cheap beverage, that is top tier for shotgunning and other party games. Very rare you will get ID if you are underage at a store.All in all, liquid gold. Like a marenellies that went to private school.

name: Coors Light
review: classica birra industriale, sentori di lattina, mais cotto e verdura cotta.

name: Coors Light
review: (20/10/19) 330ml bottle at friend's place. Light straw colour, slightly grainy aroma, grassy taste with a sweet finish. Very low bitterness. Quite crisp. Not as bad as I thought it would be.

name: Coors Light
review: One left in my fridge by my brother in-law after his familys stay at my place. Might as well rate which is weird to do after 5k rates on this site. If asked my least favorite beer in world for last 2 decades this would be my choice, although its been many years since I had last. I often would say 4 of these would give same hangover as 12 Busch light at least I used to say that 20 years ago, long before my beer snobbishness. Pale yellow brew with a smallish white head. Nose is light sour mash and wet cardboard. Tastes of corn, grain, wet dog, and tears. Some urine qualities in after taste. More bitter than I recall. I my beer journeys since college Ive had less drinkable swill but casual conversation Ill still say this is my least favorite brew.

name: Coors Light
review: 330ml bottle brewed 8n the UK, bought from T-Market, drunk with lunch in Kotel. Clear straw, not much head, lacing or rising carbonation. On the nose, soft bread and biscuit malts with gentle floral hop hints. In the mouth, similar flavour profile, quite frothy at first then light texture but not actually watery, not a lot of bitterness or sweetness with a short crisp finish. A lot less terrible than expected, refreshing on a sunny day.

name: Coors Light
review: Pint on draught. Light gold colour with white head. Biscuit cracker malt, grainy, white bread, light corn. Super bland but not that bad for an American light lager, better than stuff like Michelob Ultra for sure

name: Coors Light
review: Another light US beer, only being drunk as I work through my quest. Inoffensive and refreshing.

name: Coors Light
review: De cuerpo ligero y carbonatacin media, es una cerveza muy sencilla con un dbil aroma a lpulo. En boca es olvidable.

name: Coors Light
review: NO. Not much of a fan of these American light beers, or light beers at all. But if I would have to choose, I would take this one over BUD or MILLER light. Refreshing easy drinker.

name: Coors Light
review: Light golden in color. Low carbonation. Taste of light malt to watery. Low to none white head.

name: Carlsberg Export
review: Bardzo sodkie, szmaciane, bardzo niesmaczne. Nie warto pi, moe byo le przechowywane, ale tak czy siak, wyjtkowo ze.

name: Carlsberg Export
review: Can. Clear gold with a decent white head. Mild aroma of grains, grass and general blandness. The beer is only two months old but already tastes stale. Grainy, grassy and metallic. Low bitterness, medium carbonation. Pretty bland and boring even for it's style.

name: Carlsberg Export
review: I'm assuming this is the Carlsberg in the North American market, but no mention of Export on the label. Giant 1000 ml can from Winco. Aroma of grain, bready malt. Pours crystal clear golden with a large white head with excellent retention. Taste is mostly sweet, weirdly tart, with some light hop bitterness. Not as bad as I was expecting.

name: Carlsberg Export
review: # 272; 3/2016. From Carlsberg Serbia. Slightly bitter, grainy international lager without character. Aftertaste is little bit sour. 0,5 l bottle, market, Pilsen (CZ).

name: Carlsberg Export
review: Shared pint can poured to snifters showing a clear, golden hue, with a decent layer of soft white froth, and spots & strands of lacing. The aroma offered a touch of pit fruit, soft grain, a hint of corn, and basically, a light lager nose. Light to medium bodied, with okay carbonation, the taste was similar, and fairly clean, adding some light grain & grass astringency.

name: Carlsberg Pilsner
review: clear gold colour with a uniform foamy faded white head. Few streams of carbonation. The aroma with light notes of grass/hay, lemon, biscuits.

name: Carlsberg Pilsner
review: Draught, half pint. @"Copenhagen Airport". [#3.107 Global - #227 Denmark - #1 Carlsberg Brewery (My Danish brewery #39)]. Clear golden colour with a thin white head. Poor retention. Aroma is grainy and malty. Taste is the same leading to a soft corny and malty finish. Next one please!

name: Carlsberg Pilsner
review: 330ml can, spilt from multipack in reductions bin, from Waitrose Westfield London for 55pence. Dated as best before 21/05/2020. Served fridge cold into a tumbler. The beer pours a perfectly clear gold colour with a uniform foamy faded white head. Few streams of carbonation, I would have expected more. The aroma, although minimal, clearly has light notes of grass/hay, lemon, biscuits. The taste follows the aroma. Sweet in front with the faintest suggestion of bitter hop on the back. Nothing memorable in the mouth. A light bittersweet finish on the tongue. Clearly a beer for the mass market. Not nearly as bad as the rating on here would suggest. A stepping stone of the road from Carling to Helles.

name: Carlsberg Pilsner
review: Can. Clear golden color with a thin head. Mild aroma of hay. Messy taste. Thin body.

name: Carlsberg Pilsner
review: Schmeckt aus der Flasche seltsamerweise besser als aus dem Glas. Unspektakulrer, aber ganz eigener Geschmack. Leichte Bitterkeit, etwas herbes Aroma aber weich im Geschmack. Betonende Lakritznote.

name: Carlsberg Pilsner
review: From a can to a glass. Pours a clear light gold color with a small foamy head that disappeared. Aroma is barley corm malts and slight earthy hop note. Taste follows the aroma with a slight nuttiness note in the sip and a slight earthy hop note . Medium light mouthfeel. Pretty tasty budget beer.

name: Carlsberg Pilsner
review: I was afraid to get similar beers like the "Pilsner Urquell" because i had bad experience with that beer.. But i give a try to this also famous "Carlsberg" Pilsner beer.. The aroma smell like one ordinary "Pilsner" beer that wasen't the greater thing but the taste really surprised me and in the end i enjoy this beer.. It has some bittersweet taste and not some high rate bitterness.. Also the aftertaste is simply beautiful.. You feel one amazing malty taste in your mouth and that is the best part here for me.. Overall a very enjoyable and refreshing beer to drink and with the cheap price the whole thing become better.. For sure you can't compare these beers with some classic and badass belgium and german beers but like i say before, any beer has a purpose.. This beer for what it is, worth to drink it..

name: Carlsberg Special Brew
review: Quite strong and perfectly fine for parties. Its taste has nothing unique but it brings enough joy !

name: Carlsberg Special Brew
review: A fantastic beer with a bad reputation, which is a shame. In a blind taste test with Leffe Blonde I challenge you to tell the difference. In fact i prefer it. One of my favourite beers. Moderation is key.

name: Carlsberg Special Brew
review: Ruined! I'd been drinking Special Brew for over 40 years, won't be any more. New version is way too gassy, and doesn't taste anything like Special Brew.

name: Carlsberg Special Brew
review: Hate this brew now. Not the same. Rather pay more for the original. Its rank. Wont be buying this anymore unless they re-introduce the original as an alternative.

name: Carlsberg Special Brew
review: Theres no way Carlsberg can ever fix this, the ABV has been reduced - Once again, it used to be 9% but it's only 7.5% now Special brew has officially been ruined, forever.

name: Carlsberg Special Brew
review: Probably the best beer Carlsberg make. Made for Winston Churchill but drank by the underclass. Not a bad drink though

name: Carlsberg Special Brew
review: ABV down again :( This last pack will be my last Bought from sainsburys newport only supermarket i have found this in lately

name: Carlsberg Special Brew
review: This isn't even special brew anymore, they are just cashing in on the name now, it used to be a good beer at a reasonable price, now it's just expensive and watered down, I can't believe people still buy this.

name: Carlsberg Elephant
review: pours golden and clear with a medium head. aroma of malts, corn, slight booze. flavour of malts. sweetish.

name: Carlsberg Elephant
review: From undated bottle in dimpled mug. Pours clear golden amber w/fluffy white head, odd grainy aroma. Taste has an unusual sweetness to it almost like corn syrup.

name: Carlsberg Elephant
review: 02.11.2019 -- 0.5l bottle from rewe in charlottenburg, bb 17.09.2020. pours a clear golden with a medium head. aroma of malts, corn, slight booze. flavour of malts. sweetish. drinkable when cold, alcohol is somewhat hidden.

name: Carlsberg Elephant
review: Wersja opuszkowa. Alkohol 7,5 %. Zote, klarowne. piana biaa, drobna, obfita. W aromacie sodowe i lekka nuta alkoholowa. Zapowiada mocne piwo. W smaku sodowe, ale te wyczuwalna nuta alkoholowa. Jest ukryty, ale mimo wszystko zaznaczony. Jak na mocne piwo to smakuje nie najgorzej. Ale mimo wszytko jest mocne.

name: Carlsberg Elephant
review: Golden color, small white head. Aromas of malt, alcohol and corn. Taste of malt and alcohol.

name: Carlsberg Elephant
review: If cheap beer made a strong flavor, this is it. Hard to swallow. High alcohol content doesnt make up for awful taste. Also very heavy bodied for something that tastes so shitty

name: Carlsberg Elephant
review: Pours golden with a thick white head. Aroma of sweet and grassy malt. Taste has nice floral and rich dry bready notes. Palate is like a pilsener, dominated by bread with light elements of hops. Great.

name: Carlsberg Elephant
review: Klar gylden med offwhite skum. Atoma malt eple humle. Smak eple karamell malt. Fyldig lager med lett bitterhet. Bpks deltnmed Hilde

name: Carlsberg Elephant
review: Canned at 7.5% ABV. Clear deep gold with a moderate white head. Aroma: grains, candy. Medium body. Taste: sweet, malty. Grains, candy, a bit nutty, light to medium alcohol. Light to medium bitterness. Just a little bit harsh, still passable. This strong lager is not among the worst.

name: Carlsberg Elephant
review: Tap @ OKallaghans, Rouen VIII 2019. Licht zoet maltig biertje, goed doordrinkbaar met zachte bitter. Heeft wat weg van een Belgisch blond. Kortom sterk biertje maar wordt voor Deens pilsener weg gezet. Daar doet het zich wel echt tekort mee. Helder geel met witte schuimkraag. Plastic beker

name: Carlsberg Ice
review: Can - Transferring Old Data - Has some sweet, metallic aromas, have never drunk it again.

name: Carlsberg Ice
review: *Old rating, best before 17.07.04. Beer brewed in Germany. Smooth and pale. Malty, fresh, not too deep, highly drinkable. Nearly no bitterness, sweetish.

name: Carlsberg Ice
review: Bottled@The 1st Vaasa CS/ES beer session (Thanks JP!). Bought in Malaysia, 5.6% abv. Pale yellowish golden colour with mediumsized bubbly white head. Aroma is malts, some grains and quite grassy as well. Flavour is quite similar. Actually quite mild flavours for being 5.6%, as it is rather watery.

name: Carlsberg Ice
review: 33 cL bottle, 1999 vintage. Pours clear and golden orange with a fully gone head. Aroma is dense wineous and oldis. Dramatic change from the original fully clean and towards watery aroma and flavour. Dense malty and fruity oxidised. A bit flat into the finish. Way too oxidised but better than I remember the original.

name: Carlsberg Ice
review: Aarhus, DK. Bottled. Abscence of any character. High carbonation - would prefer water

name: Carlsberg Ice
review: Yellow with a white head. Grainy taste, Weak watery palate. Corn flavor - very sweet. Glad I never bought this myself!

name: Carlsberg Ice
review: Bottle. Yellow colour, small short head. Thin aroma of malt. Weak clear and crisp flavour of malt and some grains.

name: Carlsberg Ice
review: Bottled on a hot summers day. Light in appearance, aroma and flavor. Very drinkable, but not specially good for a summer ale.

name: Carlsberg Ice
review: Aroma seems minimal but does warm up to give caramel. Taste is similar though some grassy hops present, harsh carbonation kills it really.

name: Carlsberg Ice
review: In spite of its 5% alcohol, it doesnt really taste like anything but water. Good for thirst and not much else.

name: Grolsch Amber Ale
review: Clear amber brown appearance, medium head. Caramel, slight roast malt nose, medium bitterness. Average amber ale.

name: Grolsch Amber Ale
review: Yeah, Id say this is slightly better than the original premium lager, but not much. Sort of like the difference between Heineken and Heineken Dark. If you prefer medium dark ambers over typical lagers, then youll probably prefer this as well. Has more of a caramel, sweet malty taste...not as skunky as the original. An average overall beer, nothing more.

name: Grolsch Amber Ale
review: Bottle. Golden/amber color, almost no head. Aroma is metallic and malty. Taste is metallic and fruity in an artificial way. Very flat, with a nasty sour aftertaste. This is a really bad beer, like its failed.

name: Grolsch Amber Ale
review: oude rating, bruin/rood met witte kraag, behoorlijk bitter, moutig en verbrande caramel, medium body en waterig, licht droge afdronk, niet erg lekker

name: Grolsch Amber Ale
review: Bottle 30cl. Clear amber, nice frothy head, recedes slowly. good lacing; sweet malty nose, bread, caramel, dark fruit, herbal hops; mild sweet taste, some caramel, a bit fruity; medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation; mild dry bittersweet finish.

name: Grolsch Amber Ale
review: Bernsteinfarben mit wenig Schaum. Verhaltenes Malzaroma. Dnner Antrunk. Malzig, Karamell und leicht nussig im Geschmack. Der wenige Hopfen hat auch ne Alunote. Unterdurchschnittlich.

name: Grolsch Amber Ale
review: Bottle@tasting (1998), 300ml. Head: some off-white foam. Colour: clear, amber. Aroma: almost none. Taste: some bitter. Palate: refreshing, small bitter finish. Overall: nice.

name: Grolsch Amber Ale
review: Bottled. Amber colour small white head. Aroma is fruity, caramelly, mild bitterness along with some slight metallic notes as well. Flavour is fruity, earthy, mild metallic notes as well as some caramel and sweet grains. Balanced. For being "bulk" its not all too bad. Quite dry and only mildly "metallic" aftertaste.

name: Grolsch Amber Ale
review: Bottle- Pours an amber color with a nice head that fades slowly to lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel and not much else. Mild taste of roasted malt and caramel sweetness. There is a mild bitterness and a dry finish. medium body, some and creamy like texture. Nice balance. Nice amber that goes down easy. Good for a few.

name: Grolsch Amber Ale
review: Originally rated August 2004. Grolsch Amber Ale poured a dark amber colour, with a good lasting cream-foam off-white head. Lightly carbonated, it had great lacing. Aromas are mostly of sweet malt. Taste was slightly bitter with a smooth caramel finish. A pretty good session red ale.

name: Grolsch Premium Lager
review: Quite possibly one of the worst beers I have ever tasted, awfull metallic taste. White trash beer.

name: Grolsch Premium Lager
review: This beer is one of the only beers that come in a green bottle that I actually enjoy. Extremely refreshing, and easy to drink.

name: Grolsch Premium Lager
review: Can. Aroma of malt but not too strong. A little bit alcoholic? Ugly whitehead when poared, instantly just disappears. Colour and look of a typical industrial lager. Not very good.
