Has this very weird awful metallic taste to it. Tastes bad, but not as bad as miller so it gets a pass in that regard.

name: Grolsch Premium Lager
review: Tastes like when ur drink normal beer and when the normal beers goes into the toilet

name: Grolsch Premium Lager
review: Gyllengul l med vitt skum. Doft och smak av malt, h, maltstma och en grsig beska.

name: Grolsch Premium Lager
review: 0.5l can. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma of rice, skunk and vegetables. Taste is sweet and little bitter. No, thank you.

name: Grolsch Premium Lager
review: Blind test - 25 koncerniakw. Barwa: Zota, klarowna z drobnopcherzykow, nisk bia pian, ktra opada do maego piercienia pozostawiajc ctki na szkle. Aromat: Utlenienie kartonowe, akcent psiej karmy, troch sodowoci chlebowej, zioowego chmielu oraz jabkowych estrw. W tle nuta diacetylu. Smak: Podobnie jak w aromacie. W ustach psodkie, treciwo rednia, wysycenie niskie, lekko kwane. Goryczki brak. Finisz wytrawny z lekk zioowoci i kwan nut. Oglnie pomimo wad da si wypi.

name: Grolsch Premium Lager
review: The aroma is typical for the euro lager. Malt, hops. and some yeast. Taste. the body is nice, carbonation is soft. The taste is sweet malt. aftertaste grassy hops in bitterness.

name: Grolsch Premium Lager
review: Forgotten how good this beer is and the great feel of the flip top lid. Makes a pleasant change to my recent batch of American light beers.

name: Grolsch Blond
review: Botella 330ml , 4,0% .Color limonada,clara,espuma blanca,fina,alta,media resistente,Aroma malta,frutal.Sabor lo mismo,muy ligera,fresca,acuosa

name: Grolsch Blond
review: De Carrefour. Abv 4. En copa Alhambra. En almuerzo, con papas fritas con pollo empanao. Lager industrial correcta. Ligera pero no aguada. Con poco sabor pero sin notas desagradables. Amargor ok. Refresca y se puede beber rapido

name: Gambrinus Premium Svetl Lek 12
review: Tried it in Slovakia after a couple hours of traveling,i was thirsty and this beer was spot on,semi sweet beer with bitter aftertaste,i'll definetely buy this one when i go back to Slovakia/Czechia

name: Gambrinus Premium Svetl Lek 12
review: Tap. Pours clear golden with a high white head. Aroma of malt, grassy hops. Taste is semi-sweet, average to low bitterness. Flavors of malt, Czech hops, bready notes. Medium body, crisp texture, average carbonation.

name: Gambrinus Premium Svetl Lek 12
review: Golden orange colour. The aroma is malty, bready, grass hoppy. Flavour is long, bittersweet. Soft carbonation. Nice pilsner.

name: Gambrinus Premium Svetl Lek 12
review: #15, 4/2015. Zlat ir barva, pna rychle opad. Nevrazn sladov vn i chu s hokou dochut. Takov nijak.

name: Gambrinus Premium Svetl Lek 12
review: Lekker vol bier. Beetje donkerder dan pilsener .5.2 % gedronken in Tsjechi op de tap en gekocht in flessen in Duitsland bij de slijter

name: Gambrinus Premium ern
review: Bottled. Color, dark brown with beige head. Aroma, roasted bread, caramel. Taste, sweet, caramel and roasted grain. Nice bittersweet finish. Drinkable beer.

name: Gambrinus Premium ern
review: At an trinkgut in aachen, germany, bottle 500ml, dark brown, medium head, fully fruit hinds and burn-smoke, nice one.

name: Gambrinus Premium ern
review: Love Czech Dark beers - hard ot get, but worth it. Very nice. Drink if you can find. Generally drunk by woman, as dark beers are considered for woman - call me bitc(h)

name: Gambrinus Premium ern
review: red brown with beige head. liquorice, fruits rye. roasted but watery and light. ok...

name: Gambrinus Premium ern
review: Draught at Hospoda U Novka - after dinner. Clear reddish/black - offwhite head. Ryebread, licorice, berries, roasted, sweetness, soap. Thin, weak & watery.

name: Gambrinus Premium ern
review: Keg at Charlies bar in Copenhagen. Orange-brown. Malty aroma with notes of molasses, phenols and sweet bread. Alcoholic flavour with notes of fruits and spices. Sweet.

name: Gambrinus Premium ern
review: Big, offwhite creamy head over seemingly black, but really dark red, body. Sweetish, faintly roasty aroma. Sweetish taste of licorice and faint roastiness with faintly dry aftertaste. Nice, easily drinkable, not too exciting. Overall impression is that its a beer with very little taste, but still not really boring. (On tap. I think this rating is attached to the right beer, but not absolutely sure. Served at "Two Cats" (whatever that is in Czech), which was very much a Prazdroj house. It was definitely Prazdroj, definitely dark, and definitely 12 degrees. This is the only beer that matches.)

name: Gambrinus Premium ern
review: Draught. Dark and sweet. Very malty, but without much aftertaste............

name: Gambrinus Premium ern
review: The ones I samppled were not in their freshest form, having been sitting in one of the ubiquitous kiosks in Kyiv. As a dunkel it felt quite different as the sourness of the brew reminded me, oddly, of a Guinness. It lacks balance and has a fleeting body that tended to feel thin in the mouth.

name: Gambrinus Premium ern
review: This one is a deviation from the usual Czech beers: very acidic dark stout-like beer. I didn't really enjoyed this, but, praps, I didn't understand it right way?

name: Gambrinus Originl 10 (Destka)
review: 0.5L can. Pours clear golden with a medium sized head. Aroma of malts and bread. Taste of malts, grains, grass. Bitter aftertaste.

name: Gambrinus Originl 10 (Destka)
review: Gekregen van een Tsjechische vrachtwagen chauffeur!!! Hij was er schijnbaar dol op!! 4,3% dus lekker wegdrinken...., Maar aan Heineken kan het niet tippen...

name: Gambrinus Originl 10 (Destka)
review: Pours a clear golden yellow on tap with fluffy white foam that dissipates to leave moderate lace. Aroma of clean grassy hop notes with a hay and biscuit malt note underneath. Taste follows, clean and easy with a light bitterness and a sweet finish. Decent enough, but not the best pilsner there.

name: Gambrinus Originl 10 (Destka)
review: typical lager. a bit better than the average domestic ones. refreshing. nothing amazing about it

name: Gambrinus Originl 10 (Destka)
review: A very good pale czech lager. No aroma but also no skunk. Barely any hops. Slight malt. Clean blond. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Gambrinus Originl 10 (Destka)
review: Clear golden color with off-white head. Aroma has caramel, malt and hay. Taste is malty sweet with somewhat bitter aftertaste. Flavors of caramel, malt and hay.

name: Gambrinus Originl 10 (Destka)
review: Nincsen jellegzetes aromja. Egyedli pozitvum taln a kesersge. Annak akik ezt kedvelik. Savanysg viszont megjelenik.

name: Gambrinus Originl 10 (Destka)
review: Lata 500ml Dorada con espuma blanca,fina,alta,resistente.Aroma malta,herbal.Sabor equilibrada entre amargor y dulzor,malta,herbal.Muy buena

name: Gambrinus Originl 10 (Destka)
review: 500ml bottle [thanks Andreas!]. Clear, dark orangey, pale golden colour with small to average, frothy, rapidly diminishing, white head. Slightly bready, minimally spicy, malty aroma, a very cautious fruity hoppy touch of apricot. Taste is slightly bready, minimally sweet and spicy malty, a fruity touch of apricot; quite watery overall.

name: Gambrinus Originl 10 (Destka)
review: 500 ml Obozavam ceske pilsnere i Gambrinus je jos jedno odlicno pivo tog stila.. Brutalno lagana pitkoca ispijanja, sjeda ko budali samar..

name: Gambrinus Dry
review: # 69, 7/2015. Nakysl, po mladin vonc esk vepn pivo s przdnm tlem. Hor verze normlnho Gambrinusu.

name: Gambrinus Dry
review: Butelka 0,5 litra, zakupiona w markecie w Czechach. Barwa zota, idealnie przejrzysta. Niska, biaa piana, do szybko opada. Aromat jedynie odrobin sodowy. W smaku niska goryczka.

name: Gambrinus Dry
review: getrunken im Jnner 2018 Das Bier hat den vollen Namen "Gambrinus Dry - se snenm obsahem cukr", was soviel heit, dass es Zucker- und damit Kalorienreduziert ist. Da in Tschechien grundstzlich jeder Bier trinkt und Frauen sowieso das gleiche Bier wie Mnner trinken, denke ich dass die Zielgruppe fr dieses Bier wohl Leute sind, welche einfach keinen Zucker zu sich nehmen sollten -oder gleich Diabetiker. Es ist einfach weniger vollmundig und sffig, aber dafr mehr spritzig als ein typisches Helles. Sollte man als Diabetiker wirklich nach einem Bier suchen, ist man gut aufgehoben, aber fr den 0815-Trinker und auch den Bier-Conaisseur ist es eher langweilig.

name: Gambrinus Dry
review: Fles 50cl in Benesov. Fris, bitter, goede balans, wel wat dun. (7-2014).--.

name: Gambrinus Dry
review: 500 ml bottle. Gold in color small white head. Medium carbonation. No aroma. Very little taste and finish. Would be a good thirst quenching beer.

name: Gambrinus Dry
review: Prakticky tady pidvm tento koment, jen aby tady nco bylo, protoe zptn dopisuji 900 piv z mho seznamu a asi bych se musel u toho zblznit.

name: Gambrinus Dry
review: 50cl bottle. A clear golden beer with a mid-sized most good lasting white head. Aroma of dry grainy malt, cereals. Taste of dry grainy malt, cereals, straw, mild bitterness.

name: Gambrinus Dry
review: Sehr trockener, mild getreidig herber Beginn. Leicht erhhte Karbonisierung, geringfgig bitter. Okay. 8/7/8/7/7/7

name: Gambrinus Dry
review: 0,5l Flasche. Hellgelbes Bier, dnner Schaum. Wenig Aroma und Geschmack. Wsserig.

name: Gambrinus Dry
review: Bottle. Color: Yellow, light golden. Thin white head. Taste: Watery, hopbitter notes, lightly malty, wet paper. Dry bitterish watery finish. Lacking taste. I dont think Gambrinus would be happy if he knew this beer is named after him.

name: Primus Svtl (Pale)
review: Jasno zote, klarowne. Piana biaa, nie wysoka. Aromat saby, sodowy. W smaku wodniste, sodowe Do wpicia w upalny dzie, przy sporym pragnieniu...... tyle.

name: Primus Svtl (Pale)
review: # 191; 1/2016. Nepli dobr pivo. Nzk plnost, nepjemn hokost, mrn sladov.

name: Primus Svtl (Pale)
review: 0.5 l bottle. Pours clear golden with small head. A: bit malty bit hoppy T: crisp to fizzy, thin body, bitter, harsh

name: Primus Svtl (Pale)
review: getrunken im Frhling 2016 Das Primus ist eines der bekanntesten Biere in Tschechien. Das liegt aber nicht an seiner berragenden guten Qualitt, sondern einfach nur, dass man es berall bekommt und ein relativ gutes Preis/Leistungs-Verhltnis hat. Ich glaube am besten verkauft es sich in der 2l-Familen-PET-Flasche. Das Bier ist eher leicht, wobei es aber nicht nach 10grdigen wssrigen Sommerbier schmeckt. Wenn man sich billig betrinken will und aber doch ein Bier mit einem Namen haben will, kann man es gerne nehmen. Aber helles Bier aus Tschechien kann weitaus mehr.

name: Primus Svtl (Pale)
review: Prakticky tady pidvm tento koment, jen aby tady nco bylo, protoe zptn dopisuji 900 piv z mho seznamu a asi bych se musel u toho zblznit.

name: Primus Svtl (Pale)
review: From bottle. Transfer of an earlier rating without text recorded, rating only.

name: Radegast Premium
review: Eigentlich war dies ein gutes Bier mit feiner Wrze, aber das "Radegast Ryze Hok 12" entschdigt auf voller Lnge.

name: Radegast Premium
review: Het pils is bitter en ietwat kruidig van smaak. gouden kleur met een bekende pils/lager schuimkraag. -backlog de BierApp-

name: Radegast Premium
review: Zota barwa, idealna klarowno i adna, biaa piana. Aromat mocno sodowy. W smaku sodowe, praktycznie bez goryczki, ale nawet cakiem pijalne...

name: Radegast Premium
review: Strong bodied Czech lager. Legacy review for completions sake. Slightly darker and more malty than your usual offerings but entirely enjoyable and refreshing. Couldnt down too many in one session, however, even for a lager. Only ever tried on draught in the Czech Republic (could possibly confusing this with Radegast Original, if so will edit rating).

name: Radegast Premium
review: Fles 50cl in Benesov. Bitters, kruidig, toch ook maltig en zoet. (7-2014)..

name: Radegast Premium
review: Prakticky tady pidvm tento koment, jen aby tady nco bylo, protoe zptn dopisuji 900 piv z mho seznamu a asi bych se musel u toho zblznit.

name: Radegast Premium
review: On tap at various places. Pours a pale biscuit gold with a white head. Malt and very mild citrus notes. Weak aroma. Malt, mild honey/citrus. Mild flavoured. Thin bodied. High carbonation. Easy drinking, but not interesting.

name: Radegast Premium
review: From old tasting notes. Bright yellow gold color. Fluffy white head. Zesty fruit aroma with noticeable spicy hop bouquet.ncrisp malt flavor has that characteristic Bohemian hop influence. Clean malty finish is dry and refreshing.

name: Radegast Premium
review: Aromat sodowy, bardzo lekki chmiel. Barwa zota, piana redniopcherzykowa, szybko opada. W smaku sd, chmiel. Poprawny lager.

name: Radegast Premium
review: Zoty kolor, przejrzysty. Gra biaej, puszystej i czapowatej, drobnoziarnistej piany. Opada ona powoli do acuszka. Lacing bardzo dobry. A smaku i aromacie dominuje sd, karmel i chleb. Ciao lekkie do rednie, goryczka niska. Czysty sodowy finisz. Nagazowanie rednie. Taki sobie lagerek. Do sytego, czeskiego obiadu pasowa idealnie.

name: Radegast Triumf
review: Botella 50 cl (coleccion) tomada en Praga en marzo 2000. Fcpref 23..07..2001 Lote LC6 023 (r09). sin muchos recuerdos. Bastante comercial y simple.

name: Radegast Triumf
review: Bottled (from old bottle collection). Yellowish golden colourm small white head. ARoma is bread, mild grass, bitterness as well as some slight metallic notes. Flavour is sweet malts, grass, herbs, mild toffee. Still quite crisp and wellcarbonated (BBE 2004).

name: Radegast Triumf
review: Eurostandardn destka nevyboujc vbec v niem z prmru. Nevrazn stedn hok pivo, bez pny a bez vn.

name: Radegast Triumf
review: (Bottle 50 cl) Very straight but ordinary light Czech pilsener. A touch of hops in the palate and then a lot of nice water to quench your thirst.

name: Radegast Triumf
review: One of the worst Czech beers I've ever tasted (discontinued). Quite malty with some harsh hoppy notes. Like a bottle of Soviet Zhiguli...

name: Radegast Triumf
review: for those who can't spare 2 crowns for proper radegast......................

name: Radegast Triumf
review: Light and drinkable . Good in high volumes when you play cards with friends ...hah ..memmories .

name: Radegast Klasik
review: 0,5l Flasche aus Tschechien. Gelbes klares Bier, luftiger Schaum. Grasiges Getreidearoma. Langweilig herber Geschmack.

name: Radegast Klasik
review: Faint aroma, watery taste, too high carbonation, but still not bad and refreshing beer.

name: Radegast Klasik
review: The old version was a great typical Czech 10 pilsener. Fresh, crisp and dry at the end. Sparkeling with a grassy hopflavour. Tiny bit of butter, vanilla and fruit.

name: Radegast Klasik
review: Hellgelbes Pils mit normaler Schaumkrone. Ein verhaltenes Hopfenaroma ist vernehmbar. Dnner, trockener Antrunk. Das wenige Malz wird von der Bitterkeit des Hopfens schnell verdrngt. Kantig und unausgewogen; nicht so doll.

name: Radegast Klasik
review: Bottle. Barva: svtle zlat, pna bl, nedrc. Vn: nevrazn chmelov sladov. Chu: vodou poedn dvanctka :-). Nevrazn slab pivo s hokm dozvukem. Vborn k prci na zahrad :-).

name: Radegast Klasik
review: leather, spruce, cereal, cough drop, golden, hazy, frothy, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter,

name: Radegast Klasik
review: Bottle: This was my second bus beer from Karlovy Vary to Plzen. This was a decently bodied but none too powerful brew that was described by the guy sitting accross from me on the bus as "a Czech energy drink". It was jsut right for moving along the lovely countryside. Lightly malty and a good touch of soft hops.

name: Radegast Klasik
review: Bottle. Golden colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of malt and hops.

name: Radegast Klasik
review: Canned(500ml). -probably the worst Radegast, thin, watery and metalic, pale golden coloured, grassy aroma with minimal hop notes

name: Radegast Birell Svtl
review: Piwo jasne klarowne o biaej pianie, ktra szybko opada. W smaku brzeczka, dms.

name: Radegast Birell Svtl
review: # 329 et # 486; 5/2016 et 10/2016. Mezi eskmi nealko pivy pomrn kraluje, ale pi srovnn s klasickmi pivy se jedn o nedobr kousek. Ni plnost, mltovost, maltzov sirup, kukuinost, drsn hokost, nepjemn dochu.

name: Radegast Birell Svtl
review: 0,5l can from Sintra potraviny in Star Smokovec. Big white good retention head. Pale gold clear colour. Aroma is malty, bit caramel, grassy touch. Taste is light malty base, bit bready, light hoppy, medium carbonation, ok for the style.

name: Radegast Birell Svtl
review: Butelka. o panie, niemae zasko! Klarowne jak na koncerniaka przystao, pianka gsta i trwaa. W aromacie zioowo-trawiaste, taki klasyczny chmiel, troch chlebowe. Nuty brzeczkowe, nawet jeli, to pomijalne. W smaku przyjemnie, pwytrawnie. Goryczka nawet cakiem, cakiem. Wodniste, ale nie obstawiabym, e to bezalko. Przyjemny pils.

name: Sapporo Premium Beer / Draft Beer
review: Color amarillo oscuro, transparente. Espuma blanca de dos dedos de espesor y corta retencin. Aroma a cereal, ctrico, sin definir, leve hierba un poco rancia. Sabor igual, con un final corto con notas metlicas. Textura acuosa y ligeramente oleosa. Carbonatacin media.

name: Sapporo Premium Beer / Draft Beer
review: Sapporo is a beer with a balance taste. Reminds me of light beer but with more flavor.

name: Sapporo Premium Beer / Draft Beer
review: On tap at the Beijing Capital Airport Hotel. Clear golden pour with a white head and some sticky residue. This is one of the standard pale lagers. Nicely made and refreshing

name: Sapporo Premium Beer / Draft Beer
review: Gold, beautiful body. Japanese lager, not bad. They run out of Asahi and I get Sapporo instead.

name: Sapporo Premium Beer / Draft Beer
review: From a can to a glass. Pours a clear light gold color with a huge frothy head. Aroma is Grainy malts, Corn, barley, slight grassy earthy hops, vegetables. Taste follows the aroma well with a medium light mouthfeel. Not too shabby for a Pilsner.

name: Sapporo Premium Beer / Draft Beer
review: 33 cl Cist oke lager.. aroma klasicna, ugl slad.. Boja malo bljedunjava, pjena oke.. Okus dobar.. pitak, lagano gorak..

name: Sapporo Premium Beer / Draft Beer
review: Beer with gold color, light aspect, soft bitterness, average carbonized, some foam on top, (shared a 33cl bottle beer with PG, bought it at "LIDL", Braga, PT #1017)(#5 JP).

name: Sapporo Premium Beer / Draft Beer
review: I was challenge to try this beer because of the famous movie "Kita kita" that hits in Philippine cinema that filmed in Tokyo. The hop, aroma and bitterness similar most to the Asian beer.

name: Sapporo Premium Beer / Draft Beer
review: pours very clear bright yellow, big white head. Aroma is lightly bready. Taste is bready, slightly unpleasant tang. Mouthfeel oddly oily.

name: Sapporo Premium Beer / Draft Beer
review: Golden pale color, clear body, medium carbonation, three fingers white head. Spicy aroma, floral, malt, biscuits, bread, cereals, wheat. Some citrus, lemon and grapefruit. Smells like a Weissbier a bit. Sweet taste, light, very drinkable. Good carbonation. Otherwise, very hard to taste something else; some malt, some citrus, traces of honey. Sweet aftertaste, bread, cereals, some malt, but very weak.

name: Tsingtao
review: This beer has an unpleasant taste of lake water, and a bit of cannabis mixed in. After a gulp I felt my head be struck with a hammer. The smell is more unpleasant than the the taste. It smells as if it is drenched in sweat, and has been smoking pot at the same time. The only positive is the logo on the bottle looks ok. This beer taste awful, and smells awful. Both of these are similarities in a majority of beers that come in green bottles.

name: Tsingtao
review: Very nice refreshing taste. Served cold is a great clean taste. Great value beer but often hard to find.$20 per dozen.

name: Tsingtao
review: Goes down very easy, great with spicy food and refreshing on a hot, humid day

name: Tsingtao
review: Piany brak, barwa somkowa. W aromacie kanalizacja. W smaku brak goryczki, czu metaliczny posmak

name: Tsingtao
review: Chmielu nie czu w ogle, w smaku do sodkie, moim zdaniem a za bardzo, no ale Chiczycy lubuj sodycz w potrawach. Zapachu praktycznie brak.

name: Tsingtao
review: Simple lager, sweetish and with minimal bitterness from grassy hops. Drinkable.

name: Tsingtao
review: Pale and clear. Not much head retention. Clean and smooth taste. Low bitterness. A little too sweet. If it is cold and you are thirsty, it's nor a bad industrial lager.

name: Tsingtao
review: Very nice light lager. Mild in taste, amazing mouth feel and is extremely smooth. Would take this over many comparable beers any day. Not amazing but damn better than a lot of whats out there 5.75/10

name: Tsingtao
review: Such a smooth, Sharp, Clean, Crisp beer. It's china's answer to Heineken. I really do rate this beer 100%

name: Tsingtao
review: Bottle. Clear light golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of skunk, metal, weed, grain and dms. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter with notes of grain, metal and light corn. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Decent but skunky as hell.

name: St. Pauli Girl Lager
review: Has a pleasant hop aroma, a well-balanced malt flavor, crisp hop finish. Would definitely buy this beer again.

name: St. Pauli Girl Lager
review: Pours a light golden with a thin white head. It smells really skunky. After that its bready, grainy, and faintly floral. The graininess remains as the primary flavor. There are slight herbal and floral notes, bread, and hay. Body is light and the texture is thin. Definitely unpleasant. A drain pour.

name: St. Pauli Girl Lager
review: Bottle, had this a couple times in college. Pours a pale gold with fast receding head. Notes are skunked beer, spice, grains corn, and cereals. A little better than American macros but not by much

name: St. Pauli Girl Lager
review: Very balanced German lager. Not too hoppy and not too sweet. Very good on a hot day after yard work. Cheers.

name: St. Pauli Girl Lager
review: Bottle from California - Becks from Bremen is really making money from putting a bavaria-style girl on their label and calling it St Pauli, the heart of Hamburg, and the rival of Bremen? this is really a weird beer. typical macro lager, a bit becks-like actually.

name: St. Pauli Girl Lager
review: Bottle at 5.0%. Clear gold, tall frothy white head. Nose: cereals, bread, skunk, hop. Light body. Taste: pretty dry, clean. Cereal malts, light skunk, spicy hop. Hoppy enough. Light plus bitterness. Pretty macro. Still I used to like that kind a long time ago.

name: St. Pauli Girl Lager
review: Thick white head on top of a pale yellow body. It smells like bread, but the odor is subtle. , but it has this bite on aftertaste that I've never really liked. Is all the taste of flavor notes I like thinks of the German Purity law but that after tastes just doesn't agree with me.

name: St. Pauli Girl Lager
review: Clear, golden colored, small non lasting white head. Aroma is of malt, some herbal hops and way too much metal. Taste is medium sweet malt, grain, some herbal hops with medium pleasant bitterness but also metallic. Medium-light bodied, soft carbonation, watery.

name: St. Pauli Girl Special Dark
review: Deep brown with thin head. Light hop aroma, a little grassy. Light malty taste, goes to medium, Thin finish

name: St. Pauli Girl Special Dark
review: Bottle, when i was a kid. Can't really remember much, except that it was nothing compared to what i've had since. Was tasty when i had it. Refreshing too.

name: St. Pauli Girl Special Dark
review: From old tasting notes. Translucent deep reddish brown. Creamy tan head. Hoppy nose wit sweet malt. Sweet toasted malt flavor upfront. Light hop finish is slightly dry.

name: St. Pauli Girl Special Dark
review: Dark brown/black color; Medium body; Aroma of sweet toasted malt, & caramel; Flavor of roasted malt, caramel, and some hops; Finish is slightly bitter; Surprised by this one - decent dunkel.

name: St. Pauli Girl Special Dark
review: Rated from old notes. Pleasant, slightly sweet roasted malt taste. Fizzy, though this rapidly flattens; the head makes a quick exit as well. Light bodied, and with little complexity. Still, not an unpleasant brew and tolerable with food, and in quantity. OK.

name: St. Pauli Girl Special Dark
review: Taste is roasted malt, crisp and yet creamy. Dark brown in color and mostly clear. A nutty aroma and a medium body. Smooth head with some lace. A gentle drinking lager for anytime.

name: St. Pauli Girl Special Dark
review: Bottle. Pours brown. Sweet aroma with toasted malts. Taste of roasted malt, sweet, a hint of caramel.

name: St. Pauli Girl Special Dark
review: not wretched, and a step or two or three above the classic and the NA. like a light dunkel, has the requisite flavors and aroma, just less of it all.

name: St. Pauli Girl Special Dark
review: Reviewed from notes. This was poured into a pilsener glass. The appearance was a nice looking hazy brown color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within about a minute. There was a decent dry chocolate and somewhat of a banana like smell. The taste was mainly sweet and had a decent sweet finish. On the palate, this one sat fairly light and showed a decent sessionable aspect about it. The carbonation was mainly smooth. Overall, this was not a bad Dunkel but not necessarily one of the better ones.

name: St. Pauli Girl Special Dark
review: Bottle at home from backlog notes 07. Pours a clear brown color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have toasted malts, caramel, light fruit character, hints of chocolate, low bitterness, flavor falls off on the finish, just a slight off note.

name: St. Pauli Non-Alcoholic
review: Bottle pour into pub glass. Appearance is basically clear, pale yellow with a good amount of sparkle (basically like ginger ale), with a thin white head with poor retention and mild lacing. Aroma is fairly typical Munich or Pilsner malts, Noble/European hops, in the same vein as traditional St. Pauli Girl, Beck's, Heineken. Taste follows aroma as malty with light fruit, cardboard. Mouthfeel is light bodied with thin, smooth, frothy texture, soft carbonation and finish as taste. Overall, I'm not the biggest fan of the European group noted above, but as a non-alcoholic option this doesn't stray too far from the traditional fare.

name: St. Pauli Non-Alcoholic
review: This is the most disgusting excuse for a beverage I believe Ive ever tasted. I couldnt even get through an entire bottle without feeling ill. The taste of this non-alcoholic beer is horrible beyond description. I have no idea how there are people on here who say they like it.

name: St. Pauli Non-Alcoholic
review: This is a solid skunk lager that happens to be non-alcoholic. It's got a hint of malzbier-like sweetness that's the only clue this is for the kiddies. Otherwise, a solid mass produced Euro-lager, drinkable with a touch of bitterness in the finish.

name: St. Pauli Non-Alcoholic
review: Very pleasant. I would never know it was non-alcoholic just by taste. Very nice aroma and appearance. Light taste with decent carbonation. Nothing offensive and very refreshing I could drink these all day and be happy.

name: St. Pauli Non-Alcoholic
review: Bottle in California - clear golden, white head. simple n/a beer, medium sweetish, sweet malts, high carbonation. maybe close to becks n/a? :P

name: St. Pauli Non-Alcoholic
review: Crystal clear, light yellow/green color, tall white, forever lasting head. Exuberant yeasty aroma. Light body, intense flavor, bubbly texture, watery, flat mouthfeel, long aftertaste, weak finishing flavor. Bitter, totally dry, badly lacking acidity or other tastes. Hoppy, yeasty, greens, very narrow palette of flavors. Useful if you are avoiding alcohol, amazing nose.

name: St. Pauli Non-Alcoholic
review: Pours bright gold into a shaker. Bright white head with medium retention recedes leaving spot lacing. Skunk aromas. Soft with skunk, bitter earth and a mild watery hop finish. Honestly tastes like a regular St. Pauli Girl...

name: St. Pauli Non-Alcoholic
review: Pours clear golden with a three finger, white head. Aroma is skunk and caramel. Taste is caramel, moving to skunk and grass. Finish is corn syrup.

name: St. Pauli Non-Alcoholic
review: Pours clear solar yellow with a thick snowy head. Crisp, malty aroma unfortunately says "Non-Alcoholic." Flavor, though, is a little better than expected - not great, but at least it has a little malty character. Texture features good body and fizz for a "near beer." For a non-alcoholic, rather good.

name: St. Pauli Non-Alcoholic
review: Bottle. Single purchased at Super Saver. Poured clear golden, white head. Aroma was grassy, vegetables, toasted grain. Taste was mild bitter, stewed vegetables.

name: Pabst Blue Ribbon
review: Tasteless when cold / easy to drink Very generic lager, so fine if you are wanting a cold drink I had the sound society version, which at least had an unusual label

name: Pabst Blue Ribbon
review: Not awful, but not good. This beer has the looks, but little to no personality. Pabst Blue Ribbon will get you drunk, but will make you vomit not because you drank too much, but because of the awful taste.

name: Pabst Blue Ribbon
review: pale yellow colour, minimal head, which disappears quickly; aroma and taste of cardboard, metallic and sourish-acidic notes; almost horrible...

name: Pabst Blue Ribbon
review: 470ml can from Tops market. Thin white head. Clear golden pour. malty aftertaste. Not great

name: Pabst Blue Ribbon
review: Sodowe, kartonowe, troch jabkowe. W aromacie sabo, w smaku nieco lepiej. Pijalne, ale dlatego chyba e mao intensywne. Saby, koncernowy lager. Ale ja podwyszam ocen, bo sponsorowali Mastodon.

name: Pabst Blue Ribbon
review: Clear pale golden. Vague taste and aroma. Boring and watery beer. Not worth the 75 characters

name: Pabst Blue Ribbon
review: Aroma of old dusty hops and a little malt. Glue as well. Taste is light sweet with more old hops and a bit of crystallized sugar. Not so bad actually.

name: Pabst Blue Ribbon
review: Barwa jasnozota, klarowne, piana biaa, rednio obfita, rednio trwaa. W aromacie sodowe, nieco utlenione, nieco zielonego jabka. W smaku sodowe, wodniste, czysty profil. Niska goryczka, wysycenie rednie, ciao niskie. Sikacz.

name: Pabst Blue Ribbon
review: Pale gold with a very thin head and a mild malt nose. Malty with mild carbonation and a syrupy sweet finish.

name: Pabst Blue Ribbon
review: Jasne zoto, klarowne, piana mao obfita, drobne i rednie pcherzyki, szybko si redukuje do zera. W aromacie sodowe, nieco skunksa, odrobina zi, generalnie lagerowy. W smaku kwaskowe, sodowe, nieco owocowych estrw, odrobina kukurydzy, ledwo wyczuwalny aromat chmielu. Bardzo lekkie, niemal wodniste, goryczka bardzo niska, wysycenie rednie do wysokiego, w miar pijalne.

name: Old Milwaukee
review: for the style example ,macro or craft ,i couldnt find much wrong with it . i dont do light beers ,malt liquor ,or freeze distilled. got it down to about 35-40 degrees . def has a nice finish ,a thinner bodied pale lager than pbr or blatz ,strohs etc but not watery , outstanding

name: Old Milwaukee
review: 16 ounce can at the house. Smells grainy. Real light yellow with thin white head. Light bodied and taste the grain. Smooth and easy to drink. Little of grain aftertaste. Just a lawnmower beer and something to drink. Cheers!

name: Old Milwaukee
review: Bready aroma, watery flavor with a metallic aftertaste. Mildly bitter hops. Highly carbonated.

name: Old Milwaukee
review: Backlog, can that pours a clear golden with small white head. Flavor is cereal, grain, corn on the cob, and spice. Thin and forgettable.

name: Old Milwaukee
review: Re-visiting beers from growing up in the 70s an 80s . Nice and cheap .Nothing special here , but nothing overly offensive .Pass for a Blatz or Strohs .

name: Old Milwaukee
review: Best tasting beer out there. Not enough credit given to this outstanding beverage.

name: Old Milwaukee
review: A very smooth and refreshing beer on hot summer days after yard work. Always liked this for being what it is. A plain simple beer. Cheers.

name: Old Milwaukee
review: 500ml can Pale straw colour with firm white head. Slight grainy aroma. Sweet grainy taste. Ho hum.

name: Old Milwaukee
review: There is no profound or deep taste but it is certainly an easy drinking beer.

name: Old Milwaukee
review: Pint can. Nose sweet, subtle perfume and corn, even possibly light hops. Pour very, very clear golden, still rich and attractive, supports a large and soapy bright white head. Taste actually drier than expected for this kind of beer, well-attenuated, a bit fizzy but crisp in the light body, a little bit of malt for structure, smooth-drinking throughout, no alcohol (though I can't quite shake the hangover connotation). Perfume / corn very mild here, and I think the result is drinkability -- seems a bit closer to a cream ale than most. No rough edges, or else they've been sanded off. Drinking this blind, I'd say one of the best of the beasts, one I'll happily revisit. [2018.10.28: 2.7]

name: Strohs
review: Nice touch of gold hue in appearance, head quickly disappears but good lacing. Touch of malt taste followed by smooth dry finish. If macro lagers are judged against each other, Stroh's is near the top imo. 30 pk $18.99 + tx. Cheers!

name: Strohs
review: Worst tasting brew Ive ever had in my life. Would rather suck on cow chips.

name: Strohs
review: 16 ounce can into lager glass, best before 5/28/2018. Pours crystal clear medium golden yellow color with a 1 finger dense and rocky white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of cracker, corn, white bread dough, and lightly toasted biscuit; with lighter notes of honey, nuttiness, pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness. A touch of fruity aromas, but not overwhelming. Nice and pleasant aromas with pale malt/corn and light earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of cracker, corn, white bread dough, and lightly toasted biscuit; with lighter notes of honey, nuttiness, pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness. Light herbal, grassy, spicy bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of cracker, corn, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light honey/nuttiness, pepper, and herbal/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice robustness of pale malt/corn and light earthy hop flavors; with great malt/bitterness balance; and zero cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Perfectly clean on lager flavors, with minimal fruity notes present. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering bitterness and carbonation. Medium-high carbonation and medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy, and lightly sticky mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.5%. Overall this is a very good pale adjunct lager! All around nice robustness of pale malt/corn and light earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the mildly bitter/drying finish. Very flavorful and never watery for the ABV. Very clean and nicely rich malts/grains and solid earthy hop presence for the style. Not overdone on adjuncts, plenty of barley presence. A very enjoyable offering, and spot on style example. One of the absolute best AAL I've ever had for sure.

name: Strohs
review: lol at the guy saying its a waste of money when it's about 50 cents a beer. Great for an American pale lager :) one of the best for the style for sure.

name: Strohs
review: Geurloos en smaakloos, niet slecht, maar ook niet goed. Niet veel meer smaak aan dan water.

name: Strohs
review: wow, what a waste of money. sorry, nothing good to say about this "beer". if you are considering buying some of this, continue your thinking for a while longer.........

name: Strohs
review: Pours a clear, thin golden with a full, smooth white head. The aroma isn't strong, though its lightly floral, a little buttery, and has hay and corn. The taste has a faint sweet touch to it. Flavors are basically identical to the nose except that its even more floral. However, the overall taste is milder than what the aroma offered. Minimal floral finish. Light in body and thin in texture. This one is on the low end of the macro spectrum.

name: Strohs
review: Best beer ever. Low price but high quality. Good flavor. The most underrated beer on the market ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Strohs
review: From old tasting notes. Labeled as "Strohs Signature". Clear golden color with small bubble carbonation. Small white head. Crisp, sweet malt aroma has a slight hop background. Decent balance. Dry hop finish. Highly carbonated.

name: Strohs
review: Brewed nicely to style.looks pretty,and actually has a little hoppiness.this pabst version tastes better than the original.a very good american lager.

name: Falstaff
review: 16oz can (Old Notes)-Pours a clear golden with a decent head. Aroma of corn, grains, and malt. Taste of the same. This light bodied brew was not bad and filled the purpose in college. Purchased $.99 six packs of tall boys at Liquor Mart.

name: Falstaff
review: this was not very good beer at all. though it did have a decent golden color. and it was foamy enough. seems years ago that was the gimmick that kept us coming back, the nice robust burn of carbonation set the pattern for that ability to sense that weak and sweet malt and corny sweet with touch o hop character. that and that beer was pretty cheap.

name: Falstaff
review: tastes good or did i have too many hamms before this. nice golden look and a very simple head. reminded me of schlitz which i really enjoy. dont be snobby try a falstaff

name: Falstaff
review: Actually for a mass produced beer Falstaff, wasnt that bad. I didnt have this one for years, and didnt know they had gone out of bussiness. The aroma was ok average appearance, enough flavor to satisfy, and ok on the palate. Most certianly it was eons better then Budwiesers offerings. If I had my druthers, I would druther have had Falstaff stay in bussiness and Bud close down

name: Falstaff
review: It has been ages since i have had this. From what i recall it was fairly good.

name: Falstaff
review: I liked this beer tho I cant get it anymore.Was a bit weak but still had one of the strongest flavors of the now watered down beers since their purchase from "The Big Guys". I wish I had been drinking this prior to the buyout. I bet it was what I like in a beer.

name: Falstaff
review: This was one bad beer. Another cheaply made American lager. They finally put it out of its misery in June05. I have no idea what it looked like, because this was drunk only from the can. If its like most pale lagers, it looked suspiciously like urine, only colder. If you never tried it, consider yourself blessed.

name: Falstaff
review: Thank goodness someone had the self respect to discontinue this beer. I ralphed one night after drinking this. It was not pleasant. Ralphing, in general, isnt a pleasant experience, but this seemed worse for some reason. The fact that I can remember this from almost 20 years ago stands behind my statement.

name: Falstaff
review: (12oz can. 04/2006). Yup. Found one in back of the fridge (found a couple, actually). Not the worlds worst brew, an icon that it is sad to see disappear. Alas, a little corny on the nose with almost no body. A light straw color and quite watery. Very smooth and approaching refreshing.

name: Falstaff
review: 12 oz. can. I cant believe I still had one of these rolling around. The Falstaff brand is one of the larger groups in my beer can collection. Im sorry to see Falstaff is gone. I hate seeing these regional brewers disappear. The beer itself is not very good. RIP.

name: Lone Star
review: Typical American lager. Not much different than mass market lagers. Crisp and tinny.

name: Lone Star
review: Pours clear, pale golden with a one finger white head. Aroma is light corn and grass. Taste is corn syrup, moving to grass and faint hops. Finish is corn.

name: Lone Star
review: can. Poured clear gold with a bleach white head. Grainy aroma. Light bodied, high carbonation, flat finish. Bland corny grain flavour, an astringent hint, not even refreshing.

name: Lone Star
review: Zajebiste piwko! Smakuje jak poczenie nektaru z orgazmem. Gwno prawda, to piwo to szczyny

name: Lone Star
review: Tall can from LCBO. Pours a big foamy bubbly white head that dissipates to a thin layer and has a clear straw coloured appearance. Average lacing. Aromas are grainy, malty, herbal. Flavours are bland grainy malts, a bit of corn and light wheaty notes. Dry mouthfeel. Nothing special here.

name: Lone Star
review: Its not for everyone but its a solid lager with better flavor then some would like to give credit. Grain and corn combo with a subtle sweet finish.

name: Lone Star
review: 473 ml can from the LCBO. Pours a clear pale golden colour with modest-sized white head. Aroma is unpleasant with chemically character and gently corny grains. Flavour also has a chemically note with corn and other grains. Bleh.

name: Lone Star
review: Can that pours a clean, very light yellow colour with a whitish cap, average stay and light foam lacing. Sweet malty nose with the corn notes and bad chemical hops. Tastes the same with the smoothness of corn that many people like. Not the grossest, but fairly rich and hard going down. Gonna eat Doritos to go with the corn right now.

name: Lone Star
review: It's in my opinion a decent lager, fits well on a hot summer day. And there are a lot of those in Texas !

name: Lone Star
review: 473ml can. Clear pale blonde, effervescent bubbles and a thin foamy white head. Flavors are cereals, apple, corn and grass with floral notes. Medium body, moderate to good carbonation, smooth texture.

name: Olympia
review: Drinkable lager but not as good as I'd hoped. A bit grainy and harsh. Otherwise light, reasonable beer. Can from 5 Point Cafe in Seatte.

name: Olympia
review: Drank straight from the can because no one really cares what a beer like this looks like, its likely clear pale yellow with bubbly white head. Aroma and taste of typical pale lager, crushable and light, easy drinking. The hipster PBR of the Pacific Northwest, or is that Ranier, I don't even know anymore.

name: Olympia
review: This is a value brand beer that really is worth a try. Considerably similar to Hamms which is starting to grow very popular once again. This has your classic American Style lager flavor to it, best drank very cold and I would personally suggest getting this before any major brands like Budweiser. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Olympia
review: Clear gold with white head. Nose is weak. Vaguely sweet grain. Taste is mostly empty, nutty sugar. Light bodied with a little bite of carbonation. Yeah, its not good.

name: Olympia
review: Pours yellow with a thick white head. Grass, grain, light floral hop and malt aroma. Corn, grass, grain, light floral hop and malt flavors. Light body and average carbonation. Grain and grass finish

name: Olympia
review: Drank cold from the can. Not a lot going on. Some light grain. Refreshing when cold. Bad when it warms. Does its duty.

name: Olympia
review: From old tasting notes. Medium gold color. Fluffy white head. Light sweetish malt aroma. Light grainy malt flavor. Light dry hops in finish. Brief aftertaste. Drink it cold.

name: Olympia
review: Quenches thirst if very cold on a very hot day. Then again, so does water. One plus....it was my dads standby for years.

name: Olympia
review: 12 oz can for $2 at Sisters and Brothers, used as a fire extinguisher for some Nashville chicken. Was it worth it? Time will tell. A lot of history with this brew, so Im at least somewhat excited to finally try this. Surprisingly, this is the first time Ive had this beer. I really thought i would.go for.the half gallon can i see at the gas station sometimes. Someday. Didnt pour this to a glass, because i dont believe such behavior is allowed. Tastes like a watered down beer, with water added. The beer served its purpose for me today. Well, thats one thing we got.

name: Olympia
review: Golden with a fast-vanishing white head. Aroma is mainly cereal and maybe a bit of toast. Dry, malty with no real bitterness detected. Bland but fits the expected mass produced light lager profile. I would grab one without hesitation if the temperature hit triple digits.

name: Pearl
review: Supposedly I never reviewed this beer. Yeah, right. It's the best of the white trash beers, or should I say white collar? It pours deep golden with very minimal white head. The aroma is pleasant compared to Busch, Mickey's, etc. so it smells like something you might want to drink, that is if you like cleaning out soiled horse pens. I didn't say good. The corn is kept in the background. And it's from Texas' oldest brewery, which isn't a brewery anymore but a restaurant with a gift shop surrounded by condos. What more could you ask for in today's global economy? Oh and the pearls!? if you look extremely hard you will see a few rising from halfway up the glass but if you're over 40 you wont be able to see them. This is a conflict of a beer, it starts off good (because you're thirsty for a beer) and ends real bad.

name: Pearl
review: From can at Boiler House. A mediocre lager. Better than run-of-the-mill lights but not by much.

name: Pearl
review: From old tasting notes. Hazy, honey gold color. Creamy white head. Malty, corn syrupy aroma. Tangy citrus fruit flavor. Light hop finish is brief and watery.

name: Pearl
review: Originally rated on 9/19/08. Back in the day i hear it was a pretty good beer, but times change and pearl certianly did. Taste of corn and grain, certainly is cheap enough though.

name: Pearl
review: Rated based on notes taken 22 June 2012 -- Cheap Texas bar beer. Meh overall.

name: Pearl
review: This actually isnt that bad. Better than quite a few macros, some light but decent flavors. Good body and carbonation for drinking in the summer.

name: Pearl
review: Looking through a list of old time beers an ran across this one that I had back in the day and forgot it existed. Must not have been too memorable, bad or good.

name: Pearl
review: Grabbed a 12 pack of this just for a walk down memory lane. Drank alot of pearl when I was a teen and hadnt seen it on the shelves in probably the last 20 to 30 years. As a teen I would pretty much drink any old beer this one had to have been better than it is now to have made me keep coming back. Think someone took feed corn, mashed it, and canned it. Taste like corn water and that is it. Not very good at all. Oh well another beer of my past that I just dont get why I was drinking it all those years ago. Maybe cause it was cheap.

name: Pearl
review: 12oz snubby bottle (Old Notes)-Pours a lighter golden with no head. Aroma of grains, corn, and sweetness. Taste of the same with light hops. This light bodied brew always did the trick when playing beer pool plu sit had the puzzles on crown.

name: Pearl
review: 12oz can. Not the worst macro lager Ive had - its a good bad beer. The smell is a little ugly and unappealing, but the taste is fine, just a touch of toast and slightly bitter. Some basic cereals and basic malts, nothing fancy with the light hops. Light body, well carbonated. What can you say, its a "classic" - whatever that means.

name: Schlitz Malt Liquor OML
review: Can, as Schlitz The Bull Malt Liquor (Stroh's). Pale gold with a white head that never quite disappears. Mildly grainy aroma with a little paper. Dryish with no fumey notes. Again, slight paper. Not much of anything really. A little corn at the end where bitterness is just noticeable. Vacant. Nothing terribly offensive but nothing good either.

name: Schlitz Malt Liquor OML
review: (24oz can) AROMA: light notes of malt and grain, dough, hint of yeast/cheese, slight touch of grass, nothing too negative. APPEARANCE: straw yellow, relatively light but not extra pale, decent creamy white foam head, clear, well carbonated, some residual clinging and film TASTE: unexpectedly not too flavorful, some grain/corn, light malty middle, crisp/green finish, some toast, dont really notice the alcohol PALATE: medium body, some bitter in the middle and on the end, smooth/fluid feeling, easy to drink without being too wimpy OVERALL: better than I was expecting, easy to drink but with a touch of body and malt/toast flavor, pop retry simple. An average, drinkable beer.

name: Schlitz Malt Liquor OML
review: From old tasting notes. Bright honey gold color. Creamy white head. Pungent, vinous malty aroma. Flavor is initially bittersweet but fades quickly to become bland and listless. Light sour aftertaste.

name: Schlitz Malt Liquor OML
review: Aroma and flavor is grainy/malts, apples and a sweet/somewhat alcoholic finish.

name: Schlitz Malt Liquor OML
review: If your drinking this beer because you like the way it smells or taste. Give me a break. I love the bull. Its not for the weak or people who like yuppie beer. Its for grown folks who can handle a good stiff beer. All yall cry babys go drink some coors lite

name: Schlitz Malt Liquor OML
review: Only tried it because the grocery store I stopped at specifically to buy the regular/classic "1960s" Schlitz apparently no longer stocks that delicious old-man beer. Ugliest, most randomly jumbled can design Ive bought in a while. My decidedly-low expectations are exceeded, slightly; no overwhelming corn sweetness or off metallic flavor that is so typical of most malt liquors. The taste is actually very plain and more like a regular, bargain-price American macro lager. The sweetness predominates but mainly because there is little else going on. Not as good as Genny Cream Ale (which I admit I like), and priced more like PBR, so I doubt Ill pick up another 6er any time soon, but perfectly drinkable. Nothing to look at, nothing interesting in the aroma, yet nothing offensive. Basic 5.9% beer, drink it if you arent picky or want to get drunk.

name: Schlitz Malt Liquor OML
review: Can (from Miami). Pale yellow color, small white head. Aroma of light green apple and alcohol. Light-bodied, watery palate. Soft flavor has some corn and green apple. Watery, simple, sweetish.

name: Schlitz Malt Liquor OML
review: 473ml can. Pours a light, clear gold with a foamy white head. Doesnt dissipate nearly as quickly as some. Aroma is corny and a touch sour. Hint of sweetness and alcohol nuttiness. Flavor is alcoholic and dry, some metal, sugar, corn. Not a favorite malt though it is smooth. Blind tasted with a slightly older red, this was more acetoney and cheap tasting smelling.

name: Schlitz Malt Liquor OML
review: It is what it is. Really pretty foul. Only time I ever drank this was in college when a cheap buzz was the final objective. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Schlitz Malt Liquor OML
review: Bottle-At least it was too bad. A fizzy white head sat on a pale yellow brew. The aroma was slightly skunky that was mostly of corn and malt. Some corn and dough (not malt) in taste. Pretty much a no nothing finish. I tend to like malt, so maybe that help to improve my rating. Produce place 1.99

name: Corona Extra
review: Wodnisty lager, pachncy kukurydz i od zasypu i od DMSu. Do lekki wic w upalny dzie, dobrze schodzony powinien uj w tumie.

name: Corona Extra
review: Turns out I have not tried this one... Smell- weak, maybe hops. Foam- thin, watery, some bitter-sweetness and maybe hops. Head is quite small, but not tiny, white color. Appearance- unique brewery bottle cap, clear yellow, orange amber, medium carbonation. Taste- weak bitter notes, hops, quite refreshing, but apart from that nothing to really brag about, but definitely not as terrible as advertised, this no fancy beer, but compared to average lager it stands at the same place so score should be same.

name: Corona Extra
review: Nie jest ze ale tez nie jest dobre. Ujdzie w toku. Dupy nie urywa 5/10 taka sytuacja

name: Corona Extra
review: It's ok... nothing special. White head, not very pleasant or strong after taste. It's better with a slice of lime lemon

name: Corona Extra
review: Not much nose, slightly malty and biscuity. Light-medium body, not much flavor, but what there is is nicely balanced. Unobtusive finish. A light beer, slightly maltier than most mass-market pilsneroids, but not much to talk about.

name: Corona Extra
review: I wouldn't compare this to any craft beers by a long shot. Not a whole lot of character. It's purely for refreshment on a hot summers day. The drinkablity is very high, I've easily slugged these back. It's crisps, clean, abit of lemon. It's ok for what it is.

name: Corona Extra
review: this is a good beer, after how I drink this beer I feel good, I don't feel a headache or drowsiness. This beer tastes soft and constantly carbonated

name: Corona Extra
review: It is a mystery that such a poor beer has become so popular in the world. Light beer with slightly bitter aftertaste. No real character or body. Disappointing to drink every time.

name: Corona Extra
review: Really nice beer on a hot day with the boys! Its got a summer feel to it and is very easy drinking! Wouldnt say its the best beer ever but it sure is a nice beer!

name: Corona Extra
review: I've been ejoying Corona for over 30 years 12 months a year. Sure, I will try a new beer here and there and some are not bad. I still end up finishing with an Ice cold Corona with or without a lemon or lime. Always seems to hit the spot!! If only my cat would let me get to the only one left in the 12 pack. I have her on video unwilling to let me take one. It's very funny! Have to go, all this talk about a cold Corona has made me thirsty!! Cheers

name: Corona Light
review: This beer taste like piss and shit, the only reason I gave it a 1.1 is because the Nelk boys send Coronas.

name: Corona Light
review: This tastes like tap water filtered through my grandmothers pantyhose. Lord it is not the best beer ever. No wonder people loaded up with lemons and limes. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

name: Corona Light
review: 355 ml clear bottle. Clear, straw colour, thick white head, medium low carbonation. Aroma of white bread and corn. Mouthfeel is thin, low carbonation. Tastes as the aroma. All in all you get what you expect, an adjunct light lager, brewed with corn syrup. Nothing wrong with it, it's just dull.

name: Corona Light
review: 4-4-3-1-7 Bottle, 3,9 ABV, 11 months before bbd. Finally I get to this timeless classic. All the way from a continent far, far away comes this watered down version of the otherwise brilliant, near perfection of tastelessness. Pours a beautiful crystal clear, pale yellow, with a creamy head. Some sharp, citrusy hoppiness in the aroma, with a flat, dull biscuity sense of malts, with notes of dry, Mexican hay. Light to medium body, with average carbonation. Flavour has a sharp, citrusy hoppy edge, and light biscuity malts with floral notes of honey, minerals and hay. It's almost kind of fresh and rather crisp, with a nice dryness. Yet, still there's a sweet finish of cardboard, garden compost as well as light metal and garbage that's no winner in my little book of beer preferences.

name: Corona Light
review: Blah. If you're going to drink a beer that has barely any substance there are better options than this. Looks like pee. Flavor was muted but it's what people want I guess.

name: Corona Light
review: Bottle, mexican piss golden color without much lasting head. Notes are piss, cereal, cracker, and the lime that the asshole barkeep put into it. Thin and trashy

name: Corona Light
review: Can from Arizona - clear pale golden, white head. actually better than I thought. not overly sweet. not much else going on here, of course. watery.

name: Modelo Negra
review: Wow, this is an amazing fluid. I can recall every time I drank Modelo Negra, and every time I had a great experience each time. This dark brew is not too strong, but not too weak with the alcohol percentage. Also, the taste is one of the gods, there is no way I could ever consider chugging this beautiful beverage, as it is too much quality for a beverage, and I just savor every swig. Finally, the presentation of the beverage is quite A1, as the golden top of the bottle that holds the cap is quite the scene. This drink all in all gets the blood flowing!

name: Modelo Negra
review: Medium dark reddish clear with an off white to cream colored head. The head dissipates rather quickly. I dont detect a lot of smell, some sulphur and a very light caramel sweetness. The taste is rather light, theres a slight sweetness and a little toasted malt note. It has a medium mouthfeel, the sweetness of the caramel malts lingers. Fortunately there is enough hop to give it a little bite so its not cloying. Its pretty complex for a mass produced Mexican beer. I like it, theres really nothing wrong with it. I will definitely have this again.

name: Modelo Negra
review: Cerveza de color cobrizo, ligero y de carbonatacin media. Aroma dbiles a malta y caramelo. En boca es ligeramente dulce con una sensacin de caramelo.

name: Pacifico Clara
review: Color amarillo claro, brillante, transparente. Espuma blanca de ms de un dedo de espesor y corta retencin. Aroma tenue a cereal, notas de limn y heno. Sabor plano a cereal, final corto sin apenas amargor, alcohol imperceptible, refrescante. Textura acuosa. Carbonatacin media media alta. Puntuacin baja por su inocuidad pero no presenta fallos evidentes y es refrescante.

name: Pacifico Clara
review: At don Taco. Pours clear medium yellow. Decent white head. Bready lager aroma, inoffensive. Similar bready taste, almost no hops, light inoffensive. Goes pretty well with Mexican food.

name: Rolling Rock Extra Pale
review: My go to beer. Better than any of the basic light beers, and cheaper too. Maybe not the best beer ever, but its 5 bucks a 6 pack.

name: Rolling Rock Extra Pale
review: 473ml can (TCrBF2018) (3:2:3:2:5=1.5) Just a messy watery corny pale lager, a bit nasty. Not as bad as some of the horrors at the fest but still pretty darn terrible.

name: Rolling Rock Extra Pale
review: zapach bardzo lekki, troch zielonej butelki, troch skrki z jabek, jaki kurz, woda spod warzyw i sody. wszystkiego trzeba si doszukiwa. kolor bardzo jasny, soty, somkowy, klarowny, piana biaa, rednio obfita i krtka. w smaku wytrawne, wodniste, bardzo lekkie zboowe nuty, odrobina kurzu i zielonej butelki, kukurydza. nie jest niedobre, ale nie ma smaku praktycznie. goryczka bardzo niska, kukurydziana i liciasta. w ustach gazowana woda. nasycenie wysokie.

name: Rolling Rock Extra Pale
review: Purs a pale yellow with a whte head the leaves lacing. The nose is slight cereal. Body is thin. Taste is sweet with slight hop bitterness in the aftertaste. 16 oz can

name: Rolling Rock Extra Pale
review: The flavor of the beer, however, is lacking. There is a quite a lot of residual sugar in Rolling Rock and virtually no hops bittering, only a hint at the end, so this beer is somehow both watery and cloying at the same time.

name: Rolling Rock Extra Pale
review: Ordinary lager beer. Slightly sweet malt and crisp, hop bitterness. Hop aftertaste.

name: Rolling Rock Extra Pale
review: Refreshing and affordable. Rolling Rock is what beer should be. Taste buds change throughout one's life. Currently, I'm a light lager guy. (When I was a young buck, my beers looked like used motor oil.) You can't go wrong with Rolling Rock. If you buy it can, I recommend pouring it in a glass.

name: Rolling Rock Extra Pale
review: Nothing much going on here. I would prefer something else than this one, for me a very boring beer.

name: Rolling Rock Extra Pale
review: Overall its solid some people might hate the DMS taste but I think its a lot more subtle than people say its mild and refreshing also maybe its just me it kinda taste like colt 45 just lighter that might sound awful to some but for me that sounds pretty good

name: Rolling Rock Extra Pale
review: Taste: crisp, thin mild hops character, slight citrus notes. Mild nose. Golden hue, clear, with tall white foamy head, not much lace. Medium /light body. Light like a boating beer.

name: Red Stripe
review: Enjoyed this beer. Nice lager. Better than most as actually has some flavour. Nice head on the pour. Recommended if looking for a crisp lager

name: Red Stripe
review: Color amarillo plido con tonos verdosos, transparente. Espuma blanca de ms de un dedo de espesor y corta retencin. Aroma escaso a cereal y notas ctricas. Sabor igual, con el dulzor un poco excesivo del maz, final corto y escasamente amargo, alcohol imperceptible. Textura acuosa. Carbonatacin media.

name: Red Stripe
review: Uit een flesje. Bleek geel, weinig schuim. Voor de dorst aardig, maar verder een gewoon waterig pilsje.

name: Red Stripe
review: A very smooth lager without a bitter aftertaste or strong smell upon opening. Pairs very well with most American fan food such as hot dogs, burgers, etc. This is a truly enjoyable lager to share with friends. Two Thumbs Up!

name: Red Stripe
review: Shitty beer done Jamaican-style. Just as corn-tasting and metallic as a terrible American lager, but with the added joy of a stubby bottle. Which, to be honest, is nice, since its stubbiness means you get .8 ounces less of this awful beer.

name: Red Stripe
review: Need to rerate as no notes taken. Enjoyed at Beach Hut pop up bar in North Berwick on draft.- rerated as sessioned in cans. Nice head retention and thoroughly enjoyed.

name: Red Stripe
review: A light brass colour, clear like glass. Looks and tastes really fresh. Funnily enough tastes a lot stronger than it is - every percentage of alcohol gets through. Close to no bitterness, but quite sour, not in a bad way though. Take your time with this one, the taste doesn't kick in right away - savour it. Heavily carbonated, more than I was prepared for. This is clearly a social beer, drink it with friends in the sunshine at a BBQ or party. It's everything you would expect from a Caribbean beer, so if that's your style, I recommend this one.

name: Red Stripe
review: Can. Found it on a train. I dont care. Green tinged, clear, pale gold. Decent foam of white. Nose has corn syrup and envelope glue. Taste is a little sweet. Barely any bitterness here. Mouthfeel is a bit greasy. Burp inducing carbonation. Some bitterness on the finish.

name: Red Stripe
review: Standard clear gold lager with a low butterscotch flavour. Easy to drink and better than your other budget lagers but nothing special.

name: Red Stripe
review: 330ml bottle brewed at 4.7% in the Netherlands. Bubbling head of average size, didn't last long. Generic lager aroma, and faint at that. Yellowy colour. Medium carbonation. Not much taste - a little breadiness, a little grassiness, none of which lingers at all. Not bad, but next to nothing here for someone who wants to get something out of their beer besides the ABV and the wetness. There's a reason the bottle says serve ice cold. As with several "nation's #1 beers", it would appear they win that position by ensuring they don't have enough taste to offend anyone's palate.

name: Dragon Stout
review: Gets you rather drunk rather quickly, leaves you with a bad head also but then again that's if your like me and drinks 15 bottles of the stuff on a weekend, my favourite drink right now

name: Dragon Stout
review: 9.6 oz bottle. Pours very black brown with a dense tan head. Sweet malt and coffee scents. Taste is sweet up front with a slight edge of bitterness with vanilla notes dominating. It ends up balancing well. Sticky mouthfeel. Not bad.

name: Dragon Stout
review: Sweet, dark with a ting on the front if the tongue. Thick syrupy finish. Lingering molasses. Overtones of a sugar high... headache coming. Its very sweet.

name: Dragon Stout
review: Had from 9.6 oz bottle. Smells of chocolate. Taste is sweet, moderately bitter from dark malt and some hops - average stout taste, nothing noteworthy. For an adjunct laden beer, fairly well done.

name: Dragon Stout
review: Bottle in Orange New Jersey. Aroma of mocha and dark fruit. Pours a dark brown. Minimal brown head. Flavors of mocha and dark chocolate. Very nice but less than 9 ounces is very odd. But a very yummy sweet stout.

name: Dragon Stout
review: Proefglas van 28,4cl-fles. U: Donkerbruin met een dunne beige schuimkraag. G: Amandelpit, maraschinokers, karamel en esters. S: Zoet. Karamel, amandel en esters. Droge afdronk. M: Weinig body en medium carbonatie.

name: Dragon Stout
review: Easily the best beer I bought in the mixer sixer from Blackbeard's Liquor in Cayman Islands. It has a nice moderate body that drinks smooth. Little head. Nice chocolate flavor with a little bit of bitterness. Good beer.

name: Dragon Stout
review: This is what happens when Budweiser and Guiness have a love child. Not horrible, but nothing special

name: Dragon Stout
review: Wasnt expecting much from a tropical stout. Was definitely too thin. Taste was ok.

name: Dragon Stout
review: Dark brown beer with medium beige head. Aroma is sweet syrup, malty, sugar. Taste is also quite sweet, sugar, malty, some alcohol. Creamy texture. Overall sweet creamy stout.

name: Rolling Rock Bock
review: Im sorry, I couldny even get the first mouthfull down. Tasted grain alcohol, like a malt liquor, been sick a couple of nights in a row, figgured it wasn;t worth it. Down the drain.

name: Rolling Rock Bock
review: THE BEST AMERICAN MADE BOCK!!! With the exception of most all other bocks. Okay, just trying it out for a new ad campaign. Did you know Arnold Palmer is from LAtrobe? More impressive than any comments on this than I could give.

name: Rolling Rock Bock
review: Now I know what the do with the stuff when they clean out the vats but did they have to filter it through a homeless person's clothes?

name: Rolling Rock Bock
review: There Is a first time and last time for everything and this is it...........

name: Bad Frog Golden-Amber Lager
review: Found from notes circa 2001 while cleaning the basement. This one was a golden color with aroma and taste notes of pale malt, hops, and mild fruit. I vividly recall all the hoopla surrounding the frogs obscene gesture.

name: Bad Frog Golden-Amber Lager
review: copper amber color, smells like cider. apparently this is retired, so maybe my bottle is just old. since this beer is retired, and the last rating is from 2002, im guessing its just an old bottle. mostly malty taste with some thin hints of bitterness at the end--better than most macrobrews but not great. ill admit to buying it for the label.

name: Bad Frog Golden-Amber Lager
review: Golden color with a smallish head. This was a typical contract brew with a "cute" label.

name: Bad Frog Golden-Amber Lager
review: Okay stuff, if just for the label. I drove by the HQ for a long time and there was one of their bars for a while downtown, but it didn't make it. I enjoyed it okay, and it is better than most megabrews, but considering it was made in Frankenmuth, I would have expected more.

name: Bad Frog Golden-Amber Lager
review: The label rocks. That's about it as I probably have overrated it. Can anyone tell me where I can get this stuff, especially the other brews they have? I haven't seen it in a long time. The only time I had it was at LSSU on a weekend.

name: Bad Frog Golden-Amber Lager
review: My deepest apologies to Emily, who deserves better, but this poem seems appropriate to a dreary beer: I'm Nobody! Who are you? Are you - Nobody - Too? Then there's a pair of us? Don't tell! they'd advertise - you know! How dreary - to be - Somebody! How public - like a Frog - To tell one's name - the livelong June - To an admiring Bog!

name: Bad Frog Golden-Amber Lager
review: Gets a whole bunch of points for having a cool label and specifically for sponsoring my RAGBRAI team (Team Frog) a few years back. Doesn't get much in terms of points for flavor, unfortunately.

name: Bad Frog Golden-Amber Lager
review: I bought this beer when they finally allowed it and its label into NYS. Wish they would have kept it out on quality grounds. Would have rated it even lower, but it is better than Bud or Rolling Rock (on the other hand it costs twice as much).

name: Bad Frog Golden-Amber Lager
review: If nothing else the label is cute. Average beer, fair malts and hops, a little weak for my taste, but still a clean and refreshing beer.

name: Bad Frog Bad Light
review: Typical light beer. Clear and thin. Not too bad for a microbrew. I had it when Bad Frog taverns still existed.

name: Bad Frog Bad Light
review: 12 oz. bottle. Im going by memory here. I originally drank this beer maybe 2 or 3 years ago. Fizzy, light yellow with virtually no head. No aroma to speak of. Unpleasant flavor (and Im being charitable). I still like the logo a lot and have a bottle of this crap sitting on my bar in the basement.

name: Bad Frog Bad Light
review: Even weaker and nastier than the original. How do they do it? Water with a funny taste and a pale color. Yay. I mean boo, hiss.

name: Bad Frog Bad Light
review: This beer would be great to drink if they sold it in this state.............

name: Bad Frog Micro-Malt
review: This was the only Bad Frog beer I could tolerate at the brew pub that was within walking distance of our house. Apparently most people felt the same way since the place closed down within a few months, even thought it had decent jumbalaya.

name: Bad Frog Micro-Malt
review: You know, this stuff actually has some character - it's the only Bad Frog that my bride, a friend of brown ales and stouts, will even look at after trying the sampler.

name: Bad Frog Rockin Raspberry Wheat
review: Had this beer when Bad Frog Taverns were still in existence. I found this beer not bad for a raspberry wheat It was smooth, a malty? finish

name: Bad Frog Rockin Raspberry Wheat
review: Has to be one of the most disgusting beers I have ever tried................

name: Bad Frog Bad Brown Brown Ale
review: Inconsistent, I had two and they were very different. Color was nice, foam okay. Flavor was good, but weak.

name: Bad Frog Bad Brown Brown Ale
review: Very little to distinguish it from any of their other beers. As a brown ale drinker, this has to be the weakest brown ale I have ever tried.

name: Bad Frog Bad Brown Brown Ale
review: There used to be a Bad Frog a block away from my house in Waterford, Mich. My saving grace was that the beer just wasn't very good, though this brown ale was the best of the lot. An interesting roasted flavor, just oddly textured and sometimes a bit off.

name: Bad Frog Lemon Lager
review: 12oz bottle (Old Notes)-Brewed by Evansville Brewing-Pours clear golden with a small white head. Aroma and taste of lemon. This light bodied brew is not bad and fills a need on a hot summer day.

name: Bad Frog Lemon Lager
review: If you like lemon brews I strongly suggest this. Very refreshing taste with a slight sour after taste. Not bad at all!

name: Bad Frog Lemon Lager
review: Overall pleasant taste. Great on a really hot day, the touch of lemon isn't a good match with some foods. The refreshing flavor stands well by itself.

name: Bavaria Pilsen (Brazil)
review: Can in Brazil - now (?) brewed by Heineken Brazil - beer is very watery and resembles more a soft drink than a beer. weird.

name: Bavaria Pilsen (Brazil)
review: How : can Appearance : clear light golden, small white head. Aroma : sweet corn and minerals. Palate : thin body, high carbonation.

name: Bavaria Pilsen (Brazil)
review: Updating old records. From bottle in shaker. Run of the mill euro type macrolager

name: Tremont Ale
review: Nice copper pour. Aroma is caramel malt. Taste is smoked malts. Better than expected. Rated 2/24/04

name: Tremont Ale
review: Maybe it is because I have been having a few really good brews recently but this was just really bland and boring. copper ale color with lots of lacing on pint glass. Some malt taste and a bit of soapiness. Bar wasnt very good so maybe they had dirty lines. in any case i wont be bothering with this again.

name: Tremont Ale
review: Bottled. An amber beer with a huge lazing orangey head. The aroma has notes of malt and straw as well as light notes of caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, and toffee, leading to a dry toffee finish. Nothing wrong - just boring.

name: Tremont Ale
review: Earthy and caramelly with some wildflower hints. More spicy than the others from this line. Not bad.

name: Tremont Ale
review: I have this vague memory of drinking Tremont Ale on tap at a place on Tremont Street in Boston. Back then I believe it may have been brewed locally and not by Shipyard but I could have my facts wrong with this. A more recent taste found it to be thinner and less impressive from what I remember.

name: Tremont Ale
review: 12 oz bottle, labeled as Tremont Patriot Pale Ale. Thanks LooseCannon! Lightly hazed amber with a thin white head that dissipates quickly. Lots of carbonation. Bready nose, mild malt, light earth. Mildly bitter earth flavors, mild nuttiness. Meh. Would be better if it wasnt so weak. Its like a BMC English...

name: Tremont Ale
review: Feb. 8, 2009; 12 oz. bottle sampled in an English pint glass. Odd that an English style is (now) marketed as "Patriot Pale Ale!" Overall, this is pretty true to the commercial description. The hops generate interest (even if they are a bit sharp), but the lack of substantial aroma and somewhat-watery taste left the brew off-kilter and slightly disappointing. Id rather have a Bass.

name: Tremont Ale
review: 12oz bottle, Labeled as Tremont Patriot Pale Ale. Pours clear copper with white head which does not last long. Aroma sweet and roasted malt. Taste malt and light hops with bitter finish.

name: Tremont Ale
review: Smells of sickly sweet malts with some sweet hop notes. Taste is similar to the smell, sweet malts, taste odd, sort of like its skunked, but maybe not. Not terrible, excellent for the price

name: Tremont Ale
review: Contract brewed by shipyard, so you know what to expect out of this one. Not exciting, basically tastes like a watered down Sam Adams with old hops and garbage malt. Its cheap.

name: Tremont Porter
review: This tasted like a decent porter, except for the carbonation. It was like soda, dude. The beer was so fizzy that i could barely make out any taste. I don't know if it's because I drank it unrefrigerated, the bottle was a little old, or what. If it wasn't for the excessive amount of carbonation, I think this would have been much better. I made the mistake of taking a big gulp to start, and my throat hurt so bad. It felt like i swallowed a golf ball. Yeeeeeeeowch!!!

name: Tremont Porter
review: Not much sediment for a bottle conditioned beer. A decent porter, but nothing to write home about.

name: Tremont Porter
review: Loads of dregs followed the pour (bottle conditioned). Big roasted and chocolate flavor with mild hoppy bite. I'm hoping the six I bought was old because there was a sick aftertaste.

name: Tremont Porter
review: Rich, creamy, bold, toasty, a top 10 porter in my book. Big roasty malt nose, and nice crisp hop dry finish. Quite robust, not a training beer.

name: Tremont Independence Day Summer Ale
review: Malt and grain aroma. Clear golden color with a medium white head. Light bitter beginning with a mild sweet finish.

name: Tremont Independence Day Summer Ale
review: looks like a macro (light orange and full of fizz). I dont notice any aroma at all? very light bodied. very little distinguishable taste on the tongue with some hops in the finish. more flavor than your typical macro, but really not a lot to this one.

name: Tremont Independence Day Summer Ale
review: Light amber pour in the glass. Aroma of honey wafting from the bottle. Taste is very light honey and hops. Rated 2/24/04

name: Tremont Independence Day Summer Ale
review: Im surprised they call this an ale since it tastes like the dredge from the bottom of a Bud Light Keg at a Friday Happy Hour, very disappointing

name: Tremont Independence Day Summer Ale
review: Pours gold with a white head. Smells of pilsner malt, some toasty hints, earthy. Tastes earthy and sweet with a crisp, grasy finish,

name: Tremont Independence Day Summer Ale
review: Clear yellow color, no head. Sweet, some grain, faint citrus. Overall pretty lame.

name: Tremont Independence Day Summer Ale
review: Pours a two finger white head that fades quickly leaving traces of lace. Crystal clear gold/amber color. Light carbonation and light bodied. No distinguishable nose. Flavor is weak just hints of caramel and hops, good lawn mower beer. $1.50 for a 12oz bottle from Beverage Warehouse Winooski, VT.

name: Tremont Independence Day Summer Ale
review: (2nd Shenandoah Throwdown, 12oz bottle, thanks Dickinsonbeer) Small white head atop ahzy light amber body. Aroma is medium sweet, spicy, some orange. Taste is medium sweet, orange, some lemon, strawberry. Light-medium body.

name: Tremont Independence Day Summer Ale
review: 12 oz bottle. Pours a deep gold light copper with a thin white head. Aroma is nutty, ligth crackery malts, and a fair amount of butter. More diacetyl in the flavor, toast, nuts, lightly grassy and herbal with a light caramel malt note and a mild fruitiness as it warms- slick with diacetyl in the end. One of the bigger diacetyl bombs from Shipyard.

name: Tremont Independence Day Summer Ale
review: Bottle. Pours a clear golden with a thin, white head. No lacing. Aroma of lemongrass, sweet pale malt, some strawberries, Fuggles hops. Taste is watery and doughy with some light fruity notes. Light, watery body. Neutral aftertaste. Very simple, unoffensive. But very lackluster.
